He would like to use his share of this loan to invest in his grocery store where he sells various products. He hopes that this loan will help him to have a bigger business.  

The other members of his group need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, various products, and cosmetology. 

Ambroise says that his main challenges are a lack of purchasers and too many persons who ask him for credit. He says that his principal goal is to have a little more money so as to get a bigger business with the help of god.

loans.use: to invest in various products he sells in his grocery store.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three school-going children. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years she has operated a food stall business selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanatumu dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel  es comerciante de bolsos, calzado, dulces y ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones que vende por minutos; su negocio lo inició cuando su hija se le ocurrió poner la venta de minutos a celulares y ella hace 4 años, al ingresar a la Universidad, lo dejó a Israel, a quien se le dificultaba trabajar en empresas, como antes lo había hecho,  porque su operación del corazón, le dificultó laborar en su antigua actividad. Hoy le adicionó  a esta clientela, dulces y  la oferta de bolsos y calzado,  apoyando a su esposa que ya vendía mercancía variada.  Su sueño es lograr más adelante tener un local confortable, para brindarle un ambiente especial a sus clientes, a los que aspira ofrecer todo tipo de mercancía que le soliciten. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar variedades de diseños en bolsos y calzado, además de tres nuevos planes de minutos para responder a la creciente clientela que diariamente llegan a su negocio y con esto sustenta el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Israel is a merchant of bags, footwear, and sweets and he also offers telecommunication services that he sells by the minute. His business started when his daughter had the idea of selling cell phone minutes and four years ago, upon entering the university, she left it to Israel.  However, for him it became more complicated to work in business as he had before, because of his operation on his heart, which made it difficult for him to work at his previous trade.  Now, he has added to this clientele, offering sweets, bags, and footwear, supporting his wife who already sold various merchandise.  His dream for the future is to attain a more comfortable location in order to offer a special environment to his customers.  For them, he hopes to have every type of merchandise that they request.   Currently, he is applying for his Kiva loan, first financing through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase a variety of designs in bags and footwear, in addition to three new calling plans in order to respond to the growing number of customers that arrive daily to his business and support the success of the investment.

loans.use: to purchase comprará variedades de diseños en bolsos, además de tres nuevos planes de minutos

loans.name: María Efigenia

texts.es: María Efigenia de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive con su padre e hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, es muy conocida en la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende productos de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio que ofrece María es único; Ella es una mujer entregada a su trabajo para ella cualquier cosa que valga la pena tener, merece que se trabaje por ella, es por eso que María trabaja duro por su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, condimentos, jabones etc. María Efigenia tiene esperanza que su duro trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Efigenia, 51 years old, lives with her father and son in her own house.  She owns a store where she sells basic consumption items.  She is well known in the area and has attracted many customers by selling good quality products at reasonable prices and providing service beyond comparison.  She is a person that is very dedicated to her work.  For her, anything that is worth having is worth working for, and that is why she works so hard in her business.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, condiments, soaps, etc.. Maria Efigenia hopes that her hard work will allow her to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, condiments, soaps, etc

loans.name: Guddi's Group

texts.en:
Guddi is married and her husband is a scrap dealer. He sells scrap to different factories and to other dealers. His rates are very fair due to which he has a good number of clients which earns him good profits. 

Guddi is the mother of 6 children; one of them works with his father while the others stay at home. She herself is a very good mother and housewife, performing her daily tasks very well. She is also very supportive and helps her husband financially by doing embroidery work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk quantity and earn more income by offering her clients more embroidery variety. 

She has been doing her business for the past 10 years and is very confident that an investment will help her improving her business better.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
At the age of 41, Reynaldo is still single. Being determined to help his parent even in just a simple way, Reynaldo runs a hog raising business. He started this business six years ago. He is happy that he maintains his business even though he faces financial problems in maintaining his pig feed.
Reynaldo doesn’t want to lose hope that he can continue his business. He will treat all obstacles in growing his business as individual challenges. He believes that he can continue his business and he will strive for the growth of his business. 
Reynaldo wants a loan of P20,000 to purchase hog feed. He wants the loan to have a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed

loans.name: Mercy Kathao

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at Kilindine in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of home products. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop.

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mrs. But is 48 years old and a responsible housewife who helps her husband earn an income by selling fresh fish in mobile places or in the village. She generates an income of approximately $3 per day. Mrs. But lives with her husband and 3 single children in the Ressuey Keo commune, a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. But would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to fix some parts of her house that need repairs. She will use the remaining funds to pay for farming. Mrs. But is very happy and appreciative of all lenders. She hopes that this loan will enable the fast growth of her farming business.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 61-years-old and married with 6 children. With 1 child in school, Adela works very hard to provide for them.

Adela runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Adela has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future Adela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children; 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and expand her business. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité "San Francisco"se originó a traves de promociones  que realizó una de las asesoras en la zona. Todas las integrantes son conocidas y vecinas del barrio, y se unieron con mucha esperanza de que por medio del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación puedan salir adelante.
La sra Fabriciana es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comestibles, como ser sándwich, croquetas, empanadas y demás. Gracias a que tiene muy buenas manos para la cocina tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compran de ella. Su meta es poder tener un local donde ofrecer los alimentos que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito, para la compra de carne, pollo, jamón, queso, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para hacer los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The San Francisco communal bank originated through promotions that the advisors made in the zone.  All of the members are neighbors who know each other.  They got together with a great deal of hope that they would be able to get ahead through the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women with the Fundación. 

Fabriciana is one of the members of the group.  She tells us that she sells all types of food like sandwiches, croquettes, empanadas, and others.  Thanks to the fact that she has a gift for cooking, she has good clientele who always buy from her.  Her goal is to be able to have a place where she can sell the food she makes.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, condiments, baked goods, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to make the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, condiments, baked goods, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a resident and a farmer in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya, where she lives with her family of three children, all doing their post-primary education. She is age 44 and has been farming for 20 years.

Susan has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds at 20,000 KES and build a bigger poultry housing unit for her growing number of birds (including the ones she has yet to acquire.) She adds that she wants to expand her poultry farming operation since she has enough knowledge to counter the inherent challenges, like bird diseases. She says her main aim is to grow the business well enough to ensure that her children are all schooled.

She says her challenge is seasonal fluctuations in market price.

loans.use: to build a poultry housing unit and buy more birds

loans.name: Ana Emilou

texts.en:
Ana Emilou is 24 years old and married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ana Emilou has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. Ana Emilou requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ana Emilou has been in this business for 6 years. Ana Emilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sunbul

texts.en:
Sunbul has been engaged in poultry-breeder for 8 years. She is hard worker, likes animals.
These animals recognize her in the far distance. As soon as these animals see her, they run to her, they follow her. 
You can see in the picture turkey cock, which looks to her as if understand , what she says. 
In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $300 and bought 100 chickens.
Now she needs a loan of $600 o buy 10 lambs.
She plans to start being busy with cattle breeding.

loans.use: To buy 10 lubs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Ms. Paulina E. has been running her business for 4 years. “My business is my only way of supporting my family. I am a single mother of two young children, and I am worried because my sales have gone down because my store lacks many items.” I am asking for $1,000.00 to stock my inventory and improve my sales.
Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Paulina E. tiene 4 años con su negocio “Mi negocio es la única manera que tengo de sostener a mi familia, soy mamá soltera de dos hijos menores de edad, estoy preocupada porque mis ventas han bajado un poco debido a que hay muchas cosas que me faltan". Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para surtir bien mi negocio y puedan aumentar mis ventas.

loans.use:
To invest in my business.

Invertir en mi negocio

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Married and a mother of five, Mrs A. Dopé was born in 1969 in Sakpove and lives presently in the village of Aklalou in the Lakes district. Since her husband is jobless, she is the only provider in the household with her small grocery business named DESIADE. The business profits are completely used up by the family's daily expenses and she cannot expand her offerings. To address increasing demand, she wants to buy various goods and items to satisfy her client's demands. She is requesting a $1000 loan to buy rice sacks, oil drums and cans wholesale, to resell them and meet her family's needs efficiently.

Translated fromFrench by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Mme A. Dopé est née en 1959 à Sakpové et vit actuellement dans le village d’Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Le mari étant désoeuvré, elle est la seule à supporter les charges de son ménage à travers son petit commerce d’alimentation générale nommée DESIADE. Le revenu tiré de ce commerce est absorbé par la consommation quotidienne du ménage, empêchant la croissance de l’étalage. Face à une demande de plus en plus forte, elle sent la nécessité de s’approvisionner en marchandises et divers afin de répondre à aux exigences de la clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile et des boites de conserve en gros et de les revendre en détail afin de dégager plus de bénéfices et de pouvoir faire face efficacement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying rice sacks, oil drums and cans wholesale and reselling them

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old has a photo shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new photo machine. He lives with his mother and father, both of them are not working. Also he wants to get married in the next couple of months and he wants to establish his own household. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income and enhance his life.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new photo machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty runs a small bar in Kayunga. She is a very experienced business person who first started her career by making a local beer called Malwa. But now, she hopes to expand her inventory of beer and beverages at her bar. In time, she hopes to expand her business further and then become a wholesaler within her trading center.

She has used loan services successfully since 1997 and has had no problem repaying them.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of beer and sodas

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is engaged in the selling of used clothes and African cotton print materials. Married with two children, he started his business eight years ago at a very small scale.  He started by selling palm oil and rice, and later on he included used clothes.  His last loan was invested in purchasing African cotton prints that he sells in the market in Kabala town of Sierra Leone.  Joseph’s wife assists him by selling the materials in the villages and on village market days.  The couple is determined to expand their business and build a family house in the future.  Joseph is therefore requesting a loan of $700 to meet his dream.

loans.use: Expand his inventory of African prints for sale

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en: I am Asiah B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married have two boys. My sons run a small business selling costume jewelry and ready-made garments. They now need a loan of $250 to invest in their business and increase their income.

loans.use: Increase inventory in jewelry and garment business

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen E. is 43 years old and married with four children. She lives in the town of Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 2004, she has helped support her family by selling food in the loan produce market. She has applied for a loan of $375 to buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cascada 7 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is 38 years old. Her business helps her support her 5 children. For the past 3 years she has raised and sold pigs from her home. People from the area and other nearby towns seek her and her pigs out in her home. With her loan she wants to buy more piglets and also improve the place where she keeps her animals. The other members of the group are Antonia G. M., Reyna G. M. and Guadalupe G. M., and they all raise pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ROSA TIENE 38 AÑOS, SU ACTIVIDAD LE AYUDA A MANTENER A SUS 5 HIJOS, ELLA EN CASA DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE PUERCOS, LA GENTE DE LA LOCALIDAD Y DE OTROS PUEBLOS CERCANOS LA BUSCAN EN SU CASA PARA LA VENTA DE SUS ANIMALISTOS COMO CARIÑOSAMENTE LE LLAMA A SUS PUERQUITOS, CON SU CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS ANIMALITOS PEQUEÑOS ASI COMO PODER COMPONER EL LUGAR DONDE MANTIENE A SUS ANIMALES, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, ANTONIA G. M., REYNA G. M. Y GUADALUPE G. M., SE DEDICAN LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS.

loans.use: Purchase more animals and enlarge the area in which they are raised

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en: Bachir lives and works in Beirut. He sells motorcycles and offers motorcycle maintenance. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1000 to buy merchandise and materials to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and material

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta D., age 51, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne in Ziguinchor for four and half years. She buys cloth and shoes in Ndiassane to resell them in Ziguinchor. With her income, she helps her husband take care of family-related needs, such as schooling the children. Binta want to build up her business. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Binta D., 51 ans, marié, mère de 03 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne à Ziguinchor depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle achète des tissus et des chaussures à Ndiassane pour les revendre à Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille comme la scolarité des enfants. Binta veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela started her business because of financial needs since her husband was unemployed and they decided to set up their own business. They have been getting ahead little by little. 2 years ago she started selling oils, lubricants and adhesives and cars because her husband used to spend a lot of time selling these products and thus was familiar with them.

She now needs a loan of US$350, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more oils and to increase their profits. With your support this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Mariela inició el negocio por necesidad economica ya que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y optaron por poner un negocio propio y han ido saliendo adelante poco a poco.Comenzó hace 2 años con la venta de aceites, lubricantes y adhitivos para los sutos, ya que su esposo se desempeñaba como vendedor de estos productos, por lo que conocia los productos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas aceites y poder obtener mejores ganancias. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela baji, wife of N. H., lives in a Kasur, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Shakeela baji is a housewife and is 3 years younger than her husband. She has a skill of making cots (baby cribs). She also makes cots on order. Her husband is an automotive electrician.

She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She is applying a loan for her husbandm who wants to buy tools related to his profession.

loans.use: To buy tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.en:
The community of Puca Cruz belongs to the Rosario District, province of Acombamba, department of Huancavelica. Puca Cruz is approximately 3800 meters (12,500 ft) above sea level, a community that is economically based principally on raising cattle and sheep, agriculture (mostly barley, wheat, oats and potatoes) and in some cases commercial cattle-raising in the fairs in the district capitals (Acombamba and Paucará). Puca Cruz is situated between Paucará and Acobamba and being the necessary pathway between the two cities, most of the people are engaged in trade activities.

Primitiva S. T. is a member of the village bank with a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($210 USD). She says: "My business is to buy and sell livestock such as sheep, cows and pigs that I bring to Paucará and the Acombamba fair. Furthermore I raise animals and cultivate oats, barley and potatoes in order to make 'chuño' (dried potato). In a few years I hope to allow my children to study and become professionals. Now they are in Huancayo studying in high school. With FINCA Perú I am going to save for my children´s future because I want to make them study and not only work on a farm. I also hope to increase my livestock. Now I am with FINCA Perú in order to learn how to save and work with more confidence, responsibility and to receive the training that they are going to give." María G. P. is working with a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($210 USD) and says the following: "I and my spouse work to buy and sell animals, principally cattle. I myself have a business where I buy and sell sheep and at times cattle. My dream is to enable my children to study in Huancayo or the Institute of Paucará. I have joined FINCA Perú to learn how to save because I have a relative that has joined a village bank and has told me it has been a very good experience. I am going to listen to FINCA´s training and at times celebrate the birthdays of fellow members and learn to practice human values."

loans.use: Commercial livestock raising

loans.name: Munaza's Group

texts.en:
Munaza baji is the wife of M. A. and the mother of four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Munaza baji's husband has a business in cable networking. The definition of cable networking is "he provides tv channels to the community through satellite". Munaza baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wire to expand her husband's cable networking business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Tanvir baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to resell. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Safia baji wants a loan to buy computer parts to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy leather for her leather business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cable wires for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Vai Kim Huoch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
NineteE. people in Tuol Ampil Village in Kampong Cham Province have formed a village bank, and Mrs. Vai K. H. is the village bank president.  They each plan to use the loan for different purposes.  For instance, Mrs. Vai K. H. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets while this business is going well.  Her husband, Mr. Ock Sothy, is a construction worker who makes $2, which not enough income to support his family.  Mrs. Vai K. H. is 22 years old and the mother of two childrE. who are both are too young to work or study because they are two years and five months old. 

One among the nineteE. members in this village bank has an end-of-term loan, and the rest have monthly payment loans.  This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca inició el negocio con la venta de calzado por catalogo y ahora esta vendiendo algo de abarrotes ya que labora en Tecnológico como maestra dando unas horas de clase solo por la tarde, las mañanas las tiene libres y es cuando atiende el negocio. Inicio aproximadamente hace un año vendiendo leche, pan, tortillas, aceite solo lo indispensable ahora poco a poco ha ido agregando mas productos para así tener mas clientela y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 500 que pagara en 6 meses para compra un enfriador para meter la venta de carnes frías, gelatinas, jugos y yogurt.
texts.en:
Blanca started a sales by catalogue business for shoes but she also runs a small convenience store. She also works at Tecnologico as a teacher giving a few hours of class in the afternoons. She has the mornings free and that's when she runs her businesses. She started selling milk, bread, tortillas, and cooking oil about one year ago but now she has been adding more and more products to her store. She has been gaining more clientele and she can offer a greater variety of products.

She requires a loan in the amount of $500 US, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be invested in the purchase of a refrigerator so that she can start selling meats, gelatin desserts, juices, and yogurt.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel, socia del BC El Abiseo, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 39 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y vive con sus 5 hijos que aún dependen de ella y son la razón para su lucha constante porque ella es quien vela por ellos . 

Se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas eviscerados en su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad. Sus clientes son las señoras que venden comida y los restaurantes de la zona. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y ello le ha permitido crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará pollos y gallinas en gran cantidad para luego sacrificarlos y venderlos en el mercado y repartirlos a sus clientes que le solicitan diariamente. 

Raquel manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres trabajadoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere poner otro negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos y sobre todo quiere ver profesionales a sus hijos.

El desembolso de su préstamo fue el  20/10/08
La tasa de interés  de su préstamo es del 3.5%
El monto de su cuota mensual es de S/. 605.00
texts.en:
Raquel, a member of BC El Abiseo, lives in the San Martin region, Mariscal Cáceres province, district Juanjuí. She is 39 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with her five children who still depend on her and are the reason for her constant struggle because she is their caretaker. She sells chickens and gutted chickens in the central market of the city. Her customers are the women who sell food and restaurants in the neighborhood. She has three years experience working in the community bank, and this has enabled her to grow her business. With this loan of S /. 3000, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy chickens in large quantities to later slaughter and sell them on the market and distribute to her customers who ask for them on a daily basis. Raquel declares that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as well as for other working women. She works hard every day because she wants to start another business selling clothes and shoes, and she especially wants to see her children as professionals. The loan disbursement was on 20/10/08 The interest rate on the loans is 3.5% The amount of the monthly fee is S /. 605.00

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens in large quantities

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 46 años, es casada, vive con sus hijos, los cuales son su adoración. Se dedica a la venta D. comestibles en su pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, optó por este negocio porque le permite trabajar desD. su casa y velar por el bienestar D. sus pequeños hijos. Las ventas son buenas, ya que es la única tienda en toda la cuadra, logrando tener muchos clientes. Lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que permanecer desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche aproximadamente, pero cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos, los cuales la apoyan cada vez que les es posible, ya que ellos estudian y esa es su labor fundamental. Inés se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado implementará mejor tiendita para colmar las necesidades D. su clientela y así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Inés is 46 years old and married. She lives with her children who are the light of her life. She dedicates herself to the sale of groceries from her little store, a business she chose because it allows her to work from home while caring for her children. Her sales are good because hers is the only store in the neighbourhood, giving her lots of clients. The hardest part of her work is that she must run the store from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, but she does get a lot of help from her children. They help out whenever they can, keeping in mind that their studies are the most important work they do. This will be Inés' first loan from Microfinanzas Prismas, and she will make her payments punctually. With the loan, she will increase the range of products that she offers at her store so that she may better fulfill the needs of her clients and thus, increase her revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Chhom's Group

texts.en:
There are three members that jointed this small loan, and Mrs. Chhom M. is the group leader. She is 39 years old and earns a living by selling different kinds of fruit in the local market. She started her business more than ten years ago and is currently earning around $4 a day. She has five children, all of whom are single; three are students and two are employed, while her husband is a local chef for wedding parties and ceremonies. M. plans to expand her business, thus now she decided to apply for a loan to purchase additional fruits to resell. 

The other two borrowers are:
Phon R. is 40 years old and is selling fruits for a profit. She needs a loan to buy more kinds of fruit for sale.
Sar S. is 29 years old and is selling electronic materials. She requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise. 

They all live in Odombang Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits for sale

loans.name: Melina Leania

texts.es:
MELINA LEANIA L. MUÑOZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ” ubicada en el Jr. Los Frutales Mz. F, Lt. 01 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 01 hijo, es Técnica en Enfermería con 30 años de edad, trabajó en la posta de salud de Nuevo Bolognesi, su esposo es Constructor Civil.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, y el bajo sueldo que recibía su esposo no alcanzaba para el sustento familiar, ella compró ropas, como shores, blusas, zapatos, vendía a sus amigos de la Posta de Salud, para entonces no trabajaba solo estudiaba.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, ahora ya es profesional, compró medicinas, estetoscopio, en su casa atiende como tópico por las tardes, compró más ropas, ahora ya tiene clientes seleccionados, solo trabaja con pedidos.

Muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por darle la mano en el momento que más ha necesitado.
texts.en:
MELINA LEANIA L. MUÑOZ, belongs to the Communal Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship) situated in the Nuevo Bolognesi Settlement in the Callería District of eastern Peru. She is 30 years old with one son. She works as a Medical Assistant at the Health Post in Nuevo Bolognesi. Her husband is a Civil Constructor but the low wages he was receiving were not sufficient to sustain the family. With her first loan of 300 New Sols she bought clothing such as shorts, blouses and shoes which she was selling to her friends at the Health Post. After that, she was only studying and not working. Now that she is a health professional, she will use part of this loan of 1200 New Sols to buy medicines and a stethoscope. She will also buy more clothing which she sells out of her home most afternoons. She now has a regular clientele and sells only to order. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for giving her a hand at the time when it was most needed.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar medicinas, estetocopios, para el tópico que tiene en su casa y tambien comprar ropa para venderlo a sus clientes seleccionados

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW member, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Eunice is 29 years old, married, and has four children who are all currently in school. She lives in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu. Eunice has a vegetable and fruit business; she sells from a stall in her neighborhood. A Form II school dropout (when she was about 15 years old), Eunice used to sell used clothing in Kibuye market in Kisumu. After giving birth to a child, Eunice returned to her space in the market to find that it had been taken over. She decided then, in 2002, to start a fruit and vegetable stand. There she sells tomatoes, sukuma wiki (kale), cabbage, and fruit.

Eunice has applied for a loan from K-MET of approximately $150 USD. She will use this money to purchase more vegetables and to add charcoal to her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and add charcoal to her inventory

loans.name: Ahmadiyya Primary School,magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the Ahmadiyya Primary School, Magburaka. It was built by the Ahmadiyya Mission to propagate the faith and provide education to the people of Magburaka. It has a total of sixteen staff members and 400 pupils.

Ahmadiyya Primary School makes good grades every academic year at the National Primary School Examination (BECE). The school has been able to send many pupils to secondary schools every year.

Since teachers usually receive very meager salaries, many teachers find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in businesses or agriculture, and others organize extra classes for the pupils (though that is a practice the government is trying to abolish). Teachers therefore seek a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects and then out of their salaries, they gradually repay the loan.

Abdul K. K. (middle – first row) is the Head Teacher of this school. He was born in Magburaka and is married with four children. Abdul will invest this loan in business.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Segunda Alejandrina,

texts.es:
El esposo de Alejandrina toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio de productos de limpieza (escobas, recogedores, plumeros, desinfectantes, detergentes, etc.).  Mientras ella atendía a sus hijos que aun eran pequeños cuando su esposo empezó, el se iba a vender los productos de limpieza. Primero empezaron vendiendo por unidad. Poco a poco se dieron cuenta que era mejor vender al por mayor. Así que luego de ahorrar un poco de dinero, iniciaron un negocio de venta de productos de limpieza al por mayor.

Hoy en día esta empresa ya tiene, por lo menos, veinte años. Alejandrina hace algún tiempo se integró al negocio, para ayudar a su esposo, quien decidió vender no sólo en Lima sino también y especialmente en provincias. Antes de ayudar a su esposo, Alejandrina estuvo unos cuatros años trabajando como servicio doméstico con el fin de cubrir los estudios de educación de una de sus hijas. 

Sus planes para más adelante es poder construir su casa con material noble.
texts.en:
Alejandrina’s husband has sold cleaning products (brooms, dustpans, dusters, disinfectants, detergents, etc.) all his life. Their children were still young when he started the business, so she stayed home while he went out and sold the merchandise. At first they sold individual products, but eventually they realised that it was better to sell wholesale. After saving a little money they started a wholesale cleaning products business.

Now the business is at least 20-years-old. Alejandrina started taking part in the business a while ago in order to help her husband, who decided to start selling not only in Lima, but also - and especially - in the provinces. Before helping her husband, Alejandrina worked in domestic service for four years to put one of her daughters through school.

Her future plans are to build a solid, durable home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is an entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. She sells groceries in the central city market. She is married and raising two kids.

Yuliya’s business is flourishing. This is due to the fact that she carries a wide assortment of merchandise that is always in demand, and she has loyal clients who often come to shop from her. Yuliya has been successfully running this business for six years and has about 21,000 Hrivnya in turnover capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,400 Hrivnya.

Consistent demand for her products, combined with Yuliya’s integrity, positive reputation, and good credit history, only add to the successful development of Yuliya’s venture. Today she is seeking a loan for 8,000 Hrivnya to re-stock her merchandise. She is hoping to generate additional income with new food products and increased sales.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory and to purchase new food products for sale.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar A. D. O. D. 52 años D. edad resiD. en San Luis Talpa junto a sus 3 hijos dos D. ellos estudiantes menores D. edad y el mayor el cual trabaja para pagar sus propios gastos el cual tiene 21 años D. edad. Pilar posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su propia casa, ella desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar los productos D. su tienda, ya que dicho negocio es la principal entrada económica que posee. Es por esto que ella desea surtir su tienda para obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales contribuyan a una mejor economía familiar.
texts.en:
Pilar A. D. O. is 52 years old, and lives in San Luis Talpa with her 3 children. Two of her children are young students, and her oldest child (21 years old) works in order to pay his own bills. Pilar has a perishable goods shop in her home. She desires to obtain a loan, with which she would be able to increase her store's inventory, as her shop provides her principal income. That is why she would like to improve her stock and earn more income, which would improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products for her shop

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Erika Ivania

texts.es: La joven y madre de familia Erika Ivania A. M. tiene 31 años de edad ya esta casada y solamente tiene un hijo menor de edad. Ella esta dedicada a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio su negocio con ventas al contado pero al hacer clientela empezó a vender al crédito lo que le permitió expandir sus horizontes comerciales, saliendo de vendedora  lugares como El Viejo, Corinto, El Realejo, Chichigalpa y Jiliquillo, pueblos de Chinandega, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 12 años vendiendo ropa usada. Los créditos que Fundación León 2000 le ha otorgado le han ayudado a comprar ropa nueva, pero esta vez ella desea invertir el crédito en capital de trabajo comprando cremas y perfumes y más ropa para prosperar más económicamente.
texts.en:
A young woman and the mother of a family, Erika Ivania A. M. is 31 years old, is already married, and only has a young son. She is in the sale of general merchandise. She started her business with cash sales, but to expand her clientele she started to sell on credit which has allowed her to expand her commercial horizons by selling in places such as El Viejo, Corinto, El Realejo, Chichigalpa, and Jiliquillo, towns in Chinandega. She has been in this business for 12 years selling used clothes.

The loans that Fundacion Leon 2000 has granted her have helped her to buy new clothes, but this time she would like to invest the loan in working capital purchasing lotions, perfumes, and more clothes in order to prosper more financially.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zina Bibi Ussene

texts.pt:
Zina Bibi nasceu na cidade de maputo é mulher de 35 anos de idade, frequntou escola ate 6 classe e por dificuldades financeiras dos seus progenitores não conseguiu continuar com os estudos para realizar o sonho se formar cedo no nível secundário.
Casada e mãe de três filhos, sendo a mais velha com 13 anos de idade que freqüenta escola com outro que lhe segue. Vive em campoane, zona periférica de boane juntamente com o seu marido e o seu irmão na sua responsabilidade.
Saiu de maputo no ano de 2001 com sua família porque viviam numa casa alugada e em campoane vive já numa casa própria que esta construindo com seu marido.

Não trabalha e o principal ingresso familiar tem sido o salário do marido que ganha 4.000,00MT por mês. Na foto aparece com o seu filho menor.
Nunca fez empréstimos com outros bancos e que este valor de 18.000,00MT vai aplicar no acabamento da casa onde habita propõe se a pagar sem dificuldades.
No futuro tenciona construir uma mercearia para aumentar a renda familiar, daí que com mais outros empréstimos logo que terminar de pagar o presente credito.
texts.en:
Zina Bibi, 35, married, was born in Maputo, Mozambique. Her dreams of graduating early from high school were interrupted when she was in 6th grade, due to her parents' financial difficulties. She is the mother of 3 kids, the two oldest being already in school (in the photo, she appears with her youngest). In 2001, she moved with her family from Maputo, where they had been renting, to Campoane, periphery of Boane, where they were able to buy a place, and where they have, since, gradually been building their house. Since Zina doesn't work, her husband supports their family (including Zina's brother, who lives with them) with a monthly salary of 4,000.00 MT. This is the first time she's applied for a loan, which she hopes to repay without difficulty. She will use the 18000,00 MT to finish her house, and when this loan is paid in full, she plans to apply for others, to start a grocery store and help improve the family's income.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Gladys Judith

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Judith es la secretaria del Banco Comunal Cochapamba en la comunidad de San Miguel Alto, ubicada aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Como secretaria, le toca anotar y leer todos los minutos de las reuniones del grupo y guardar los cuadernos del banco comunal. Gladys tiene 23 años y está casada, tiene un hijo de cinco años. Trabaja como empleada en una casa; ya lleva dos años trabajando así. Trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8am a 3:30pm. También tiene un negocio vendiendo ropa a sus amigos y familiares; compra la ropa en la Feria Libre de Cuenca y sus clientes le paguen en cuotas. 
Gladys está pidiendo este crédito para poder comprar más ropa de mujer, hombre y niño para poder satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes. 
Gladys es socia de la Fundación Espoir hace más que dos años, y dice que le gusta bastante. Ha usado gran parte de sus créditos para su negocio de ropa; también ha usado los créditos para la compra de materiales para terminar la construcción de su casa, donde vive actualmente con su esposo y su hijo. 
Su sueño para el futuro es poner su propia tienda de ropa en la comunidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Gladys Judith is the secretary of the Cochabamba communal bank in the community of San Miguel Alto, located approximately one half-hour from the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. As secretary, it is her responsibility to take and read the minutes of the group’s meetings and to keep them in the communal bank’s notebooks. Gladys is 23 years old, is married, and has one five year-old child. She works as a domestic servant; she has been working in this for two years. She works Monday through Friday, 8am to 3:30pm. She also has a business selling clothing to her friends and family members. She buys the clothing in the Open Market of Cuenca and her customers pay her in installments. Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for women, men, and children in order to satisfy the requests of her customers. Gladys has been a member of Fundación Espoir for more than two years, and she says she likes it a lot. She has used most of her loans to purchase clothing; she has also used some of her loans to buy materials to finish building her house, where she lives with her husband and her child. Her dream for the future is to open her own clothing store in the town where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men, and children to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Nyame Beko Agye Yen Group

texts.en: Martha is 42 years old, married and has one daughter. She makes a living selling cereals, and leads a trust bank group called "Nyame beko agye yen," which means "God will fight to vindicate us." She is in the center of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers, and work hard to support their  families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members of this group have been in business for a long time, and have amassed a great deal of experience. They are seeking a loan to help them buy more goods to sell and expand their businesses. It is the overriding desire of members of this group to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Deograsiana

texts.en:
Deograsiana is a member the of Faraja borrower group.  She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of 2 children.Her children are ages 19 and 13. She also cares for other 1 dependent. 

Deograsiana started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago; she works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings (about $150 US). This is Deograsiana`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania.  She requests the amount of 200,000 shillings in order to buy more clothes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Deograsiana hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a mother of two children working as a home-based clothes seller to cooperate with her husband on the household expenses and to be able to continue her children's schooling. Hayat is requesting to borrow $600 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore, her income.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred N. is a very resourceful person who is willing to take on any venture as long as she could earn an income to supplement her husband's salary as a laborer in a "hacienda" or sugarcane plantation. Mildred, 43, is married to Edgardo and they have six children. Their oldest son has already graduated from high school. Four of her children are still attending school and the youngest, who is just 5, is a preschooler. 

When Mildred realized that it was impossible for them to make ends meet with just her husband's salary, she racked her brain for ideas on what business ventures to go into.  She went into many business ventures like selling "Ginamos" or shrimp paste, opening a general store in their neighborhood and, when she was earning enough, she rented land which she turned into a vegetable farm. 

She sold her vegetable harvest in the local market and in the neighboring towns and soon vegetable buyers started going to her offering to buy her produce in bulk volumes. Her vegetable farm earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which she reinvests in the business, uses to pay for their household expenses and sets aside some savings for the education of her children. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was paid back in full without any delays or delinquencies. She plans to use her 13th loan of PHP 19,500 as additional working capital for her vegetable farm so that she could pay the landowner the rental fee for the land and for the education and security of her children.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farming business

loans.name: Sr. De Coyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal SR.D. COYLLORITY; pertenecen a la zona D. Muñapata en el distrito D. Quispicanchis en Urcos; nuestros socios son miembros trabajadores y muy alegres. Ubicados a 1 hora y 15 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con la agricultura, ellos producen diversas variedades D. maíz, papas, habas, tubérculos en toda sus variedades, hortalizas y otros, también se dedican al engorD. D. ganados para así venderlos en las ferias a mejor y mayor precio, ellos también crían animales menores como el cuy y aves D. corral, también chanchos para su venta;  nuestros socios también alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista, ellos tiene diferentes negocios entre los que encontramos la venta D. madera y palos,  los socios desean solicitar el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferente negocios y así seguir mejorando su calidad D. vida.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismos se comprometen en cumplir con la diferentes cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Rahinatu

texts.en: Rahinatu is twenty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to one girl, who is in school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially provide for the family. Rahinatu is a trader. She trades in jewels. She procures the goods from nearby communities and hawks to sell at the local market. Rahinatu has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to procure jewels in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best  education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy jewels in bulk

loans.name: Asinath

texts.en:
N. Asinath is a promising lady, twenty-eight years old, who owns a grocery shop located in Kabwohe trading centre and has lived and worked there for over five years. She is requesting the loan to invest more in her business, that is to say soap, Jik (disinfectant), toilet paper, and so forth for sale.

Asinath is married with three children and expects to provide the best for them. She is a happy and active businesswoman whose hope is to have a self-sufficient business.

loans.use: To purchase soap, Jik, toilet paper, and so forth to sell

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 36 years old and married with one school-age child. He runs a barber shop in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He describes himself as hardworking. He's been in this business for twenty years and also earns some income as a taxi driver.

Nicholas successfully completed a previous loan from Faulu for Kes 60,000. He requested this loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a haircutting machine.

loans.use: To buy a haircutting machine

loans.name: Elma

texts.es:
Elma M. es una mujer activa y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos (mayores de edad) y se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa de segundo uso. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que le permitieron invertir en prendas interiores de damas para luego ser vendidas. 
Ahora Elma necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para comprar joyas y ropas de segundo uso. 
La meta de Elma es tener una tienda de ropas de segundo uso en su casa.
texts.en:
Elma M., 41, is an active and cooperative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She's a single mother of two adult children. She sells jewelry and second-hand clothing. She has been a member of the "Del Futuro" communal bank for the last two years and her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy ladies underwear to sell. Now, Elma needs 1000 new soles to buy jewelry and second-hand clothing. Elma's goal is to have a used clothing store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Sarit

texts.en: Mrs. Sarit T. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 5-hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Toem Bros, owns a plowing machine which he hired to help with the rice farming. Now Mrs. Sarit T. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and pesticides. She will use the rest of loan to repair the plowing machine. She is 38-years-old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is grocer and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and repair the plow

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter works in the army while her husband works as a security guard in a secondary school. Her youngest, who is 8 years old, attends a local secondary school. Erdenechimeg operates a DVD rental and PC game service near her home. As she is the only owner of DVD rental and PC game service, her building is always very crowded and is a very profitable place to operate. Erdenechimeg started her business in 2005 by extending her house for her business. At first her working capital was 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD) which then reached 2,200,000 tugrugs (~1550 USD). Due to her successful location and increasing demand from her many customers, Erdenechimeg feels it is time to expand her business. In the near future, she hopes to buy an apartment for her family. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more supplies of DVDs and PC games for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of DVDs and PC games

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 29 year old single man.  He offers a money transfer service named Omega, using the M-Pesa cellphone-based system.  He has been in the business for one year and has one employee.  He earns extra income working at a hotel.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to finance his business.  He has requested Kes.40,000 to top up his business's M-Pesa cash float.  He hopes to open more businesses and create employment for many people. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: Add cash float to his money transfer business

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina V. is 37 and married with 4 children (ages 1 - 12).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Sina needs a loan of WST $2250 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sina V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel C. C. es una señora de 44 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Doña Rosibel se dedica a la ganadería de leche. Comenta que desde hace 3 años inició su proyecto y que poco a poco ha visto como su negocio crece día a día. Además dice que se siente muy orgullosa como microempresaria ya que se ha ido superando en muchas áreas de su vida tanto profesionalmente como personalmente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita doña Rosibel es un micro crédito de ¢656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones), para comprar una vaca más ya que así podrá  mejorar su negocio y hacerlo crecer más. Dice que gracias a esto podrá tener un mayor  ingreso y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Doña Rosibel es socia de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosibel C. C. is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in a community called San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrualba in the Cartago Province. It is a small rural community. Its inhabitants devote themselves to milk production, and the farmers mainly grow coffee and bananas. Raising pigs is also a common activity. It has an irregular terrain, and much of the land is maintained as tropical rain forest. Rosibel devotes herself to milk producing cows. She started this project three years ago. Little by little she has seen how her business grows day to day. She also says that she feels very proud as a small businesswoman. She has been improving in many areas of her life, professionally as well as personally. Rosibel is now requesting a loan for ¢656,000 (six hundred fifty six thousand colones) to buy one more cow. That way she will be able to improve her business and make it grow more. She says that thanks to this she will be able to have more income and give her family a better quality of life. Rosibel is a member of the Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, one of the 100 partner organizations with Edesa in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan. She plans on continuing to grow on a personal and economic level and participating in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
El señor Adelio M. de 52 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Basilia Leiva de 42 años de edad, ellos tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijas que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
   Don Adelio se dedica en este negocio aproximadamente  desde el año 2.000; el es heredero de unas hectáreas de tierra, que el cultivaba cada año, y con el ingreso compró un local o puesto de trabajo ( comedor),  donde toda la familia se dedica a la venta de comida, en la actualidad tiene una buena concurrencia de clientela por sus buenos servicios ofrecidos.
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar un local que se encuentra ubicada a lado mismo de su puesto de trabajo, con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de otros clientes.
texts.en:
Adelio M., 52, is married to Basilia Leiva, 42, and they have two daughters who are in high school. Since 2000, Adelio has been cultivating a few hectares of land that he inherited. With his earnings, he has purchased a food stand where the whole family works. They now attract a good number of customers because of the good service they offer. Adelio will use this loan to buy a space next to his food stand. In this way, he will be able to serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new location for food stand

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 60 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector Pampa La Aviación del distrito de Chóchope, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era muy joven, el posee un terreno propio de dos hectáreas en el que suele sembrar granos. Actualmente tiene instalado en ese terreno un cultivo de maíz desde hace quince dias. Con la cosecha de este producto el piensa obtener los recursos económicos para sacar a su familia adelante, por este motivo Alfonso pone todo su esfuerzo para sacarlo adelante.

Actualmente es tiempo de aplicarle fertilizantes y foliares a su cultivo para que este se desarrolle en las correctas condiciones que le permitan brindar una buena producción; por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo

Alfonso es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona conocida y respetada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 60, lives with his family in the Pampa La Aviación sector of Chóchope district, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since very young; he owns his own, two-hectare, field where he grows grains. He planted corn two weeks ago and hopes that the corn harvest will produce income to help the family get ahead. Alfonso, therefore, puts all his efforts into a successful harvest. This is the right time, then, to apply fertilizers and other nutrients to the crop so that it will develop under the right conditions for optimal production. He is, therefore, requesting a loan, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa. He needs 1500 new soles to reach his objective. Alfonso is a responsible father who is very dedicated to his family; his greatest wish is to provide them with a better quality of life. He is a known and respected person in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his corn crops.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda Isabel tiene 53 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, sus inicios se dan por no tenia los recursos suficientes para mantener a sus hijos, ya que por medio de la venta de plátanos lo obtuvo, pues todos los días se dedicaba a ofrecer un buen servicio. Por lo que está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como plátanos, repollo, papa, cebolla y ayote. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería muy grande.
texts.en:
Yolanda Isabel, age 53, sells fruits and vegetables. She has worked in this business for over 18 years. She started because she did not have enough resources to support her children. She got them by selling bananas. She works everyday offering good service. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material like bananas, cabbage, potatoes, onions, and squash. She dreams of having a very large mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTI”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia de cusco departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. LUZ ELENA,  ella tiene 48 años de edad, es casada  y vive en el distrito de san sebastian, Nuestra socia tiene 3 hijos menores y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tienenuna pequeña tienda y vende piñatas y accesorios para fiestas infantiles; Nuestra socia también vende productos de belleza por catálogos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para implementar su negocio de piñatería.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista casi el 70 % de los socios se dedican a la venta de celulares y prestar el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos celulares; un 20 % tiene sus tiendas de venta de muebles para el hogar y el restante vende libros y una socia tiene una botica y multiusos. Ellos solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus negocios.

Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “Inti” communal bank. She lives in the Anta district, in the Anta province, in the department of Cuzco. Our member is Luz Elena. She is 48 years old, married, and lives in the San Sebastián district. She has 3 young children and she alternates her domestic activities with retail. She has a small store and sells piñatas and accessories for children’s parties. She also sells beauty products from catalogs. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her piñata business. Our members alternate their different activities with retail. Almost 70% of the members sell cellular phones and rent cell phones for individual calls. 20% have businesses selling furniture for the home. The others sell books and one member has a general drug store. They are requesting loans to reinvest in their businesses. The member is grateful for and appreciates the support provided through this program and she promises to repay the loan in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her piñata business.

loans.name: Sam Art's Group

texts.en: The five members of this loan group live in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sam Art U. is the group leader, and was elected to this position by the other members, each of whom will use a portion of this loan for a different purpose. Mrs. U. makes a small income selling vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, and has applied for this loan to make that expansion possible. Her husband, Mr. Ravuth C., is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows vegetables. This couple does not currently have aN. children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Ayawo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a ouvert depuis 2007 sa propre boutique de vente de produits d’alimentation générale, son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients, il doit se réapprovisionner, c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 10 sacs de riz, 4 sacs de sucres, 8 cartons de tomates, 5 cartons de vin  et divers.
Il est père de famille et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman opened his own general food store in 2007. His current stock levels do not enable him to satisfy all his customers, which is why he needs to resupply and is requesting from Wages a loan to buy 10 bags of rice, 4 bags of sugar, 8 crates of tomatoes, 5 cartons of wine and various other items. He is a father and the business enables him to meet his family’s needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy general food products

loans.name: Milyene

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 38ans célibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 7ans.Commencee très jeune dans la vente de légumes et fruits ,elle excerce cette activité avec enthousiaste, car sa grande mère l'avait initiée à le faire.elle va s'approvisionner très tôt chaque matin dans les marchés ou les fruits viennent de l'interieur du pays.
ses clients sortent de différentes quartier, car son lieu d'activité est un caréfour.
Avec le prêt ,elle compte achéter une grande quantité de fruits de qualités, c'est pendant la saison sèche que les ventes sont meilleures.
ces ventes journalieres varient entre 25000f et 15000f.
Elle veut aider ses soeurs à faire comme elle et soutenir plutard sa fille  de 7ans à etudier dans les bonnes écoles de la ville.
texts.en:
This is a 38-year-old unmarried woman who has two children, varying in age from 2 to 7 years.  Having started at an early age in the selling of fruit and vegetables, she operates this business enthusiastically because her grandmother had introduced her to it.  She is going to stock up very early every morning at the markets, where the fruit arrives from the country's interior.  Her customers come from different districts because her place of business is a crossroad.  With this loan, she intends to buy a large quantity of quality fruit.  Sales are better during the dry season.  These daily sales vary from 15,000 to 24,000 francs.  She would like to help her sisters do as she does and to support her 7-year-old daughter later on with attending the right schools in the city. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit and vegetables in season

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith P. is 38 and married with four children.  She owns a business venture selling lava lavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Judith has one year of experience in this business.  Judith needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 90 talas or US $38 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Judith joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Judith's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii and Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment & tools

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Nelita P., from the town of Banga, is separated from her spouse and has five children. Despite the painful experience her family had, Nelita continues to work hard for her children, two of whom are still going to school. She dreams of seeing them graduate from college.

To make a living, Nelita owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been doing this for over 10 years, and when not raising pigs, she spends time selling dried fish in her community.

Nelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEV, she is now requesting a new one, her second, of 7000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Nelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is a small producer in the city of Istaravshan in Tajikistan. Together with his children they’ve been raising cattle for more than five years. These produce the income which allows him to feed his family. As well as caring for his livestock, he also cultivates an agricultural crop, wheat, which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. 

Nemat has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle shed

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina G. is currently in the business of selling sugar, tomatoes, onions and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fish, beans, maize flour and rice to sell.  Elina is 20 years old and is married; her husband is a student. She has 1 child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house which she would rent out.

loans.use: Stock fish, beans, maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Huamaní S.
