Santos vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad , su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en avenida Buenos Aires Ica ,El solicitante se dedica a brindar servicios de chofer de taxi por el cual alquila la unidad vehícular durante cinco años. El cliente presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito que ocupará para sus gastos personales y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Huamaní S. Santos lives with his wife and their 2 year old son. His home is located on Buenos Aires Ica Avenue. He works as a taxi driver with a vehicle he has been renting for 5 years. His clientele offer good personal and work references and for that reason he commits to pay back the loan he will use for personal expenditures and the improvement in his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: GASTOS PERSONALES

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Iglesia lo integran Darling Rodríguez C. de 35 años, Nestor José C., Gilma Estela Rodríguez y Maryen Griselda Guzmán H.. Darling, quien es la coordinadora del grupo decidió hace 3 años que debía ayudar a salir adelante a su familia y fue así como inició una pequeña fritanga los fines de semana, ella empezó con pocas cosas pues no tuvo ningún apoyo económico, sin embargo después de obtener el primer crédito su negocio empezó a tener una mayor vida y ahora además de las comidas vende verduras en su hogar.

Nestor es chofer de una caponera desde hace 3 años, Gilma vende comidas en los campos de beisbol cercanos a su hogar los días domingos y Maryen vende verduras y productos de la compañía AVON desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The members of "La Iglesia" ["The Church"] solidarity group are Darling Rodríguez C., who is 35 years old, Nestor José C., Gilma Estela Rodríguez, and Maryen Griselda Guzmán H.. Darling, who is the coordinator of the group, decided three years ago that she should help her family to get ahead. This is how she came to start a small business selling fried foods on the weekends. She started with very little because she didn't have any economic support, but after she received her first loan, her business started doing better. Now, along with foods, she sells vegetables from her house. Nestor has driven a motorcycle taxi for three years. Gilma sells food on Sundays at the baseball fields near her house. Maryen has sold vegetables and Avon brand products for two years.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock basic grains, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna G. is into the sale of bananas at Abura. She is married to a cleaner and they live together with her two children. She has been in this business for four years. She helps her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy additional fruit to sell. She has the plan of putting up a structure where she can display a variety of fruit for sale.

loans.use: buy additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela K. is 56 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. She is from the village of Magsaysay, a part of Baliangao municipality, Misamis Occidental province on the northern Mindanao islands. Manuela grows rice to sell. She has been in business for fifteen years and earns a monthly net income of 4000 PHP.

In 2003, Manuela joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC that was used for personal purposes. Manuela is requesting a new loan, her ninth from PMPC, of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil L. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old. Ramil is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ramil owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing watch repair services in the local community. Ramil has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Ramil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be Ramil's seventh loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Campo 1 Group

texts.es:
MUJERES DEL CAMPO 1 
Este grupo solidario está formado por doña Blanca Rosa L. de 50 años una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene una panadería, hace y vende el pan en su casa desde hace 7 años, solicita el credito para comprar arina para elavoracion de pan, tiene 3 hijos y está casada junto con su esposo han luchado para poder sacar adelante a su familia, también esta doña Vanessa Esther A. Monzón de 34 años con 2 hijos y casada, ella es dueña de una mini despensa y venta de ropa para niño y damas, desde hace 7 años , también esta doña María Tereza Z. A.  de 60 años, ella es la líder de este grupo,  quien es la dueña de un comedor en el mercado de San Raymundo desde hace 25 años, ella nos cuenta que gracias al apoyo que Fape le ha brindado, le ha ido muy bien en su negocio, espera que este fin de año le vaya mucho mejor que los anteriores ya que ahora tiene nuevos clientes y le piden más variedad de comida, entonces ella ahora solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar productos de comestibles y asi surtir mas su  tienda  y complacer a sus clientes, confía en Dios en que fape le brindara la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Mujeres del Campo 1

This solidarity group was set up by Mrs. Blanca Rosa L., 50 years of age, a very hardworking woman who owns a bakery. She has been making and baking bread in her house for 7 years, and is requesting a loan to buy flour for bread production. She has three children and is married. She and her husband have struggled to raise their family.

Mrs. Vanessa Esther A. Monzón is also a member. She is 34, married with two children. For the past seven years, she has been the owner of a mini grocery store where she also sells women and children’s clothing.

Another member is Mrs. Maria Tereza Z. A.. At 60, she is the leader of this group, having owned a diner in the San Raymundo market for the past 25 years. She tells us that thanks to the support provided by FAPE, she has done very well with her business. She expects this year-end will be more successful than the previous years, as she has new customers who are asking for a wider variety of preparations.

She is requesting this new loan to purchase food products so as to restock her diner and satisfy her customers.
She trusts in God that FAPE will bring her the help she needs.

loans.use: Buy food products and flour to make bread

loans.name: Fuerza Y Union Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.en:
This borrower group’s name translates to “Strength and Union Towards the Future” and represents the optimism they feel about their possibilities.  Lizet (in the red vest) is the group’s president and has been borrowing with this group for three years.

Lizet is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  She recently began selling cosmetics in a display case in her mother’s store.  Lizet orders the cosmetics from catalogues and tries to only sell the most popular products.  With this loan, she plans to increase her inventory for the busy holiday season.   

In the future, Lizet would like to run her own beauty supply store and perhaps even become a hair stylist.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mcharuko Group

texts.en:
Stephania K., who is in her early fifties, is married and has two children. Stephania has been running a small fish business for the past eight years. Open between 08:00 am and 08:00 pm daily, the business earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Stephania's fifth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania, her previous loans having been used to expand the business and make more capital available to buy additional fish when needed. These loans have all been repaid. With her fifth loan, Stephania aims to make improvements to her stall, which is not in very good condition at the moment. Stephania's dream is to one day build herself her own house.

Stephania will share this loan with her loan group Mcharuko. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Stephania is in front in a black dress.

loans.use: To make improvements to her fish stall.

loans.name: Mbalenhle Group

texts.en:
Nombulelo is the leader of her borrowing group and is standing in the center of the photo above. She is 42 years old and has six children, ages 5 to 18 years. Her husband works as a welder, and Nombulelo has been operating a corner store for four years in Hlabisa, South Africa.

She sells frozen products, cosmetics, refreshments and prepaid airtime for cell phones from her shop at her home. She hopes in the future to expand her shop into a big shop and to add more products. Currently she faces problems with competition and late payments from clients. 

Nombulelo has requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase airtime, frozen products, and chickens to increase her stock. She hopes that the extra income generated from this loan will help her to build a big house for her family and pay educational fees for her children.

She appreciates the opportunity that WDB and Kiva give her. She has seen the green light for her and her family's lives.

loans.use: To purchase airtime, frozen products and chickens

loans.name: Seydina Mouhamad Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SEYDINA MOUHAMAD est né le 14 décembre 2008. Toutes le femmes qui composent le groupe sont du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA

Madame MBARK. F. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. 

Elle de l'embouche bovine. Elle achète des sujets frêles qu'elle engraisse pour revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois
Parallèlement elle fait du petit commerce

Avec son prêt elle va renforcer ses activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Seydina Mouhamad solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of women who are all from the same area, and who came together as neighbors and through ties of kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois KEUR SERIGNE BARRA.

Mrs. MBARK. F., standing on the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are still in her care.

Her activity is cattle fattening. She buys frail animals, which she fattens and resells after four to five months. As a sideline, she is also engaged in small trade.

With her loan, she will strengthen her business in order to increase her profits. Her goal is to assist her husband in providing for their family.

loans.use: To buy oxen

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P., 54 years old, is married and lives in Tuyabang Proper, Oroqueita City, Misamis Occidental. She has three children. Rebecca has sold ornamental flowers for ten years. She sells her flowers on the street in Ozamis City.

Rebecca joined Paglaum Multi-purpose Co-operative to access funds for her business. She has successfully repaid all her previous loan obligations and today, she applies for 8,000 PHP for additional working capital. 

Rebecca's dream is to own a little parcel of land for her ornamental flower plantation.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail business for one year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She hopes to sell as a wholesaler in the future.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase five bundles of maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase five bundles of maize flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Milagritos

texts.es: Milagritos, de 26 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 30 años, fabricante de calzado; y sus 2 hijos pequeños; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Hace más de 4 años esta empeñosa dama se dedica a la producción y comercialización de calzados y sandalias. Manifiesta que cuando era joven ayudaba a sus tíos en el taller de fabricación de zapatos  que esta ubicado en una pieza de su casa, y luego cuando formó su familia no dudo en empezar a vender los zapatos (de acuerdo a la temporada)  en un mercado mayorista de su zona. Ella fabrica una vez a la semana y durante los 5 días útiles restantes vende,  además dice que su mercadería sale constantemente y por eso necesita capital con regular frecuencia; es por esta razón que solicita el crédito que le permitirá comprar materiales para producir al lado de sus familiares mayor cantidad de materiales para calzados y sandalias. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado en un mercado de su zona. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar con el progreso de su negocio. Milagritos tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita para la fabricación de todo tipo de calzado, pues necesita abastecerse para la campaña escolar que esta próxima.
texts.en: 26 year old Milagritos lives in her own home along with her 30 year old husband, José, a shoe maker, and their 2 small children. Together they strive daily to move ahead in life. For more than 4 years, this earnest woman has been engaged in making and selling shoes and sandals. When she was young she used to help her uncles in a shoe-making workshop that is located on one floor of her house, and later, when she had her own family, she didn't hesitate to start selling shoes (according to the season) in the major market in the area. She makes shoes one day a week and during the remaining 5 working days she sells them. She says that her merchandise sells-out constantly and so she frequently needs capital. This is why she is requesting a loan that will enable her to buy materials to make, along with her family, a greater quantity of shoes and sandals. As she is an enterprising woman, for the future she plans to start a store selling clothes and shoes in the neighborhood market. This is the second loan that she has had from MFP and she promises to make the repayments punctually as she doesn't want to be seen in a bad light by the people who are making this contribution that will enable her to keep building her business. Milagritos plans to use the loan to buy the materials to make all types of shoes, and she also needs supplies for the upcoming school year.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 64 years old and married with nine children. The oldest child is 47 years old. 

Florita is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to the community. Florita currently earns approximately 3500 PHP per month. She works hard to improve this income.

This loan will be used to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Florita hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de  quezalguaque y tiene un año de vivir del empalme quezalguaque 2000 varas al sur  es un profesor licenciado en biología y imparte clase en el colegio de Cristo Rey en el cual tiene 5 años de dar clase en esta localidad y solicita para reparar una motocicleta la que utiliza como medio de transporte para poder viajar diario ya que es un lugar donde es escaso el medio de transporte y para estar diario en su nucleo familiar necesita tener bueno ese medio y el es casado con 2 hijos con los cual él quiere estar en su hogar diario para apollarlos en sus estudio, los que estudian en el colegio de la comunidad, es un profesor luchador, su familia son productores agropecuarios de la comarca la estación quezalguaque, y el también esta efectundo inversiones en ganado, para buscar mejores niveles de vida.
texts.en: This client is originally from Quezalguaque and has lived for a year in Empalme Quezalguaque, 2,000 blocks south. He is a licensed biology professor, and he teaches classes at the Cristo Rey boarding school, where he has worked for five years. He is requesting a loan to repair a motorcycle that he uses as his daily means of transport because transportation is limited in this place, and in order to be with his family every day he needs to have a working vehicle. He is married with two children, and he wants to be home with them to help them with their homework. They go to school in town. He is a hardworking professor. His family are local farmers in Quezalguaque, and they are saving their money so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and purchase a stove with four burners

loans.name: Anallely Enriqueta

texts.es: Anallely tiene 24 años y estudio hasta tercer año de secundaria y comenta que no continuo con sus estudios porque sus papás no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirla apoyando con los gastos de la escuela. Doña Anallely está casada con el señor Francisco; ellos tienen dos hijas una de 5 años la cual estudia el preescolar y una de 7 meses. La señora Anallely esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para invertir en zapatos por catalogo y ropa para tener en existencia y sus clientas se animen a comprar sus productos por que ella dice “de la vista nace el amor por eso quiero que vean los productos y tener en existencia”. Ella tiene con este tipo de negocio aproximadamente 3 años, dice que decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijas y para pagar una casa que compraron de interés social. La meta que tiene es hacer un local en su casa para ella estar mas al pendiente de sus pequeñas hijas ella quisiera poner una fonda donde venda comida o una papelería ya que cerca de su casa no lo hay.
texts.en:
Anallely, 24, studied until her third year of secondary school, and says that she did not continue her studies because her parents did not have enough money to continue paying her school expenses. Doña Anallely is married to Sr. Francisco, and they have two daughters. One is 5 and in preschool, and the other is 7 months old. 

Anallely is asking for a loan to invest in shoes and clothing from catalogs so she can have them in hand and her clients will get excited about buying her merchandise. She says, "If they see it, they love it. That's why I want them to see the products and have them in hand." 

She has been doing this sort of business for about 3 years. She says she decided to start the business in order to help her husband with her daughters' expenses, and to pay for a house that they bought from public housing. Her goal is to have an area in her house where she can watch her little girls. She would like to put in a small eatery where she can sell food or a stationary store since there isn't one near her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes from catalogs to sell

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phirum C. (pictured here) is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Sarat Pech is 32 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh approximately twenty-five kilometers outside of the city. They have been married since 1999 and have three children-two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 

Phirum is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 34 years old, married and has five children.

Hanaa has been a tailor since 2007. She makes and repairs women, men and children’s clothing. She has good experience, a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting $2,500 to buy a sewing machine and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profit so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 58 years old with one child. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  
 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labor as he will employ one person to help him with preparing and planting.

In the future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Monte Verde está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Una de ellas es la señora Juana Mercedes quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya desde hace más de 2 años. Ella con el préstamo comprara cosechas de perecederos de temporada. 
Los otros integrantes son Lizett Marbelly y Rogelio José se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en: The group, Monte Verde, is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people. One of them is Juana Mercedes who has been dedicated to the sale of fruit and vegetables in the municipal market of the city of Masaya for more than two years. With the loan, she will buy perishable seasonal crops. The other members are Lizett Marbelly and Rogelio Jose who are dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal perishables.

loans.name: Josue Abinadab

texts.es:
Josue, es un agricultor, está casado tiene 3 hijos de 12, 15 y 18 años de edad, a través del cultivo ha logrado dar a su familia la alimentación y una vida digna, lleva muchos años siendo agricultor sembrando maíz y frijol.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono e insecticidas, para el cultivo de maíz, con estos materiales podrá dar un sano cuido al cultivo.
Su aspiración es que a través del cultivo de maíz, su familia pueda estar más segura económicamente, apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y ante cualquier circunstancia.
texts.en:
Josue is a farmer, he is married with 3 children aged 12, 15 and 18.   Through his farming, he has fed his family and given them a decent life.  He has been growing corn and beans for many years.

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and pesticides for farming corn.  These materials can provide healthy care for a crop.

His hope is that through the farming of corn, his family can be more secure financially, and he can support his children in their education and in any other situations.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides for farming corn.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer from Kisii town, South Rift, Kenya. She is age 38 and married with three children, two of whom are still going to school. She has been farming for 20 years producing vegetables, beans, coffee and tea which all go to the local market. She runs a grocery retail shop in the local market to supplement her farming income.

Josephine has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She say the dairy cow will enable her to meet her family's basic needs like food and further income will go towards educating her children. She is focused on venturing into a transport business by buying a motorcycle as well as expanding her cereals shop.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.ru:
Степан женат и у него трое сыновей. Степан живет с семьей в родном городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Клиент занимается проведением отопления в домах и установкой отопительного оборудования. Он – отличный мастер, поэтому у него всегда нет отбоя от заказов. Степан занимается этим делом уже 12 лет. Ежемесячный доход около 8.000 гривен. 

Степан хотел бы вложить 8.000 гривен в приобретение новых инструментов, необходимых ему для ежедневной работы по установке отопительного оборудования. Степан собирается приобрести более мощный отбойный молоток и новый паяльник для меди. Приобретение этих инструментов ускорит и облегчит работу Степана. Со временем Степан планирует нанять несколько сотрудников и планомерно расширять свой бизнес и дальше.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Stepan is married and has three sons. Stepan lives with his family in his hometown of Hust, Western Ukraine. The client heats homes, installing heating equipment. He is a skilled craftsman, so he always has jobs. Stepan has been doing this work for twelve years. His monthly income is about 8,000 hryvnias. 

Stepan would like to invest 8,000 hryvnias in buying new tools he needs for his daily work of installing heating equipment. Stepan is going to buy a more powerful hammer drill and a new soldering iron for copper. The acquisition of these tools will accelerate and facilitate Stepan's work. Over time, Stepan plans to hire more staff members and plans to expand his business further.

loans.use: to buy a more powerful hammer drill and a new soldering iron for copper.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La joven Érika vive en un pueblo bonito de clima templado donde hay mucha vegetacion y arboles frutales, ella tiene 20 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria, ella es casada su esposo es campesino, ellos tienen un hijo varón de año y medio de edad, ella va a iniciar su negocio de siembra y venta de plantas de aguacate, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar plantas de aguacate y surtir su negocio, su suegra y su esposo le van a enseñar a cultivar las plantas de aguacate, este negocio es importante para ella porque va a tener trabajo y dinero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, las ganancias del negocio las pieza utilizar una parte para la comida y otra parte para invertir en bolsas y huesos de aguacate para sembrar y crezca su producción de plantas de aguacate, sus sueños y esperanza son seguir vendiendo plantas de aguacate, que se dé bien la producción de las plantas y que su pequeño hijo este bien de salud y siga creciendo. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos nos ayuda a tener nuestro propio negocio".
texts.en: Young Érika lives in a pretty town of temperate climate where there is much vegetation and many fruit trees. She is 20 years old and studied until the 6th grade. She is married and her husband is a peasant. They have a boy who is one and a half years old. She is going to start her business of cultivating and selling avocado plants. She is requesting this loan to buy avocado plants and supply her business. Her mother-in-law and husband are going to teach her to cultivate the avocado plants. This business is important for her, because she will have work and money to help her husband with the household expenses. She plans to use part of the profits from the business for food and invest the other part in bags and avocado pits to sow and grow her avocado plant production. Her hopes and dreams are to continue selling avocado plants, that her plant production goes well and that her son is healthy and continues growing. She wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thank you very much for the loans that help us to have our own business.”

loans.use: to buy avocado plants.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Fabiana  es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora  a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo solicitado fue por la suma  de   S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales en bordados de diferentes paisajes culturales y chompas, la señora comprará ocho kilos de lanas de diferentes colores para sus bordados y entregar su pedido a sus clientes. 
Su sueño es tener una casa, un carro para su uso personal y mejorar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la ganancia del mismo.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member of the "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli" Communal Bank, located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 30, and a single mother of 2 children. She has an elementary education.

Fabiana is a new member who has recently joined up to work with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her requested loan is for the sum of 500 nuevo soles. She will invest this money in her business, which is selling handicrafts: embroidery of different cultural landscapes, and sweaters. She will purchase eight kilos of wool of different colours for her embroidery, and fill her customers' order.

Her dream is to have a house, a car for her personal use, and to improve her business.

What she likes about the communal bank are the savings and the earnings from the savings.

loans.use: to purchase eight kilos of different-coloured wool

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela de 31 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de Ropa y Zapatos, lleva 7 años en este negocio. Inicio a los 20 años de edad con una pequeña pulpería luego comenzó a trabajar con créditos y gracias a eso pudo vender ropa y zapatos en su casa, después siguió surtiendo su venta de pulpería y venta de ropa. Actualmente tiene 2 local en el mercado, para eso lucho muy duro convirtiéndose este negocio en su fuente de ingresos.  
Requiere el préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería de ropa y zapatos, productos variados de uso cotidiano. Esta inversión será de gran ayuda pues siente que le ayudara a mejorar la diversidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella piensa lograr diversificarse como comerciante, quiere tener una cadena de tiendas de ropa y zapatos dentro del mercado de Granada.
texts.en:
31-year-old Ángela is a single mother with three children who lives in the city of Granada.  She is a saleswoman and sells clothes and shoes.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She started out at the age of 20 with a small grocery store.  She started working with loans and, as a result, was also able to start selling clothes and shoes from her home.  She continued stocking her grocery store and also sold clothes.  She currently has two stalls in the market and has worked very hard to turn this business into her source of income.

Ángela needs this loan to buy new merchandise.  She will buy clothes, shoes and a variety of essential household products.  This investment will help her a lot as she feels that it will help her to improve the range of products that she has to offer her customers.  She plans to diversify as a saleswoman and would like to own a chain of clothes and shoe stores in Granada market.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise (clothes, shoes and a variety of essential household products)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica nació en la provincia de La Convención en la ciudad de Quillabamba por la selva del Perú. Actualmente, Veronica tiene 35 años de edad y tiene un hijo (Luis de 14 años de edad). 

Veronica radica desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en uno de los colegios particulares de la ciudad de Calca, ella en sus horas libres se dedica  a  la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catalogo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza. Su sueño de Veronica es abrir un centro educativo inicial.  

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Veronica was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, which is in the Peruvian jungle. She is 35 years old and has a 14-year-old son named Luis.

Veronica moved to the city of Calca at the age of 20 and this is where she conducts all of her business activities. She works at one of the private schools in the city of Calca. During her free time, Veronica sells beauty products through catalogs. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more beauty products. Her dream is to open a preschool.

The Communal Bank “Milenium III” meets every 30 days in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco in Peru. Cusco is recognized for being an area for tourism and business. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is 36 years old and a married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. Jenty has a business selling beer in hai mahad branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Jenty has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more beer for sale. She says that the profits from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es: Meliza tiene 23 años. Hace 8 años se casó con Willy, el padre de su único hijo de 8 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus suegros. Ella se dedica principalmente a labores del campo, específicamente a la siembra de productos como: papaya, café, maíz, kión y plátanos en terrenos de su propiedad. Hace 2 años abrió una pequeña bodega en el hogar donde vive, de esa manera genera más ingresos para su familia. Con su esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus suegros a podido mantener a su hijo; ya que su esposo se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima dedicándose a la música, por tal motivo no la visita con frecuencia. Meliza comenta que, la venta del café y maíz son rentables y tiene mucha demanda en la ciudad de Pichanaki. La falta de capital hizo que no pueda sembrar sus productos en cantidades que ella deseaba, por lo que anhela ampliar sus cosechas en las parcelas de sus suegros y con suerte al próximo año construirá su casa y ampliará su negocio. Es la primera vez que Meliza obtiene un préstamo de MFP, por esa razón tiene muchas expectativas en el trabajo con su banco comunal en donde se siente muy cómoda y entusiasta. Con el financiamiento que espera obtener, ella comprará semillas de café y kión; así como invertir en la mano de obra que requieren los cultivos que, según comenta Meliza, cuesta de 20 a 25 soles al día por peón.
texts.en:
Meliza is 23 years old. Eight years ago she married Willy, the father of her only child, an 8-year-old son. She lives at her in-law's house.
She does mainly rural work, specifically sowing produce such as papayas, coffee, corn, ginger and plantains in the land she owns. Two years ago she opened a small grocery store at home in order to get more income for her family. With her own efforts, as well as her in-law's help, she has been able to support her son. Her husband is in the city of Lima working in music and for that reason he doesn't visit often.
Meliza reports that coffee and corn sales are profitable and there is much demand for it in the town of Pichanaki. For lack of working capital, she can't sow her produce in the quantities she would like to. That's why she wishes to expand her harvests in her in-law's plot. With luck, next year she will build her house and expand her business.
This is the first time she receives a loan from MFP. For that reason she has great expectations for her work with the communal bank, in which she feels very comfortable and enthusiastic. With the loan she hopes to get, she will purchase coffee and ginger seeds. She will also use it to hire labor which is needed for farming. Meliza says that each rural worker costs 20 to 25 soles a day.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and ginger seeds and to hire rural workers.

loans.name: Munhotgon

texts.en: Munhotgon is 30 years old and lives with her two sisters, two brothers and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber, Mongolia. One of her sisters is disabled, her two brothers are herders, her other sister stays at home and watches over Munhotgon's daughter and her elder daughter is a school student. She is single and the only provider for the family. Munhotgon sells food and drinks in the train station for a living. She lacks kitchen appliances and raw materials. She is requesting 450,000 MNT to buy kitchen appliances and meat to make food.

loans.use: to buy kitchen appliances and meat.

loans.name: Mupakasya

texts.en: Mupakasya needs another loan to buy clothes to sell. He used to sell groundnuts but after acquiring enough profits he diversified his business and also started selling clothes to increase his income sources. His challenge is the seasonal nature of the business and his dream is to open a boutique in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 32 years old, married and a father of four children who are in school.  He has been in business for four years and has employed two people. 

He runs a grocery business to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business because he has been able to access financial resources easily.

Martin has requested for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy milk.

loans.use: to buy milk for his business.

loans.name: Tida

texts.fr:
Tida âgée de trente trois (33) ans est célibataire, habite dans un département de la région sud du sénégal; elle a un enfant âgé d'un (1) an. Elle est commerçante depuis cinq (5) ans. Tida place ses articles sur une table, car manquant de moyen pour s'offir une cantine. Elle vend diverses articles comme des bracelets, des boucles d'oreilles, des perles...

Avec son commerce, Tida parvient à sastifaire ses besoins. Elle a choisis ce metier car à l'école ça n'allait pour elle et espère avoir dans l'avenir une cantine pour développer son activité et rêve d'avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Tida is thirty-three years old. She is single, lives in a department of the southern region of Senegal, and has a one-year-old child.

She has been a retail merchant for five years. She displays her products on a table, as she lacks the funding to acquire a stall. She sells various items such as bracelets, earrings, beads,...

Tida manages to meet her needs through her business activity. She chose this occupation because going to school didn't agree with her. She hopes to acquire a canteen in the future to develop her business, and she dreams of having her own home.

loans.use: reinforce her business assets

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg, age 37, runs a clothing retail business at a local market in Ulaanbaatar. She has three years of work experience in the hospitality industry; however, she decided to start her own business in 2005 and has made much progress since then. 

Tserenchimeg usually sells women’s clothing imported from China, and this loan will help her to increase her product variety. She and her husband have two small children, ages 3 and 4. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Tserenchimeg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to import more clothes for the winter, a very high shopping season. She is planning to expand her business by increasing her product variety, which she is confident will help her business’s sales to increase.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the winter shopping season

loans.name: Fuerza Corazón De Lampa Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Fuerza Corazón de Lampa” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros relacionados con el comercio, ellos trabajan en diferentes ferias libres. Y Todos ellos pertenecen a la comuna de Colina.
Irma presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, usando una polera con rayas horizontales de colores rojo, blanco y Calipso. Se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo específicamente frutas y verduras en distintas ferias libres de su comuna, además ella comercializa artesanías del pueblo de Pomaire. 
Se inicia en el negocio desde joven ya que la mayoría de su familia es comerciante. Tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras que trabaja en conjunto a su marido y su puesto de artesanías en greda, las que adquiere a un artesano fabricante de Pomaire. Trabaja de martes a domingo en tres ferias distintas y pronto espera integrarse a una cuarta feria ubicada en el centro de la comuna.   Además durante esta temporada participa en la feria navideña de su comuna la que funciona en un horario vespertino.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, de tal forma de abastecerse de artesanías para la época de navidad, vendiendo principalmente pesebres con la Sagrada Familia.
Sus metas en su negocio, son consolidarse como comerciante y poder trabajar de manera independiente y más formalizada en un local establecido.
Irma vive junto a su marido,  su suegra y su pequeña hija Daniela de tan solo tres años de edad, quien la motiva para salir adelante.
Su mayor sueño dice relación con la adquisición de su vivienda, ya que esto le permitiría consolidar su familia, y además poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera de ver crecer y participar activamente de la educación de su hija.
Su mayor motivación en relación al negocio es consolidarse como microempresaria y poder sacar adelante su familia y poder dejar un Patrimonio a su hija.
De su experiencia en Fondo Esperanza destaca lo útil que le ha sido el financiamiento para esta época del año, le parece interesante el hecho que le ofrezcan la posibilidad de participar en las reuniones y capacitaciones impartidas en la institución, por lo que también recibe una ayuda integral. 
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
The community bank called "Fuerza Corazón de Lampa" consists of 16 entrepreneurs, who are involved in different areas related to trade. They work in different open market fairs, and they all belong to the municipality of Colina.

Irma is president of the community bank. In the photo she is standing in the front row, second from left to right, and wearing a shirt with red, white and calypso (aquamarine) horizontal stripes. She is active in retail trading, specifically selling fruits and vegetables at various open markets in her community. She also sells crafts from the village of Pomaire.

She started in the business at an early age as most of her family are merchants. She has a fruit and vegetable stand she runs jointly with her husband and a stand for clay handicrafts, which she acquires from a craftsman in Pomaire.

She works from Tuesday to Sunday at three different market fairs and soon expects to join a fourth market located in the center of town. At this time of year she is also involved in the town's Christmas market which is scheduled in the evenings.

With a credit loan to buy merchandise for her business, she will stock up on crafts for the Christmas season, mainly to sell manger scenes showing the Holy Family. Her business goals are to become an established merchant, and be able to work independently with formal standing in a more permanent structure.

Irma lives with her husband, her mother-in-law and her young daughter Daniela, who is only three years old and is her prime motivator for success. She says her biggest dream is related to the purchase of her own home. This will enable her to strengthen her family and solidify her business, in a way that allows her to see her daughter grow and actively participate in her education.

Her main motivation with relation to her business is to become established as a micro-entrepreneur, improve her family's condition, and leave an inheritance to her daughter.

Her experience with Hope Fund highlights the usefulness of financing at this time of year. She found interesting the opportunity to participate in meetings and training within the institution, so as to receive comprehensive support.

Colina is a community in the metropolitan area north of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is currently the focus of major investments, especially in the agro-industrial sector. This is due to the installation of large and important companies, which provide a large number of jobs to the community.

It is also an area of welcoming subdivisions, which has helped to increase significantly the number of its inhabitants. It also has adequate space devoted to tourism, such as spas, water-sports on Laguna Piedra Roja and mountain-climbing.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business, and stock up on crafts for the Christmas season, mainly to sell manger scenes showing the Holy Family.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 30 years of age, single and has one child who she is sending to school. Glenda is engaged in a retailing business selling powdered soap, perfumes and lotions. She has been in this business for almost eight years.

Glenda’s way to sell her products is walking around their village, offering the products to the people in their village. Even rain or shine, Glenda continues to sell because it is her source of income to provide the needs of her child.

Glenda wants to gain higher income. She plans to build a sari-sari store business (variety) to have an additional source of income. With the connection of her plan, Glenda is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional perfumes and lotions and build a sari-sari store business. She hopes to take the loan and earn a higher income from her additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase additional perfumes and lotions and to build a sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Dorice is thirty-eight years old. She is married to Richard and they have 2 children, aged 3 and 5 years. She has operated a clothing boutique in Kimilili town, in western Kenya, for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She is requesting for her first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 50,000, which she will use to buy stocks of new clothing to sell. She will plow the anticipated profits back into her business.

Her dream is to open another boutique.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of new clothes

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a widowed woman. She has two children, age 24 and 28 years. She describes herself as focused and quiet. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cows for slaughtering. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a viable and busy area and her primary customers are butchers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a cow to sell for slaughter. 

Within the next five years, Philomena hopes to own a slaughterhouse.

loans.use: To buy a cow to sell for slaughter.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 44 años, está casada y tiene una niña de 07 años de edad,  por quien trabajan duro día a día para brindarle lo mejor, tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su familia. Graciela se dedica al corte y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, contando con su propia maquina de coser para realizar su trabajo. Lleva más de  07 años en éste trabajo y tiene un taller muy rustico y pequeño en su casa.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tienen sus servicios y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta de su trabajo pues está en su hogar y puede realizar una actividad que la mantiene ocupada y le permite sentirse una persona productiva, además le permite tener ingresos y cumplir la función de ama de casa y madre. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2000, espera que le vaya bien ya que hasta ahora siempre fue una socia muy cumplida y siempre se caracterizo por pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como  tela, algodón, hilos y productos para su pequeño negocio, para que pueda seguir con su labor y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 44 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old daughter. She lives with her family and they own a home where they live together. Graciela works hard day after day in order to provide the best for her family. She designs and sews outfits for women, men, and children. Graciela has her own sewing machine for doing the work. She has been in this profession for more than seven years. Her small workshop is very basic and is located in her house.

Graciela considers her business to be profitable because of the demand for her services. It generates a good amount of income. She enjoys her work because it allows her to stay at home. Her business keeps her busy and allows her to feel like a productive individual. In addition, she is able to generate an income while fulfilling her role as a housewife and mother.

Graciela is taking this opportunity to request 2,000 PEN. She expects to do well since she has always been an accomplished member who is known for making payments on time. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy sewing materials such as fabric, cotton, thread, and other supplies for her small business. This will enable her to continue her work and to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cotton, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mahugnon 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON 4 est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, nommée  André (Celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgé de 51 ans. André est marié a une revendeuse du nom de Blandine. Le couple a quatre enfants, certains scolarisés et trois a leur charge. André vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, André vend des pièces détachés dans sa boutique et à son domicile. De façon secondaire, André vend aussi des fagots de bois et des sacs de charbon de bois.  André s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité André ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUGNON 4 sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fagots de bois et des sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 39 years old, married woman with three children; ages 14, 12 and 8 years old. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps her husband by selling the fish. Helen and her husband are doing this livelihood for 15 years. This livelihood is their main sources of income since they started their married life. With this, they want to improve this livelihood for their sustainability. And they also want to have enough money for their children to finish their studies. To do this, Helen is asking an amount to buy fishing nets and fishing boat engine.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing boat engine

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
The following description was written by Moses O., a volunteer with Village Enterprise Fund and partner representative for Kiva in Uganda:

Justine O. is among the most successful small-scale business leaders.

He got a grant of 100 US dollars from VEF. He started by buying and selling of goats right away. Most butchers have known his business, so a number of them come to him to buy goats.

He can now buy and sell between 15 and 20 goats in a month -- a great amount.

The market is very open since most of Ugandans rear goats and cows for raising money whenever needs arise like school fees, sickness, death, journey etc.

O. has attended business training and he is capable of handling the loan and paying it back.

Given a loan of 500 US dollars, he is targeting to introduce bulls for slaughter and opening up a butcher shop himself.

loans.use: Buy bulls, open a butcher shop

loans.name: Fredy

texts.en:
My name is Fredy G. and I sell all types of second hand clothing for men, women, boys and girls. I have had my business for 5 years and I have a good clientel because we sell our items at low and affordable prices for our community. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to offer a wider variety of products and with the additional earnings, I will feed my family and give a good education to my son, who is ready to begin University.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Fredy G. me dedico a la venta de todo tipo de ropa usada para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendemos nuestro producto a un bajo precio y que es accesible para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi hijo que esta por ingresar a la universidad.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate A. is 45 years old, married, and has four (6) children. She lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. A dedicated client of LAPO, Kate specializes in the sales of provisions and drinks. She is asking for US$400 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a vegetable stall for his wife

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mr. Lim R. is 62 years old and the father of three school-aged children. He and his wife work selling a variety of grocery products to the people in their community, where they can earn on average about $8/day in revenue. This couple hopes to use this loan to increase their inventory by adding some kinds of products to meet their clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu, a mother of seven children, sells items such as sugar, chicken stock cubes, and tomato paste in the open-air market in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. Her husband does irregular and temporary work that does not guarantee a flow of income for the family. Fatu’s business is therefore the main source of income for her family.

With her previous loans, Fatu made a profit and has invested a portion of that into farming. Fatu’s aim is to have family food from the farm so that the business income can be mainly used for the children’s school fees and medical expenses. Fatu is presently requesting a loan of US$ 250 to expand her business.

loans.use: Continue to expand her grocery business in the Makeni market

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 42 years old and is married with 4 children. She started her business in 2003 with a loan from SMT.  She sells plastic shoes and some cotton materials.  Fatmata invested part of her last loan on a palm oil business. Her husband is assisting in the purchase and selling of the oil in Freetown.  She would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: Diversify her business to include selling palm oil as well as shoes.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: I am Rukhsana S. from Multan, a medium-sized city in Pakistan. I am married and have five children. All of us live in a small brick house. My husband’s income is very small. To supplement his income. I sew clothes to order for my neighborhood clients. I am requesting a loan of $425 to expand my business. Your loan will help me continue to put food on our table.

loans.use: Expand sewing business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. is 31 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the town of Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria, and since 1999 has helped support her family by selling drinks and food at a local market. Faith needs a loan of $450 to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Freddys Andres

texts.es:
Cattle farming is an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the "municipio" of Villanueva, Fredys has earned a living from raising cattle since he was a boy.

He's married now and has two children that, according to Fredys, are his reason for living. It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural aren't enough to maintain a family and, for this reason, Fredys works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his wife and children.

Fredys urgently needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan with Ceprodel, his helping hand in the business, which has supported him with 4 loans up to now that he has used for the benefit of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La ganadería es una actividad económica, dedicada a la crianza del conjunto de especies animales para sacar provecho al animal y sus productos derivados, así como la propia explotación del ganado. En la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio de Villanueva, el señor Fredys S. se dedica a la ganadería desde su juventud.

Es casado y con dos hijos que son el motivo de su existencia según nos cuenta este señor. Cabe señalar que por vivir en una zona rural, sus bajos ingresos no le alcanza para mantener su núcleo familiar y es por esta razón que se esfuerza grandemente para brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su esposa e hijos.

La necesidad que atraviesa Fredys es la urgencia de adquirir los animales como vaca y terneros y para esto ha acudido en Ceprodel quien es su mano amiga en este negocio ya que le ha apoyado con 4 créditos que le han beneficiado satisfactoriamente en la compra del ganado que es su necesidad una vez mas.

loans.use: Buy calves for livestock business.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a married woman with one child.  She lives in Ordzhonikidze and owns a small business selling women’s lingerie in the central city mall.  Ludmila has many loyal clients who know her little store for having versatile merchandise at affordable prices.  Ludmila has been in this trade for 13 years.  Presently, her turnover is about $6800.  Her monthly profit is about $600. 

Ludmila would like to increase the assortment of inventory in her store and improve her sales as a result.  Today she is requesting a loan of $800 to re-stock her inventory.  She is hoping to obtain a stable source of income and continue developing her business.  A committed wife and mother, Ludmila works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Lucydania

texts.es:
Lucydania is a humble and exemplary woman that makes a living making beautiful weavings on a wooden loom. Her daily efforts and dedication have given her great satisfaction and an immense list of orders. However, her daily labor can be interrupted by the damage of her old and loved loom. She wishes to acquire a new loom and a greater quantity of prime material to successfully fill the orders of her demanding clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

LUCYDANIA, es una humilde y ejemplar mujer que se gana la vida fabricando bellos telares con la ayuda de una máquina a base de madera adquirida para este fin, su dedicación y esfuerzo diario le han otorgado más de una satisfacción y una inmensa lista de solicitudes; sin embargo su diaria labor puede verse interrumpida por los desperfectos que viene teniendo su vieja y amada máquina. Desea adquirir una nueva y mayor cantidad de materia prima para cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of a new loom and prime material

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Vũ Thị Hòa is 54 years old. She is a 4th year TYM fund member. She has 4 children, 2 are still living with her and her husband. She sells pork, this is her main occupation. Ever since she received the loans from TYM, the sales have increased because she could buy more pork to sell. With the money that she makes, she is able to buy the goods that are needed for her household. Her income is 220 USD a month. She is requesting a loan of 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Hòa, 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ được 4 năm. Chị có 4 người con, trong đó 2 người còn sống với bố mẹ. Công việc hàng ngày của chị Hòa là buôn bán thịt lợn. Từ khi có thêm đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ, số lượng hàng bán ra tăng lên đáng kể. Có thêm thu nhập chị Hoà mua sắm thêm được nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị Hòa là 220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thịt lợn bán.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Temurova

texts.ru:
T. is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has a college degree. Previously she worked as a middle school teacher, but because salaries in the public sector in Tajikistan are very small, 8 years ago she left work and has opened a wedding salon. She purchases wedding gowns and rents them for weddings. Her goods are unique and are in high demand in town. Her salon has become very well known. Summer is the season for weddings and for this reason she would like to increase her selection of gowns by purchasing some in Turkey. This will help the brides look their absolute best on their wedding day.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Турсуной женщина 42 лет замужем имеет троих детей, образование высшее.Она раньше работала учительницей в средней школе , но т.к. зарплата бюджетников в Таджикистане мизерная, поэтому она ушла с работы и уже 8 лет как она открыла свой свадебный салон, где закупает свадебные платья и отдает в аренду на свадебные мероприятия.Её товар оригинальный и имеет хороший спрос у нас в городе.Её салон знаменит.Лето это сезон для свадеб и поэтому она хочет увеличить свои платья завозом из Турции, чтоб наши девушки невесты были неотразимыми на своём свадебном вечере.

loans.use: свадебный салон

loans.name: Catalicia

texts.es:
Catalicia sells fruits and meats in a small market near her house. Six years ago, she formed a group of people who wanted to set up businesses and together they rented a large space to sell their products. That's how they started a mini-market. Catalicia has worked in daycare centers and communal eateries. She's always been a leader wherever she's worked.

The loans that Catalicia has applied for have been used to expand her business and to open a stall in another mini-market where her husband works. She would like to find other people to open more mini-markets in other places.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Catalicia vende frutas y carne en un pequeño mercado cerca de su casa. Hace 6 años, ella formó un grupo de personas que querían poner un negocio, por lo que entre todos alquilaron un local grande y empezaron a vender sus productos. Fue así que formaron un mini mercado. Catalicia ha trabajado cuidando niños en guarderías comunales y en comedores populares. Siempre ha sido lidereza de estas organizaciones.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para ampliar su negocio y para abrir un puesto en otro mini-mercado. Allí trabaja su esposo. Catalicia quisiera contar con más gente para abrir más minis-mercados en otros lugares.

loans.use: To expand food business and open another stall.

loans.name: Inne's Yatakuwa Group

texts.en:
Inne is 38 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 7 and 3. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Inne has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Inne now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: A A Ketut Srianti

texts.id:
A.A Ketut Srianti mempunyai pekerjaan sebagai pembuat banten. Bahan – bahan yang diperlukan adalah potongan bambu yang sudah dipotong kecil-kecil serta daun kelapa, baik yang muda maupun yang tua. Keahlian yang dimilikinya sudah didapatkannya dari ibunya karena sudah menjadi tradisi bagi perempuan di Bali khususnya yang beragama Hindu .
 	Dengan modal awal Rp. 200.000.- Srianti mulai membuat berbagai  macam jenis Banten. Harga satu  ikat Banten dijual dengan harga Rp.10.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih Rp.50.000,- Jika ada pesanan dalam jumlah besar, Srianti selalu kekurangan modal. Dengan adanya bantuan modal usaha  dari Yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya, Srianti merasa sangat senang karena bisa memenuhi lebih banyak lagi pesanan terutama jika ada hari besar keagamaan. Suaminya bernama Ida Bagus Sudi Arnawa Yasa adalah seorang Tukang Ukir yang sangat terkenal didesanya. Srianti mempunyai seorang anak laki – laki, sekarang duduk dibangku kelas 2 SD. Dari hasil penjualan bantennya, Srianti selalu menyisihkan untuk ditabung agar bisa membiayai pendidikan yang lebih tinggi.
texts.en:
A.A Ketut Srianti is a Banten maker. Banten is a religious article used in Hinduism faith religious ceremony. The material of Banten is bamboo pieces and coconut leaves.

Her husband is Ida Bagus Sudi Arnawa Yasa, a well known carpenter in their village. They have one son who is now at 3rd grade at the local elementary school.

With initial capital of IDR 200 thousand (around USD 21) she can makes various styles of Banten. She can earn a profit of IDR 50 thousand (around USD 5.5). However if her customers want to place a big volume order, she cannot accept it as she doesn't have enough capital to get the material. Therefore with the loan money from DINARI foundation, she is now able to take the big orders as she can afford to buy the material. With this she can increase her revenue and she can save more money for her son's education fund.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material (Membeli bahan baku)

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is Hassan K.. Hassan was born in Kabala some 35 years ago. He is married with one child who is not of school age. His wife sells market food at the Kabala town market. Hassan sells spare parts and has been in this business for the past 10 years now.

This will be Hassan's fifth loan from SMT.  Previous loans have helped Hassan a great deal. With each loan cycle, Hassan can buy himself valuables while paying off the principal of the loan. He has been able to buy a bed, a tape recorder, a motor-bike and a plot of land. 

Most often, Hassan buys his spare parts from the neighboring country of Guinea because prices are lower in Guinea than in Sierra Leone. When Hassan is in urgent need of parts, he must travel to Freetown (285 miles each way) and purchase the items he needs.  

Mr. Hassan is seeking a loan of Le 5,000,000.00 (US$1,200). This loan amount he will reinvest in his business by buying more spare parts. With more spare parts in his shop, he will be able to make more sales and avoid having to travel to purchase more parts.  Consequently, this will increase the amount of profit he makes. This will make him a happy person and he will be able to do a lot of great things for himself. He will be able to buy himself a house and take great care of his family.

loans.use: Buy more spare parts to add to his business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is married and has 6 children, of whom 3 are currently in school. Carmen travels 3 times per week to local markets, where she sells dry goods with the help of her children. Carmen also bakes and sells bread; she starts baking each day at 3am and begins selling the finished product at 5am. Her husband has a workshop where he fixes cars. 

Carmen needs a loan of 1800 soles ($600 USD), which she will use to buy sugar, flour, and oil.

Carmen's dreams are to own her own business and to outfit her husband's workshop with the necessary tools. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Carmen es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, Carmen viaja 3 veces a la semana a las ferias en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Carmen elabora panes actividad que realiza desde las 3 de la mañana y a las 5 de la mañana vende los panes. El esposo de Carmen tiene un taller de reparación de carros.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1800 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, harina, aceite.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener un negocio propio e implementar el taller de su esposo.

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Nereida Elena

texts.es:
La señora Nereida Elena tiene 63 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle Aviación 1198 sector Jerusalén, distrito D. La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque forzosamente tuvo que trabajar desD. muy niña. Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 5 hijos, que ya están casados.
Nereida tiene una bodega en la cual trabaja diariamente y D. la cual vive. AtienD. a sus clientes con mucha alegría, lo que le ayuda a obtener mayor clientela.
Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en compra D. abarrotes para ampliar su bodega.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en arroz, azúcar, gaseosa.
Nereida sueña con tener un mini mercado por su zona.
texts.en:
Nereida Elena is 63 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "Nueva Esperanza II". She lives at 1198 Aviación Street in the Jerusalén sector of the distrito of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru.

She finished elementary school but didn't continue on because she was forced to get a job at a very young age. She married at 20 and has 5 children who are all now married. Nereida owns a small grocery outlet that she works in every day and that supports her. She attends her customers with a big smile which helps her build a customer base.

With her 1st loan of 300 Soles (1 $US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 instalments, she invested in grocery items to expand her store. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which she will repay in 6 instalments, she will invest in rice, sugar and soda. Nereida dreams of owning a mini market in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items.

loans.name: Myra Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Myra Lorena Gómez Torrez tiene la edad de 40 años, sus estado civil es casada, Doña Myra tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son una niña de 13 años que cursa el 3 año de secundaria y un niño de 5 años que cursa el 1 primer grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora en una agencia en el guasaule, sus propósitos son incrementar sus ventas para que su negocio se mantenga activo para seguirle ayudando a sus hijos que lo necesitan, sus deseos son de proporcionarle a sus hijos un futuro en los estudios para que estos sean un profesionales para el día de mañana y lograr educarlos para la vida y para la resolución de sus problemas.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería y alquiler de video, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de ENITEL 2 cuadras al oeste ½ al sur, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia por lo que este fue un medio de trabajo para ella por lo que decide realizar el financiamiento para sacar adelante su negocio y mantenerlo de esta forma activo y empieza con una vitrina con los productos como: borrador, lápices, y cuadernos y al ver la buena acogida de sus clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que quiere estar preparada cuando se avecine la entrada a clases y realizar las diferentes compras como: cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, tarjadores y cartulinas.
texts.en:
Myra Lorena Gómez Torrez is 40 years old. She is married and has two children, a 13 year old girl attending her 3rd year in secondary school and a boy of 5 attending his 1st grade in primary school. Myra’s husband has an agency in the city of Guasaule. Her goal is to increase her sales to keep her business active so she can continue helping her dependent children. She wants to provide them with a better education so they can become professionals in the future so they don’t have to face great problems. She’s owned a bookstore and video store for 5 years. Her shop is located at ENITEL, 2 blocks west half block south. She stated this business on her own as she needed a job and she requested for a loan to keep it active. She stated with a small counter with products such as erasers, pencils, notebooks and others. As she became more popular among her customers, he decided to invest more money on her business. She will use this loan for work capital to get ready for the upcoming school season. She wants to buy more supplies such as notebooks, pens, erasers, maps and large cards.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
TERESA DE JESÚS MARTÍNEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ”, ubicado en el Jr. Oroya Mz. G, Lt. 02 del Asentamiento Humano “Nuevo Bolognesi” en el km. 7 del Distrito de Callería.

La señora teresa tiene 46 años de edad con 03 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es fotógrafo.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, se compro una máquina fotográfica, rollos de películas y empezó a tomar fotografías, buscaba clientela y sobre todo los días festivos, pues lo consiguió.

El último desembolso que recibió fue de S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprar frutas, botellas, tapas, madera para la producción de néctar y el encajonamiento, con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo hacen la distribución necesaria a sus clientes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos todo su apoyo que brindó a ella y a su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús Martinez belongs to the Community Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship), located at Jr. Oroya Mz G, Lot 2 in the Nuevo Bolognesi neighborhood, kilometer 7 of the District of Calleria. Teresa is 46 years old and has three grown children. Her husband is a photographer. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles and she bought a camera and film and began to take photographs. She sought out clients and during the holidays she was able to serve many customers. This loan, for S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles is to buy fruit, bottles and lids, and wood to make and bottle juice. With the help of her husband and children she will distribute the juice to her customers. She is grateful for all of the support Manuela Ramos has given to her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and bottles to make and sell juice

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.en:
Julia Liliana is an extremely hard-working woman who lives in a very poor area just outside Guatemala City. She is always busy sewing clothes (her first businesses) and has recently graduated from a professional pastry course specializing in cake preparation (her second business). 

Her children have helped her greatly to succeed. She currently has her sewing business, and it has done very well. The products are of good quality, and her clients are demanding more products. Julia Liliana needs a loan to increase her products and to better meet the needs of her customers. 

This is her second loan with Kiva. She will use part of this loan to buy more fabric and sewing necessities, and part of the loan to invest in the bakery and to buy the many things she needs for this business. She says that all of this will allow her to continue moving forward and to be a better person every day.

****************************************

Julia Liliana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien vive en una communidad muy pobre fuera de la Capital del Pais. Se ha dedicado a la costura de ropa  (su primer negocio) y se ha graduado recientemente de repostería profesional de elaboración de pasteles (su segundo negocio) .  

Sus hijos la han ayudado mucho a que ella se supere.  Ella actualmente tiene su negocio de costura y le ha ido muy bien, ya que sus productos son de buena calidad, y sus clientes le han propuesto que agrande sus negocios, por eso ella necesita de un préstamo para aumentar sus productos y poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este préstamo es su segundo prestamo de Kiva.
