Con el préstamo que solicita, ella comprará  mas telas y mobiliario, también aprovechará  para invertir en la repostería, donde compraría muchas cosas que se necesitan para ello.  Con todo eso ella dice que puede salir adelante, y ser una mejor persona cada día.

loans.use: Bulk fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Antoci

texts.en: A. lives in Floresti district, Puteni village. His business is vegetable growing for the wholesale market when he cultivates a very good harvest. A. thought to have a rich harvest throughout the year but for this he needs to build a greenhouse at his home so he took a loan from Microinvest, a Kiva partner, to do this. What he wants most of all is to increase his business and to start to raise pigs because customers who come from outside the town are asking for pork.

loans.use: Increase his business and to start to raise pigs

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es: Don Lui Roberto A. es Originario de la zona 4 de Totonicapán  don Luis por los conocimientos adquiridos y por el tiempo de estar trabajando en el Hospital de Totonicapán, reunido con su familia de poder emprender su propio negocio y la cual se deciden en la apertura de una Farmacia la cual nos visita las oficina de ASDIR para solicitar un credito que le permita sustir aun mas  de medicamentos de la nueva farmacia. Facilitar al publico en general a un precio accecibles que las ptras farmacias,
texts.en:
Lui Roberto A. is from Zone 4 in Totonicapán. Due to the knowledge he acquired from his time spent working in the Totonicapán Hospital, along with his family he as been able to open his own business which is a pharmacy. He visited the offices of ASDIR to request a loan that will help him supply more medicines at the new pharmacy and offer more affordable pricing to the general public than what is offered by the other pharmacies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married. His family lives in Vinogradovo. Pavlo owns a business selling household items and sunglasses in the central market of his home town. He owns a small vending kiosk right at the entrance to the marketplace. Pavlo started this business 7 years ago. Currently, he has about 35,000 Hrivnya in inventory. His gross income amounts to 15,000 Hrivnya.

Pavlo is requesting a loan of 12,000 Hrivnya to increase inventory and his proceeds as a result. One of his long-term plans is for the expansion of his business. Pavlo has benefited from the lending services provided by “Nadiya Ukraine” previously and has established a reputation for honesty as he worked with the organization. We believe this loan will provide further assistance to Pavlo as he seeks to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida B. is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, both of whom are sons. She says both are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Vida is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of vegetables – tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs (small eggplants), etc. She sells on a table top in the market square. Vida procures her vegetables from farmers in the nearby communities at effective prices. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables for resale

loans.name: Akinbade

texts.en: R., a 42-year-old widow, has three children and sells drinks/juice. She started this business a year ago, but previously had been trading in seasonal goods. R. is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks/juice to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena Y. is 32 years old. She is married and has two children—both daughters. One is currently in junior high and the other in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Abena sells food stuffs such as yam, plantain, and so forth. She wants a loan to buy food stuffs in bulk. Abena sells her products to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Abena has been in business for three years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is twenty-eight years old. He is single and has no children but cares for a younger sibling. He lives independently in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Joseph sells agrochemicals. He buys the chemicals from Kumasi and sells them in a store in his community. He supplies to farmers in his community. Joseph has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals and fertilizers in bulk to expand his business. Joseph desires to save for his future and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. is the single mother of three school-going children. For the last fourteen years she has been cooking food in her house to order and delivering it to specific clients around Naivasha town. Sarah was introduced to KADET through her friend and this is her first loan with the organization. She plans to buy more utensils for the ever-increasing clientele of her catering business, and also to build a bigger permanent structure for her other business of rearing and selling poultry and rabbits. In future, Sarah hopes to build her own restaurant that will not only cater for her active clients but also serve the walk in clients. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, and to build a bigger place to keep poultry and rabbits

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She sells baby things and she has been in the business since 1993. She is requesting for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more baby things to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional items to sell to increase income

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña María Vásquez tiene 41 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar  Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío  Centro, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante
texts.en:
María Vásquez is married and is 41 years old. She has a workshop with 2 looms where she weaves "traditional styles for women." She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband are both engaged in this trade, and have 2 employees working in the same activity. For 8 years they have produced these garments in their home, which is located in the Centro hamlet, in the village of Vásquez in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala. Presently orders from her customers are growing but she is not able to raise capital due to the economic conditions in her area. For this reason she has turned to the ASDIR Association to request a loan to be used to buy raw materials. In this manner she can increase her sales, and hopefully also move her family ahead economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicraft production (increase of capital)

loans.name: Cristhian Alex

texts.es: Alex de 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 13 y 9 años, los mismos que a la fecha están viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Alex tiene su taxi propio con el que trabaja personalmente en servicio de taxi, por otra parte, la esposa es veterinaria y tiene su propio consultorio con varios años de experiencia. Asimismo, el sector de transporte tiene gran demanda del servicio ya es medio de transporte de mucha gente, pese a que existe un parque automotor competitivo el rubro del transporte es muy lucrativo. El destino del crédito es para mantenimiento de vehículo y unos pequeños arreglos de su domicilio (refacción baño),  finalmente, cabe mencionar que el cliente  está en su tercera secuencia crediticia, demostrando durante este tiempo responsabilidad y buena fe pagos.
texts.en:
Alex is 39 year old and lives with his wife and two children who are 13 and 9 years old. The family is currently living in the house of his mother-in-law. Alex has his own taxi, with which he provides taxi services, moreover his wife is a veterinarian and she has her own veterinary office with several years of experience. Also, the transportation industry is in great demand, given that it is the medium of transport of many people. Although there exists a competitive fleet transportation industry, his business is very lucrative. This loan will be used to maintain his vehicle, and to do some small repairs of his house (spare bathroom.) Finally, we mention that this client is in his third credit cycle, and he has demonstrated in previous loans responsibility and good faith in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital and construction

loans.name: Bigue

texts.fr:
Madame Bigue D. est une femme mariee mere d un enfant qui s active dans la vente de poissons afin de  satisfaire la demande de sa clientele.Avec ce pret elle aura l opportunite de maaximiser ses benefices en passant d un montant de 80 000 frs a 90 000 frs chaque mois.
 Madame Bigue D.  est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF)  Seydina  Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bigue D. is a married woman and the mother of one child who works at selling fish so as to satisfy the demand of her clientele. With this loan, she will have the opportunity of maximizing her profit, going from the sum of 80,000 Frs to 90,000 Frs per month. Mrs. Bigue D. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Program for the Development of Children and the Family (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF is attempting to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children coming from underprivileged families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of the latter can take advantage of loans with more flexible conditions than usual. Since the agreement went into effect in December of 2008, 120 parents have received a loan for amounts between 50,000 and 150,000 Frs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Ms. Mary K. is a business woman who owns a bar pub along Kakoba road. She would like to use the requested loan money to boost her business by purchasing crates of beer, sodas, etc for her pub. She is a married woman and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She hopes to generate more monthly by building rental houses.

loans.use: To boost her business by purchasing crates of beer, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and married with six children between the ages of six and twenty. She has a business selling fish in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She sells fingerlings (young fish) and has been in business for five years. She describes herself as a very hardworking person.

She successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for 20,000 KES, and says that since she joined Faulu, she has been able to expand her business. She requested this loan for 40,000 KES from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to be a supplier for the entire region and be able to buy more household goods and have her own home.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is a client of Asociación Arariwa and is member of a communal bank consisting of thirteen members in Cusco. The group is called Maquimanta Purisun (which in Quechua means "Walking together hand in hand"). Guillermina is 63 years old and she lives in Cusco. She is the mother of three children and has ten grandchildren.

Guillermina runs an auto parts distribution business which she started ten years ago. It is a family business and many of her family members help her out. She buys auto parts and repair kits in Lima, the capital of Peru, which she then sells in a market in Cusco and also distributes to nearby towns.

Business is slow during this time of year so Guillermina needs only a relatively small loan to be able to buy additional car parts to supply her customers.

Guillermina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her auto parts business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is fifty-three years old. and she is married. She has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Agnes is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. She sells by the roadside. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Agnes has been in business for over twenty-one years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is 35 years old and is the loving mother of three children. Since beginning her family, she has dedicated herself to raising livestock, work that she continues to this day with much love and patience. As a result of her self-sacrificing work and the care that Matluba brings to each one of her young cows, she has been able to increase the quantity of her calves. Now, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, which, apart from everything, fill her with pride and much satisfaction. 

Her next desire is to move into the business of selling milk. This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and to enable her to pay the university costs of her children. In order to meet her goals, Matluba is relying on your generous heart and asks for a loan in order to buy more cattle and begin this new occupation without delay. Matluba awaits your response in order to finalize her plans and to make her dreams of seeing her children become professionals a reality.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for milk to sell

loans.name: A. Victoire

texts.fr: N. A.Victoire est née le 12 Janvier 1976 et est mariée à ADJOVI Agapit. Le couple a deux enfants à charge, dont un représente leur propre enfant et est scolarisé. Il y a un an de cela que la famille s'est installée au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est surtout le mari de Victoire qui assure les charges de la famille, mais Victoire vient souvent en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Victoire a fréquenté jusqu'à l'université. Mais depuis 4 ans environs, Victoire vend des tissus et des chaussures au quartier Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Victoire a une buvette où elle reçoit ses clients venant payer des boissons. Victoire s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Victoire ambitionne renforcer son capital et agrandir son étalalge afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de la clientèle. C'est ce qui a conduit Victoire à solliciter un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A.Victoire N. was born on 12 January 1976 and is married to Agapit ADJOVI. The couple has two children to support, one of which is their own child and is at school. A year ago the family settled down in the Agla district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Victoire's husband assumes the bulk of the household expenses, but Victoire often helps him with these, thanks to the income which she gets from her activity. Victoire went to school up to university level. But for around four years now she has been selling fabric and shoes in the Sainte Rita district of Cotonou. At the same time she has a refreshment stall where she welcomes her customers who come to pay for their drinks. Victoire gets her supplies in Lomé in Togo, one of Bénin's neigboring countries, and also in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. In great demand from her customers, Victoire's ambition is to strengthen her capital and expand her display in order to meet the ever incoreasing demand of her customers. This has led her to apply for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fabric and shoes

loans.name: Matlуuba

texts.ru: Сафарова Матлюба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 22 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Муж работает в городе Душанбе. Сама Матлюба занимается торговлей. Она более 5 лет занимается приготовлением пирожков и их продажей на рынке. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Matlуuba S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 22 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband works in the city of Dushanbe, while Matlyuba herself makes pies and sells them on the market. She has been in this business for over five years and is seeking a loan in order to increase the sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales volume increase

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
la sra. Eleuteria G. V. tiene 54 años de edad, tiene un pequeño local que esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. su negocio opera bajo el nombre de "Quesitos Tellitas".
Eleuteria esta casada, con su esposo trabajan en el mercado, hace mucho tiempo obtuvieron su local en este mercado.
sus productos se venden mucho, este mercado es muy bueno para las ventas, mas los fines de semana.
cabe decir que Eleuteria se dedicaba antes a la costura.
gracias a este negocio logro graduar a su hijo de la universidad, lo cual la tiene muy feliz porque era una de sus metas en su vida.
Eleuteria tiene 3 hijos, los otros dos toda via estan estudiando y espera que tambien sean profesionales algun dia.
Eleuteria necesita el credito para comprar mas lacteos y chicharrones ya que muchos de los clientes que ella tiene son personas que trabajan en la Alcadial Municipal de Tegucigalpa y les vende al credito y hasta finales de mes le pagan lo que consumen.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria G. V. is 54 years old. She has a small store that is in the Dolores market in the city of Tegucigalpa. Her business operates under the name "Quesitos Tellitas" (Small Tellita Cheeses). Eleuteria is married. She works with her husband in the market. She started her store in this market a long time ago. Her products sell well. The market is very good for sales, especially on weekends. It is appropriate to add that Eleuteria was previously a seamstress. Thanks to her current business, her son has graduated from the university. His graduation made Eleuteria happy because it was one of the goals of her life. Eleuteria has three children. The other two children are studying, and she hopes they will also become professionals some day. She needs a loan to buy more dairy products and fried, ground pork. Many of her customers work in the city hall of Tegucigalpa. She extends credit to them, and they pay their debt to her at the end of the month.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cheese, soft cheese, butter, and fried, ground pork

loans.name: Ema Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Ema A. N. es profesora de secundaria tiene doce año de ser maestra, es el séptimo crédito con nosotros es excelente cliente los otros crédito los ha solicitado para mejora de su hogar y este crédito lo solicita para cambio de techo de su casa compra de materiales como zinc, perlines, pernos y pago de mano de obra, la Sra. N. es casada tiene tres hijo dos menores en edad escolar, su esposo es conductor de camión trabaja en Managua vendiendo cemento y piedra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ema A. N. is a high school teacher and has been teaching for 12 years. This is her seventh loan from us and she is an excellent customer. She used the previous loans for home improvements; she will use this loan to replace the roof; she will buy roofing material, steel framing, bolts and she will also pay for labor. Mrs. N. is married and has three children (two of them are minors); her husband is a truck driver and works in Managua selling cement and rocks.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy roofing material, steel framing, and nails

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is married with four children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She is a 50-year-old hardworking woman who sells for long hours to support her home. To make a living, she fries fish to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. 

Iyabo is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more fish to fry and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: working capital to buy grocery items and supplies

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria V. is from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.ru:
В жизни каждого человека  возникают моменты, когда, то, чем он занимается, перестаёт доставлять ему удовольствие, и он начинает питать отвращение ко всему, что его окружает. И только сильные люди способны не принимать близко к сердцу такие препятствия, психологического характера, и чётко настраивать себя на работу и надеяться на лучшее. Если прочитать историю наших героев, то становится очевидным, что в повседневной жизни нас окружает множество таких людей. 
Исаева Мира – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок три года. Мира – мать троих детей. Старшей дочери восемнадцать лет, среднему сыну четырнадцать, а младшей дочери всего семь. Мира выбрала себе изначально довольно традиционное занятие – учитель в начальных классах. Однако в условиях современной жизни, когда бюджетников не очень жалуют зарплатами, встал вопрос о том, чтобы находить дополнительный источник заработков. Так муж Миры стал фермером, а Мира, по мере возможности стала помогать мужу. Привыкнуть к новому роду деятельности довольно нелегкое дело. Однако, Мира имела твёрдое намерение по улучшению жизни своей семьи и ей пришлось осваивать новое занятие. Сейчас они с мужем уже не нуждаются в чьей – либо консультации по поводу того, как надо сажать  и что, как следует выращивать. Мира обратилась за этим кредитом, так как сейчас им надо закупить солярки по оптовой цене. Они очень надеются получить этот кредит и купить солярки.

Партнёры Миры по группе:

Джапаеву Алтынбеку двадцать пять. Он уже женат и у него сын, которому исполнился всего месяц. А также с ним живёт его сестра, которой Алтынбек помогает. Чтобы прокормить семью, Алтынбек работает учителем информатики. Помимо этого, Алтынбек активно занимается сельским хозяйством. Алтынбек нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить солярки. 

Табалдиевой Гульзат сорок три года. Гульзат – вдова и сама восритывает троих детей. Для того, чтобы прокормить семью, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас для Гульзат стоит приоритетная задача – ей необходимо закупить солярки, но средств у неё не имеется. Она обратилась именно за этим кредитом, так как очень верит, что у неё всё получится. 

Иманкожаевой Талайкул сорок восемь лет. Талайкуль – вдова, и мать четверых детей. Она сама обучила детей и до сих пор их со всем усердием поддерживает. Талайкул занимается земледелием. Она выращивает различные овощи и сейчас очень надеется на получение этого кредита, так как он позволит ей закупить солярки. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
All of us experience moments in our lives when we cease enjoying our activities and start detesting everything surrounding us. Only strong people are capable of overcoming such psychological troubles and of making themselves focus on work while hoping for a change to the patter. Reading this group’s story, it becomes clear that many such strong people may be found next to us every day. Mira I. is this group’s leader. She is 43 years old. She is the mother of three children. The oldest daughter is 18 years old; the middle child, a son, is 14; and the youngest daughter is only seven. Initially, Mira had chosen a fairly traditional profession for herself—grammar school teacher. Yet in today’s conditions when civil servants are hardly getting paid, it has become necessary for her to find an additional source of income. This is how Mira’s husband became a farmer, and Mira has been helping her husband as much as she could. Getting used to a new professional occupation is not easy. Yet Mira was firmly set on improving her family’s life conditions and she had no choice but to learn a new trade. By now she and her husband no longer need to consult others about the right steps to follow when planting and growing their crops. Mira has requested this loan as she and her husband need to buy diesel fuel at wholesale prices. They are really hoping to be able to obtain this loan and to purchase fuel. Other members of Mira’s group: Altynbek Z. is 25 years old. He is already married and has a son, born just a month ago. Altynbek’s sister, to whom he helps with expenses, also lives with the family. In order to support his family, Altynbek works as an informatics teacher. In addition, he is actively working in agriculture. He needs a loan to purchase diesel fuel. Gulzat T. is 43 years old. She is a widow, raising three children on her own. She does agricultural work in order to support her family. Right now she has a pressing need for fuel, but she lacks the financial means for it. She has requested this credit as she trusts that she will be able to manage it all. Talaikul I. is a widow. She has educated her four children herself and is still providing for them as best she can. She does farming, growing various vegetables, and at this moment she is really hoping to obtain this loan, which will allow her to purchase diesel fuel.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase 150 liters [of diesel fuel]

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who also help out with the family expenses. He has been working as a security officer for the past 10 years, but the last 6 years he has been working on his own as per the clients' request. This type of business became popular in Lebanon due to the instability situation during the last few years.
He is requesting a $1,000 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l in order to buy a special suit and a stun gun.

loans.use: to buy a special suit and a stun gun

loans.name: Goussi

texts.en: Mrs. Goussi D. sells cereals in her home town of Lomé. She’s been selling cereals since 2005 and is now taking her first loan from WAGES. She is 37 years old and married to a printer. They have one child. Mrs. D. uses her income from selling cereals to help support her family and the raising of her child. She has requested a loan of 150,000 CFA to purchase more grains to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to resell

loans.name: Luamoana

texts.en:
Luamoana A., a 41-year-old married mother of four children, has owned a business venture running bingo games for the past two years. She is now requesting a loan, her third from SPBD, for WST$2250 to purchase game prizes. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the enterprise. In 2007, Luamoana joined SPBD. SPBD's loans are Luamoana's only access to capital because she has never qualified for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase game prizes

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Brgy. Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Aida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sale. Aida is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sam Maraneh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Sam Maraneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, making more sales and better profit. 

Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Magburaka. She is forty-one years of age, married, with two children who are attending secondary school. Fatmata has been in business for many years now; she sells drinks and clothes. She will use this loan to buy more drinks and clothes to add to her business. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy more drinks and clothes to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 48 years old and married with four children who are 4, 6, 10 and 12 years old.  Athanase is commonly known for selling milk. To this end, he has to purchase additional cows in order to get a large quantity of milk to sell. 

Athanase's target is to become financially stable through the operations of his business. He needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to reach his target.  If his target is reached, he will continue providing all the basic needs to his family and keep expanding his business for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional cows

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Faustina; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías en el distrito de Urubamba, ella vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m  en forma independiente, la socia quiere tener un local donde pueda vender las artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanías como carteras, mantas muñecas y trabajos en arcilla.
 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Faustina, 36, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with crafts sales in Urubamba district. She sells from 6am until 6pm independently. She wants to have a locale to sell her crafts. She is asking for funds to buy crafts like purses, blankets, dolls and clay items. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts like purses, blankets, dolls and clay items.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es: Santos Emilio Munguía Ramos tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el Barrio El Centro, en el Municipio de San Esteban, Olancho. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y sus cuatro hijos de 9, 8, 6 y 3 años. Santos posee una pequeña pulpería que atiende todos los días desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. Él trabaja junto a su esposa con el deseo de poder brindarles a sus hijos todo lo básico y necesario para su sostenimiento. Él solicita este préstamo para poder comprar una mayor cantidad de productos y así mantener bien surtida su pulpería. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Santos podrá comprar al contado la mercadería que necesita para incrementar su inventario y así mejorar el precio de venta para sus clientes. Sus sueños son poder extender su negocio a otros lugares de la comunidad y obtener más ganancias para poder brindarles a sus hijos la educación que necesitan para tengan mejores oportunidades de desarrollarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Santos Emilio Munguía Ramos is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Centro in San Esteban municipality, Olancho. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the home, and their 4 children, ages 9, 8, 6, and 3. Santos owns a small store that he attends to everyday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. He and his wife work hard, with the goal of providing for their children's basic needs. Santos requests this loan so that he can buy a greater quantity of products and keep his store well-stocked. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy merchandise at wholesale prices, so that he can increase his inventory while offering lower prices to this customers. Santos dreams of expanding his business to other locations in his community, thereby increasing his income and providing his children with the education they need to have better opportunities to develop in life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, beans, rice, pasta, churros, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma D. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Nelma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelma owns and operates a retail store, selling blankets, clothing and shoes in the local community. Nelma has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nelma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken by Nelma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nicho Lite

texts.en:
Nicho Lite M. is from the town of Siayan. He is 26 years old. Nicho Lite is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nicho Lite owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling a variety of meats in the local community. Nicho Lite has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earn approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nicho Lite joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicho Lite has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nicho Lite is requesting a new loan of 60000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nicho Lite from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Nouy Sokheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nouy S., president of this village bank, is 42 years old, and has been selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to support their businesses.  The members who make up this village bank are twenty-three people who live in Anlong Slat village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Nouy S. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family while her husband, Mr. Bun Pom, is a fisherman who can earn some money to support his family. 

Her problem is that her husband’s fishing supply is too old to use. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Nouy S. is applying for a loan to buy  a fishing net to replace his old one. 

She is a mother of eight children, two are babysitters who get a low salary, four are studying in the local village, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy new fishing net

loans.name: Vida Abundante Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vida Abundante está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Margarita del Carmen A. de 30 años propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 10 años la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosas y chiverias.  Ella trabaja arduamente por sus tres hijos de 14, 11 y él bebe de 14 meses por quienes desea superarse.
Las otras integrantes son Victoria G. quien vende ropa y María del Socorro T. quien vende ropa desde hace 10 años.
texts.en: The group Vida Abundante (Abundant Life) is made up of three hard-working, courageous and enterprising women.  One of the members is Margarita del Carmen A..  She is 30 years old and 10 years ago she started her grocery store by selling soft drinks and snacks.  She works arduously for her three children, ages 14, 11 and the baby, 14 months.  It is because of them, that she wants to better herself.  The other members are Victoria G., who sells clothing, and María del Socorro T., who has been selling clothing for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa Estela, resiD. en Jucuapa departamento D. Usulután, donD. vive con su esposo e hijos D. las edades 6 y 18 años, el negocio es la venta D. ropa, es propio, lo atienD. D. 8:00am á 5:00pm, lo inicio hace 5 años por iniciativa propia, doña Rosa tiene 39 años D. edad.
Ella quiere impulsar su negocio hacia el crecimiento dentro del mercado, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas D. vestir, D. esta manera se está preparando para la mayor demanda que se acerca en temporada naviD.ña, aprovechado para tener mayores ganancias y la preferencia D. muchas personas.
Sueña con ser una empresaria con el negocio fuerte, con mucha clientela, y contribuir a mejorar los ingresos D. la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela lives in Jucuapa in the Usulutan department with her husband and children aged 6 to 18 years.  She has a business selling clothing.  It is her own business, and she attends to her shop from 8am until 5pm.  She started this business 5 years ago on her own initiative.  Rosa is 39 years old.

Rosa wants to propel her business toward growth in the marketplace, and so she requests a loan to buy clothing such as blouses, trousers, and dress shirts.  In this way, she is preparing for the greater demand that occurs as we approach the Christmas season.  She wants to take advantage of this so that she can have greater earnings and attract many customers.

She dreams of being a businesswoman with a strong business that has many customers, so that she can contribute more to the family income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers and dress shirts

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two sons. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka. Igor owns two big greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale. He started this business 11 years ago. Currently, he grows 3,000 tall-grown tomatoes every year. Igor has invested 25,000 UAH in this business. His expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 10,000 to 13,000 UAH every year.
Igor is seeking a loan of 7,500 UAH to construct an additional greenhouse for tomato seedlings. He has potential for further growth and development of his business. Igor is planning to construct a few more greenhouses in the future.

loans.use: To construct an additional greenhouse for seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothing articles like blouses, underclothes, socks, t-shirts and hand bags

loans.name: Dora Glicet

texts.es:
Dora Clicet tiene 49 años de edad tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, con el apoyo económico del esposo ya que en la colonia donde vive no vendían verduras ni productos de consumo diario, los cuales le generaron ganancias,  obtuvo un crédito con el cual logro instalar una mini tienda obteniendo mas ganancias y pudo ampliar la tienda, además vende comida (tamales y chuchitos) los fines de semana. En el negocio es ayudada por las hijas. 

Ella solicita FAPE que la siga apoyando con un crédito para seguir adelante y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora Clicet is 49 years old, and she has six grown children.  She is married.  She started her business ten years ago with financial support from her husband.  She started because no one in her neighborhood sold vegetables or daily consumption products, which generate income for her.

Using a loan that she got she managed to set up a mini store.  With the increase in earnings she was able to expand the store and sell food (different types of tamales) on the week-ends. Her daughters help her with the business.

She asks that FAPE continue supporting her with a loan.  She wants the loan in order to get ahead and be able to give her children a better future.

loans.use: To buy daily consumption food products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is 30 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Erlinda runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and toothpaste to the local community. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snacks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicine for resale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, tiene 37 años de edad, nació en la ciudad Ollantaytambo del departamento de Cusco y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Faustina se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Faustina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas y comprar alimento para las gallinas.  

Faustina pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Faustina is 37 years old and was born in the city of Ollantaytambo in the department of Cusco but lives in the city of Urubamba in the same department.  Faustina raises guinea pigs, pigs and hens.  She has been in the business for two years and is very successful at it thanks to her hard work.  Faustina is in need of a loan to buy hens and feed.

She is a member of the "Mainique" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy hens and feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Helen is a farmer. She grows rice that she sells to her community. Aside from rice farming, Helen also grows pigs and ducks. She sells the pigs and the duck eggs at the market. Helen works hard to help provide for the increasing needs in her household.

Helen requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She is hoping her harvest will increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Bertha Claudia

texts.es: Bertha Claudia tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de hot dog, hamburguesa, gaseosas y sopas. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a disfrutar de sus diferentes productos, inicio este negocio por su esposo que fue quien le ayudo con el poco capital de trabajo compraron ciertos productos y fue así que lograron observar que establecer este tipo de negocios es muy rentable. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsas, pan, carne, salchichas, sopas, gaseosas, jugos, entre otras cosas.  Desea que su hijo sea un profesional y logre obtener un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Bertha Claudia is 44 years old and sells hot dogs, hamburgers, sodas and soups.  Her customers enjoy her variety of products.  She began her business with the help of her husband who invested in the first products she needed to get established, since they could see this was a profitable endeavor.

She plans to use the loan to buy bags, bread, meat, sausages, soups, sodas, juices and other items.  Her wish is to see her son become a professional and have access to a good job.

loans.use: To buy bags, bread, meat, sausages, soups, sodas, juices and other items.

loans.name: Libia Ester

texts.es:
Hace 7 años Libia A. decidió montar su propia sala de belleza como una solución para salir de la difícil situación económica que enfrentaba su familia para aquella época; por eso se capacitó y poco a poco fue perfeccionando sus técnicas hasta alcanzar un reconocimiento en su barrio como la mejor del sector en su oficio.
 
La sala de belleza está ubicada en su casa donde fue reformando el espacio para tener un lugar acogedor y cómodo donde atender a sus clientes, sin embargo aún hay arreglos que cree necesarios pero que, por falta de presupuesto, no ha podido realizar. Dentro de las adecuaciones quiere poner una ventana que le proporcione luz al espacio y además pintar tanto el exterior como el interior de la sala de belleza para darle un poco de vida y estatus al lugar. Es por esto que hoy Libia Ester busca un crédito que le ayude a cumplir sus propósitos, y así darle más posicionamiento a su negocio y tener más insumos para poder atender a sus clientes con mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Seven years ago, Libia Ester A. decided to start her own beauty salon as a solution to a difficult economic situation that her family was faced with back then. This is why she took upon herself to learn this craft and, little by little, was able to perfect her technique to the point that she is now recognized in her neighborhood as the best in her line of work.

The beauty salon is located in her home where she has been developing a welcoming and comfortable space for attending her clients. However, there are still some necessary renovations that she has not yet been able to do due to budgetary constraints. One of the planned improvements is to install a window that would provide more light and also to paint both the inside and the outside of the salon to give it a more attractive and lively appearance. 

It is for this reason that Libia Ester decided to seek a loan that would allow her to accomplish her goals in giving a better positioning for her business and a better quality of service to her clients.

loans.use: to renovate a beauty salon and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married, with two children. He is a market vendor from Melitopol. Vladimir sells TVs, DVDs, hairdryers, etc. He has been working in this sphere of trade for 15 years. Presently, Vladimir has about 45,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His income amounts to 7,500 Grivnyas every month.  

Vladimir is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted household electric appliances for further retail sale at a vending kiosk. He is planning to buy assorted hairdryers, irons, CD players, tea kettles, etc., and thus diversify the selection of items he offers for sale. Vladimir is planning to do some remodeling and make some improvements in his house using generated profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of household electric appliances

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with 3 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees. 

For the past 6 years, she has been selling clothes especially for men.  She sells wholesale, retail, at the market and from door to door. Her major challenge is seasonality.  During the December holidays she has many customers purchasing clothes, compared to other months where sales are very low.  Rebecca dreams of establishing a well-stocked boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sodas, mineral water and a freezer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of sodas, mineral water and a freezer.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Sra. Guillermina tiene 60 años D. edad. Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, patos y gallos D. pelea. Ella es casada. Su esposo percibe un ingreso mensual por su pensión D. jubilación. Viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Tate Camino GranD.. Su vivienda está siendo lentamente reconstruida  con sus esfuerzos después del terremoto del año 2007. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora. Su sueño es incrementar la crianza D. animales tener mayor ingresos y así poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
La Sra. Guillermina se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le estamos brindando con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
La Sra. Guillermina tiene 60 años D. edad. Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, patos y gallos D. pelea. Ella es casada. Su esposo percibe un ingreso mensual por su pensión D. jubilación. Viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Tate Camino GranD.. Su vivienda está siendo lentamente reconstruida  con sus esfuerzos después del terremoto del año 2007. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora. Su sueño es incrementar la crianza D. animales tener mayor ingresos y así poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
La Sra. Guillermina se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le estamos brindando con este financiamiento.

loans.use: Incrementar la crianza de animales

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La señora Emma y su esposo el señor Hector tienen ya mas de 26 años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera y venta de ellos.
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que a su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas materia como es madera, pegamento, clavos y pinturas para la madera, no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la inversión que necesitan, ya que tiene varios pedidos de muebles para elaborar y por falta del material no han podido entregar estos pedidos a tiempo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Emma and her husband Hector have been making and selling wooden furniture for 26 years.

They are requesting a loan as their business needs more material such as wood, adhesive, nails and wood paint but they do not have the money they need to invest.  They have several orders for furniture and, owing to a lack of material, they haven't been able to deliver these orders on time.

Emma plans to repay her loan with some of the profits that she makes in her business since this is the source of income that she has for her family.

loans.use: to buy material for her business

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johana, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de dos años. El marido es comerciante de pescado. Para ella este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos han podido salir adelante en su negocio.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio del marido el cual vende mariscos en el mercado numero uno de Portoviejo. Allí él vende pescado, camarones, conchas, entre otros mariscos, nos dice nuestra amiga que su esposo se va de madrugada al mercado a esperar que lleguen los comerciantes mayoristas para luego él comprar sus productos y tener para la venta diaria, luego espera a que lleguen sus clientes a este lugar para hacer sus compras para el hogar, él trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 18h00 y viene realizando esta actividad por mas de seis años.

Este crédito es para comprar  pescado, camarón, conchas entre otros productos del mar.
 
Su sueño  es tener un buen local para vender sus productos.
texts.en: In La Paz is the city of Portoviejo, known in colonial times as Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, where every fortnight the members of the communal lender 5 De Septiembre meet.  Johana is one member who is 21, married and mother of a 2-year old son.  Her husband has been a fish seller in the market of Portoviejo for the last 6 years, where he sells fish, shrimp, shellfish and other seafood, buying product wholesale early in the morning and selling in the afternoons.  Johana has sought credit 3 times before, and is grateful for allowing her to grow her family's business.  She hopes to one day be able to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and seafood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last three years. She is 38 years old, married to John, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Margaret hopes to become a successful farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Camino Al Mar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Camino al Mar” conformado por 17 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de leña, artesanía, venta de huevos, criadero de gallinas, preparación de mermeladas y venta de hortalizas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Marina presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto aparece en el primer lugar de la fila de derecha a izquierda, usa una boina color café y viste una chaqueta color negro. Ella se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente teje en un telar, ha realizado diferentes tipos de cursos, que le han permitido instruirse en el rubro. Comenzó en éste rubro desde hace 6 meses.
Actualmente está terminando un curso de telar y expondrá lo aprendido en una feria de artesanía. Además se inscribió nuevamente en un taller de telar mapuche.
Sus materiales, específicamente lanas las compra en un depósito, estas deben ser de color blanco para que las pueda teñir con colores naturales, que ella misma prepara, buscando matices de arboles. Para esto necesita sulfato y fijador. 
Con los telares realiza alfombras, bajadas de cama, tapices y bufandas. Con el crédito comprará lanas hiladas y blancas. 
Sus metas son instalar su negocio con un local establecido en una feria artesanal. 
Marina vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 28 y 16 años de edad, sus sueños son poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza. Ya que con éste capital podrá invertir en su negocio, lo que le permitirá generar más ganancias. Respecto al grupo comenta que todos son muy comprometidos, tanto con la institución, como con cada uno de sus negocios. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Camino al Mar” (Road to the Sea) and has 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of occupations like: firewood sales, crafts making, egg sales, raising chickens, jam making and vegetable sales.  All of them are from Puerto Montt.

Marina, communal bank President, in the photo is in the fist spot from right to left wearing a brown cap and black jacket.  She is a crafts person, specifically, she weaves on a loom.  She has taken several courses that have instructed her in this line of work.  She started the work six months ago.

She is currently about to finish her weaving course and will exhibit what she learned at a crafts fair.  In addition, she’s signed up for a course to learn traditional Mapuche weaving.  

Her supplies, specifically yarn, are purchased at a warehouse.  These must be plain white so that she can dye them with natural dyes that she herself prepares aiming for tree-like hues.  She needs sulfate and fixative for this.  She makes rugs, bed skirts, wall hangings and mufflers on her looms.
Her goals are to set up her business in an established locale at a crafts market.  Marina lives with her husband and two children who are 28 and 16 years of age.  Her dream is to be able to provide them with better quality of life. 

She is very happy with and grateful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza because she’ll be able to invest this capital in her business and that will lead to more profits.  With respect to the group, she comments that they are all very committed both to the institution and to each one of their businesses.

Puerto Montt is a city in south Chile located in the Los Lagos region.  Among Puerto Montt’s attractions are its beautiful, green scenery, its uncrowded beaches, its cuisine and especially the reputation of its fish, seafood and crafts.  It’s also the entryway to the Isla Grande de Chiloé, rich in tradition and legends.

loans.use: to buy threaded wool and plain wool.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth, tiene la edad 49 de  años, está casada y vive con su hija y la mamá. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de maquinas de coser. Ella  cuenta con un local y pretende invertir la compra de maquinas de coser para darle un aprovechamiento al local. Ella quiere implantar un negocio de costuras para vender ropa en el mercado local y lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de venta de ropa y costurería en general. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yamileth is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her daughter and mother. She intends to buy a sewing machine with the loan. She has a locale and intends to buy sewing machines to take advantage of it. She wants to open a seamstress business to sell clothes in the local market and in other areas. She wants to generate more income for her and her family's wellbeing as well as to grow her clothes selling and general sewing project. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans before in regular banks, but a FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with easier payments and much lower interest.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas de Sivicani”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el   Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que invirtió en compra de artefactos como equipos de sonidos, televisores, DVD,  etc.
Con su nuevo préstamo solicitado de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos equipos de sonidos,  estos los compra en Tacna y los vende los domingos en Ilave y los sábados en Puno,  en el negocio le ayuda su esposo, también trabaja como  operador de tractor.
Su sueño es tener su casa, carro propio y seguir con el negocio para obtener ganancias y tener su propio capital.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Kantutas de Sivicani” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Carmen has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her previous loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and was invested in the purchase of appliances such as sound equipment, televisions, DVD players, and other items.

With the new loan she requested in the amount of 1000 PEN, Carmen will buy two sets of sound equipment. She will buy these items in Tacna and sell them either on Sundays in Ilave or on Saturdays in Puno. Her husband helps her with managing her business, but he also works as a tractor operator.

Carmen’s dream is to have a house, her own car, and to continue with her business so that she can generate income and have her own capital. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the punctuality and the discussions.

loans.use: to buy two sets of sound equipment.

loans.name: Maria Estrella

texts.en:
Maria Estrella is single and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. (Abaca is the fiber of a palm leaf.) Maria Estrella has been in this business for three years. Maria Estrella works hard to support her family. 

Maria Estrella requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her abaca weaving business.

In the future, Maria Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Ligia Monabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ligia, tiene 31 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus tres hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, los mayores está estudiando en colegio y el menor en escuela. Ella vive sola con sus hijos.

Ella después de que su esposo falleció tuvo que dedicarse a realizar el trabajo sola ya que antes trabajaban juntos,  ella se dedica a la venta de pescado,  tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad Portoviejo en el cual vende todo tipo de pescado ya sea pescados pequeños o por libras. Trabaja de jueves a domingo desde las 5h00 hasta las 18h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio despues de cumplir con sus estudios, nos cuenta que lleva 9 años dedicada a esta actividad, el pescado lo compran a comerciantes en el mismo mercado. 

Este crédito es para invertirlo en comprar pescado para surtir su negocio. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es socia fundadora y le gusta por la  responsabilidad del grupo.

Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Virgen de Guadalupe' community bank meet in Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we meet 31-year-old Ligia.  Several years ago Ligia's beloved husband died and left her alone with her three children aged 14, 12 and 9.  The older children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  She lives alone with her children.

After her husband died, Ligia had to start working alone as she used to work together with her husband.  Her business is selling fish.  She has a stall in the market in the city of Portoviejo where she sells all kinds of fish, both small fish and fish by the pound.  She works from Thursday to Sunday, from 5.00am to 6.00pm.  Her children help her in the business when they finish school.  She tells us that she has been in this business for nine years.  She buys her fish from salespeople in the market.

Ligia will use this loan to invest in buying fish with which to stock her business.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank.  She is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because of the responsibility shown by the group.

Ligia's dream is for her children to never want for anything.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 33-year-old lady who is married to Ali, a truck driver. She has been working from her house in flower arranging to help her husband in improving their living level.

Now Reham has applied for this loan to start another business besides what she does, which is selling home products such as kitchen tools (plates, pans, etc), and expand her current business among Madaba, where she lives.

Because Reham is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Ali appear in the photo.

loans.use: To start a retail business selling home products such as kitchen tools

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Tulcán. María se describe como una persona muy responsable, sencilla, humilde y tranquila. 

Trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de cerdos de engorde para posteriormente sacar al mercado para su venta. Es es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado para la compra de crías de cerdos para su crianza que servirá para que su negocio crezca.

Su sueño es que su familia se mantenga con buena salud y que su negocio le siga dando ingresos para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en: María, 47, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in Tulcán.  She describes herself as a very responsible, unassuming, humble and calm person.  She works with her husband raising pigs to later take to market to be sold.  This is her second loan request to Fodemi and she’ll use it to buy litters of piglets to raise so that her business will grow.  Her dream is that her family stays healthy and that her business continues to produce income so that she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Julita sells fish for a living. She sells his husband's catch and also buys fish from other fishermen. Julita does her best to help provide for her family. She has requested a loan to purchase fish traps, an ice box, and other materials. Julita hopes to have a successful business. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fish traps, ice box, and other materials.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 26 years old and single. For the past three years, he has sold second-hand clothes. Clement earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

Clement is requesting his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase more clothing to sell. He will use his anticipated profit to expand his business. In the future, Clement hopes to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is 18 years old and single. He runs an M-pesa (mobile phone based money transfer) shop. He has been in business for two years.  

Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 26,000. He is borrowing KES 50,000 to increase the float (stored-value credits) in his business. Hillary plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business and to open another M-pesa location. 

This is Hillary's first loan. He hopes and dreams to run a big business and to be a role model in the area.

loans.use: to add float (stored-value credits) to the business.

loans.name: Simon Maina

texts.en:
Simon has been selling new clothes for the past five years and he earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family. He has repaid his previous loans in good time.

Simon is requesting his third loan with KADET LTD to buy new clothes to add to his business. He will expand his business with the anticipated profit from his loan. Simon’s hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale boutique which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell for the festival season

loans.name: Lum Orng's Group

texts.en:
Lum Orng, aged 31, is a married mother with two children, who are still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district and has been selling Khmer noodles to earn a living for nearly seven years. 
With her current business, she earns 20 U.S. dollars per day and can only save around 1.5 U.S. dollars per day after family and business expenses. 

Lum Orng leads a group of two female members. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan to buy rice to make Khmer noodles for her business. 
With this loan, she hopes to make more Khmer noodles, so as to earn more income and thereby enabling her to build up some savings for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice for her Khmer noodle business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 24-year-old young woman who is married with no children yet. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. Aya has a beauty salon located in a good area close to the place where she lives. The income she earns from the salon helps her and her husband with their living expenses. 

Aya wants to make some improvements to the salon such as painting, installing lights, and making some decorations. She also wants to buy new beauty salon kits including hair creams, different types of hair brushes, hair dryers, etc. She would like to request a loan from FATEN to help her buy these things. 

When Aya gets the loan, she will be able to pay for the necessary improvements to her salon and will be able to purchase new beauty salon kits.
