This will enable her to improve her salon and share the living expenses with her husband which will improve their living conditions. Aya is a conservative woman, so her husband Abdullateef is photographed instead.

loans.use: To improve the beauty salon's condition and purchase new beauty salon kits.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Mr. Loh is 55 years old and works as a construction foreman around Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. According to his skills and experiences in this work, he is able to earn a good income of $8.00 per day. He has a common-law relationship with his wife who helps him generate income by selling fresh fish in a market in the city. This couple has been blessed with five children.

For his first loan, Loh will buy a used motorcycle to better his living conditions. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to provide his children a better standard of living and further education.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia pudo surtir su puesto de abarrotes y vendió toda su mercadería. Ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más mercadería y continuar generando ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Esta será la segunda vez que desea que su crédito sea enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Cecilia was able to restock her grocery store where she sells all types of merchandise. Now she is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise so that she can generate income to support her children.

This is the second time that she wants her loan request to be sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 04/05/2010.IL est composé de membres issus de la même zone.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Celle qui est à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras ,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 05 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de riz et de l'huile.Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter 02 bidons de 20 l d'huile à 20000f et 04 sacs de riz de 50kg à 15000f le sac.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et d'assurer les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group was created 04/05/2010. It is composed of members who come from the same community. Their main occupations are running small businesses.

The representative of the group is shown in the photo on the far right, with her arm raised. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five girls. Her small business is the sale of rice and oil. She has been running this business for several years.

With this ​​loan, she intends to buy two 20-liter cans of oil at 20,000 Francs, and four 50kg sacks of rice at 15,000 Francs per sack. Her aim is to increase her savings and be able to pay for daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for resale.

loans.name: Lucelinda Daisy

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Orquídeas en la ciudad de Guayaquil.  Se dedicó a esta actividad debido a que pudo percatarse de que al tener otro ingreso mejoraría  su vida familiar.  Labora en su negocio de venta de comidas junto a una persona que le ayuda desde las 7 am hasta la noche.  Es casada y su esposo ejerce la función de guardia en una empresa.  Tiene un hijo menor de edad, quien estudia en el colegio fiscal del área donde habita.  A futuro planea construír un segundo piso para su casa, ver culminar los estudios de su hijo e incrementar su negocio.  Ahora requiere el dinero del préstamo para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the sector of Orquídeas in the city of Guayaquil.  She has been involved in this business because she thought it would be a good idea to have another income for improving her family’s life.  Her business involves selling food and she works with another person who helps her from 7:00 A.M. until nightfall.  

The borrower is married and her husband works for a company as a security guard.  They have a child who is attending a state high school in the area where they live.  In the future, she plans to build a second floor to her house, see her son finish his studies, and expand her business.  For now, she needs the money from this loan for home improvements.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Carlos Medardo

texts.es: Carlos tienen 38 años, es originario de la comunidad de San Antonio donde viviò hasta la edad de 15 años. Estudió hasta segundo grado de primaria en la escuela de la comunidad de San Antonio, no pudo continuar sus estudio ya que se dedicó a trabajar en agricultura con su padre; a la edad de 15 años tuvo que viajar fuera de su país para seguir trabajando y poder ahorrar dinero y poder ayudar a sus padres. A la edad de 32 años regresó a su país y contrajo matrimonio pero actualmente no tiene hijos. Carlos actualmente vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y se dedica a las labores del campo, junto con su esposa quien se dedica a la comercialización de productos lácteos. Producto de su arduo trabajo han podido construir su casa, sin embargo no cuentan con energía eléctrica, hace algún tiempo se decidieron a comprar un panel solar para poder tener energía eléctrica y poco a poco posteriormente irían comprando los demás accesorios para completar el sistema solar. Es por esa razón que hoy está aplicando a un crédito y de esta manera adquirir el resto de los accesorios que le hacen falta para completar el sistema solar.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old, and he comes from the community of San Antonio, where he lived until he was 15.  He studied until the second grade of primary school in San Antonio's community school. He was unable to continue his education, as he devoted himself to farming with his father. At age 15 he had to travel far from his country in order to continue working and be able to save money so that he could help his parents.  At age 32, he returned to his country and got married, but he does not have any children currently. 

Currently, Carlos lives in the same community where he was born, and he devotes himself to farming along with his wife, who sells dairy products.  The result of their hard work is that they have been able to build their house. However, they don't have electricity. Some time ago, they decided to purchase a solar panel so that they would be able to have electricity, and since then they have been purchasing the other accessories to complete the solar system gradually.

That is the reason that he is applying for a loan today, and in this way he will acquire the rest of the accessories that are needed to complete the solar system.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for a solar system.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a farmer and salesperson from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She keeps livestock and practices crop farming for a living. On her farm, she has dairy cows, poultry, crops and a side hustle business she does. Dorcas generates additional income from brokering cereal grains. She buy cereals from local farmers and sells to her neighbours and nearby markets at a higher price. Given that she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to stock large volumes of cereal produce. She is seeking a loan to buy more cereal grains from local farmers, which she will later sell at a higher price, using her understanding of the market conditions and prices. Income from this investment will help Dorcas generate enough income to meet her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жамила успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, и благодарить Вас за поддержку. Она очень рада, что Вы ей не отказались в помощи. Жамила на протяжении 4 года занимается животноводством. Для нее данная деятельность является единственным источником дохода. Жамила очень ответственно подходить к своему делу. В ее деле помогает старший сын.  У нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота Жамила необходимо определенная сумма денег. Она намерена на заемные деньги приобрести скотов и сохранить бизнес. Именно с этой целью она обратился к Вам за помощью и верит, что его заявка не останется нерассмотренной. Жамила верит в вас и на Вашу доброту.

loans.use: Для увеличения поголовья скота и сохранения бизнеса

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angella A. is a wife and mother of 4 children. She has an additional 6 people that she stays with in their home and cares for them all.

This bussiness is dealing in various types of produce. She started by planting an acre of cassava, 500 suckers (seedlings) of pineapples, 1 acre of maize, groundnuts. She sold these and realized some profit which she used for buying a pig and bicycle. She has also been able to take her children to school. The agricultural business is growing with expectation of more harvest this season.

She now buys her items in small quatity because of little money in the capital. But given a loan of $500, she plans to increase her stock by buying other types of produce that is in the market but her money is not enough to buy enough to fetch her good profit.

Right now, she can buy up to 500 Kilograms of produce. When she gets the loan money, the stock will go to 1000 Kilograms.

She is a dedicated lady in her bussiness. She attained a business skills training with Village Enterprise Fund and will be keen to use the training to handle and repay the loan in a timely way.

loans.use: Buying other types of produce that is in higher demand in the market. The stock will go to 1000 Kilograms.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
My name is Azucena G. and I sell new men's and women's clothing such as shirts, jeans, socks, blouses, and dress shirts. I have had my business for 2 years and I have a good clientel because I sell high quality products at reasonable prices, fit for our community. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a wider variety of products and with the additional earnings I will be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Azucena G. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para caballero y dama como ser camisas, jeans, calsonetas, blusas, camisas de vestir, tengo mi negocio hcae 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto es de muy buena calidad y lo vendo a un precio justo para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Yao

texts.en: Yao is a brick molder and runs his own business, T.'s Block Work. He is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. He is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva for working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina S. V. is 25, married, with three children. She'll buy a horse and a lamb to raise to sell. The people in this remote area of northern Guatemala take advantage of the rich green slopes to pasture many animals, but mostly sheep. Herds of sheep and the occasional goat pass by far more often than vehicles do. She wants to use this opportunity to work together with her husband to help support the family.

Catarina is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a horse and a lamb

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
CATALINA is 33 years old and has four children. Her husband is a trader and he works selling fruits and vegetables in the city of Tuxtla Gutiérrez. She works buying blankets and making blouses, napkins, and tablecloths, which she then embroiders and sells in the city of San Cristóbal. She belong to the solidarity group Alaxa 3, along with Ms. Pascuala Hernández Vásquez (artisan), Ms. María Hernández Hernández (artisan), Ms. Cristina Pascuaza Montejo (artisan), and Ms. María Pérez Pérez (artisan). With the loan they will invest in their businesses, buying fabric and thread.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CATALINA, tiene 33 años, cuatro hijos, su esposo es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez. Ella se dedica a comprar manta y confecciona blusas, servilletas y manteles, luego los borda y sale a vender a la ciudad de San Cristóbal. Pertenece al grupo Alaxa 3 junto con doña Pascuala Hernández Vásquez (artesana), doña María Hernández Hernández(artesana) y doña Cristina Pascuaza Montejo (artesana) y doña María Pérez Pérez (artesana). Con el préstamo invertirán en sus negocios comprando géneros e hilos.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Paulina O. is 39-years-old. She is married to Braulio Ganoso, who is 36. They have 4 children, 3 girls and 1 boy, of whom 3 are of school age.

The couple has a butcher's shop and a small grocery store in their home. They have all of the necessary elements, and thanks to their attention and the good quality of their products, they have a large quantity of clients. Her husband also practices agriculture, raises cattle, and has a motorcycle shop.

Paulina and her husband are very beloved people in the area. Everyone knows them as very hard-working and enterprising people. Paulina hopes to buy more merchandise for her grocery store with the loan, such as rice, noodles, meat, chicken, canned goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Paulina O. tiene 39 años, esta casada con el señor Braulio Ganoso, que tiene 36 años de edad; ellos tienen 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y 1 varón, de los cuales 3 estan ya van a la escuela para estudiar.

La pareja tiene una carnicería y despensa en su casa. Poseen todos los elementos necesarios, y gracias a la buena atención y calidad de sus productos, poseen una gran cantidad de clientes. Su marido además de dedicarse a la agricultura y cría de animales vacunos, también posee un taller de motos.

Paulina y su esposo son personas muy queridas en la zona, todos los conocen como personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ella desea el crédito para comprar mercaderías para su despensa, tales como arroz, fideos, carnes, pollos, productos enlatados, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise:  rice, noodles, meat, chicken, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en: I have five children: two boys and three girls. I live with my family in a small brick house in Multan, Pakistan. All of my children are enrolled in a local school here in Multan. I wind thread on plastic spools that my husband uses, at his power looms to manufacture cloth. We need to expand our current business for which we require a loan of $200.

loans.use: Expand cloth manufacturing business

loans.name: Total 2083(D) Group

texts.en:
Betty N. is 40 years old and married with four children. She runs a retail shop. With the business profits she earns, she wants to start a beauty salon business. Oliver sells fresh foods. Justine wants to use this loan to buy a fridge for her restaurant. Mary and Betty N. own beauty salons.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Muhofah North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Catherine I.. She is currently in the business of operating a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries. Catherine is 50 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 20 to 30. Each week, Catherine makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a better grocery store. Catherine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Catherine is joined in her small group by M. S., Christine Muhofa, Harriet N., and Zaina N.. M. S. has a business selling cold drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Christine Muhofa is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase stock. Harriet N. operates a business selling used clothing and wants to add working capital. Zaina N. is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To increase stock in grocery store

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex Taky M. is married and has 4 children.  He recently opened a general provision store in Elmina where he sells a wide variety of items.  He is requesting $525 so he can further expand his selection to include food products, which he currently lacks. Alex is also the president of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To add food products to his general store

loans.name: Dilma

texts.es:
Dilma is the principal breadwinner for her family, ensuring the health and security of her husband, children, and elderly parents. Dilma owns a guinea pig farm and earns a substantial amount from selling these animals. The high demand for guinea pigs has led Dilma to ask for a loan to expand her market and acquire more animals in order to make her farm the best in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Dilma, es la principal fuente de ingresos que provee bienestar y seguridad a su amado hijos y a sus ancianos padres, posee un criadero de cuyes y semana a semana obtiene sustanciales ganacias gracias a al comercialización de los mismos. La gran demanda de sus productos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su mercado y adquirir mayor número de ejemplares con el objetivo de convertirse en la mejor criadora de cuyes de su ciudad.

loans.use: Acquire a larger quantity of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and materials.

loans.name: Ana Adilia

texts.es:
In the town of Chinandega, at the market Santa Ana, doña Ana Adilia G. has a general store where she sells all kinds of products like food, items for personal care and housecleaning to her clients.

For 7 years she has done this for a living and has achieved improvements thanks to her great efforts and the support from Ceprodel which has helped her improve her condition. Presently she has approached Ceprodel once more to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase more products for her business. She has received a total of 18 loans and each of them has been repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, en el Mercado Santa Ana, la señora Ana Adilia G. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual ofrece todo tipo de productos como comestibles, personales y del hogar para sus clientes que le visitan.

Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 7 años habiendo alcanzado mejoras gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel, el cual le ha servido para mejorar su condición. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo de Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su negocio. Ella posee un total de 18 créditos habiéndose destacado en el cumplimiento de los pagos de cada uno de estos.

loans.use: Purchase products to be sold at general store.

loans.name: Melody

texts.es:
Melody and her husband have 2 children, now of school age, and like all parents they want their children to achieve more than they have. That’s not to say that they have not achieved anything, both continue to work hard. This couple own 2 tuk-tuks (three wheeled vehicles) which they use to transport passengers. One is driven by César, Melody’s husband, and the other by a driver who they contract. At the same time, Melody has a clothing business, which she hopes to rent a premises for, as she currently is keeping all the stock in her house and selling it to her neighbors and friends, going door to door. Melody is requesting this loan to pay for maintenance on her tuk-tuks so that they continue to function well, and also to buy different stock for her clothing business so that she can diversify and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Melody y su esposo tienen 2 hijos que aún están en la escuela, como todo padre, ellos desean que sus hijos puedan surgir más de lo que ellos lo hicieron hasta hoy, pero eso no significa que su avance haya menguado, ya que siguen trabajando duramente por su propia superación. Esta pareja es propietaria de 2 motocarros, lo que usan para el transporte de pasajeros, uno de ellos es manejado por César, esposo de Melody y el otro por un chofer que ellos contratan para esa labor. Paralelamente Melody tiene un negocio de ropa, en el cual espera alquilar un local para ello, ya que por el momento tiene la mercadería en su casa y la va ofreciendo a sus vecinos y amigos de puerta en puerta.El motivo del pedido de préstamo de Melody es para pagar el mantenimiento de sus motocarros para que tengan un mejor desempeño, y por otro lado para la compra de variedad de ropa para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: To maintain her tuk-tuks and buy stock for her clothing business

loans.name: Fadhila's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Fadhila is 26 years old. She is single with 2 children aged 2 and 6 years old. She has owned a small stationery shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fadhila now hopes for a loan to buy more stationery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sabah.

loans.use: buying more stationery items for her business

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en: K. Muharram is 42 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of 4 children. Since 1998 Muharram has run her own business embroidering the national skull-cap for men and women. Muharram producies various types of the national skull-cap. She has many clients and usually there are many orders. His children help her with the business. The ready-made skull-caps that Muharram is selling are in demand. Thus, her business is stable which allows her to contribute significantly to the family budget. Today Muharram is requesting $600 for the term of 9 months. The loan is for purchasing the fabrics for embroidering. Muharram thanks you for your support and promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for embroidering

loans.name: Jeanette Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Jeannette habita en un barrio que se llama Naciones Unidas de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, y con dos hijos de 5 y 13 años de edad, que están estudiando,  su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad. La Sra. Jeannette tiene una pulpería que  inició con ayuda económica de su esposo. Con la solicitud del crédito quiere comprar productos de consumo básicos ya que es uno de los cuales se vende más rápido y con mayor demanda, también desea captar más clientes para crecer más en su negocio. A largo plazo es tener mas inventario obtener mejores ganancias, y captar más clientes, así como poder dar estudios a sus hijos para que sean personas responsables.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette lives in a neighborhood of Managua called Naciones Unidas. She is 35, married, with two children ages 5 and 13 who are in school. Her husband works in security. Mrs. Jeanette has a general store that she started with the help of her husband. With this loan she wants to buy the basic daily products that sell most quickly and are in greatest demand. She also wants to attract more clients so her business can grow more. Her long-term goal is to increase her inventory, make a better profit, and increase her clientele, in order to educate her children so they will become responsible adults.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic daily products for her store

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, con su pareja tienen la dicha que de sus dos hijos aun solteros los acompañen. Desde los 15 años, Jacinto ayudaba a sus padres en la siembra, con ello podía ganar dinero para pagar sus estudios en la universidad. Cuando se casó ya tenía sus propias chacras ya cultivadas con frutos cítricos y plátanos. El se va muy temprano a sus campos, aun con el ardiente sol permanece en la montaña. Actividad que le es rentable, ya que en tiempos de cosecha llega a vender 400 kilos de cítricos.  Jacinto hace uso de su profesión de agronomía, todos sus conocimientos los emplea en sus plantaciones, y le va muy bien, sin mayores dificultades y siembra gran variedad de productos. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita con MFP. El dinero será invertido en la compra de semilla de café, para la ampliación de sus sembríos de este producto.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 52 and married. He and his wife have the happiness to be assisted by their two unmarried children. For 15 years, Jacinto helped his parents to plant, which is how he was able to earn the money to pay for his university studies. When he got married he already had his own fields already planted with citrus fruits and bananas. He goes to his fields very early, staying on the mountain even in the burning sun. This is profitable for him, since at harvest time he can sell 400 kilos of citrus fruit. Jacinto makes use of his agricultural training, using all his knowledge in his plantings. It is going very well with him, without major problems, and he is growing a wide variety of produce. This is the first loan that he has requested from MFP. He will invest the money in coffee seed, in order to increase his plantings of this crop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee seed

loans.name: Chhlea

texts.en: Mr. Chhlea K., 44, lives in the Treal Commune in Kompong Tom Province. He is married to Mrs. Mao Yon, 42, who is the mother of their five children.  One of their children is married.  The two who are employed earn approximately $4 a day. The couple make a living raising pigs and are widely known in their area as a skilled pigs farmers.  They have been engaged in this business since 2004. K. is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more piglets to raise and food to fatten them.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S., 75 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du citron, des légumes et du poisson séché pour renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Coumba S., age 75, is married and has been a member of the village association of Petit Kandé for seven and a half years. She wants to buy palm oil, lemons, vegetables, and smoked fish to boost her commerce. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables, palm oil, lemons, and dried fish

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika B. V. esta separada de su esposo, ella actualmente vive con su mamá, trabaja como empleada en una empresa donde se hace ropa y con los ingresos que percibe mantiene a sus 2 hijos.
La señora Erika está solicitando un préstamo para solventar los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que los ingresos que percibe no le son suficientes, esto permitirá que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y en un futuro puedan llegar a ser profesionistas.
texts.en:
Erika B. V. is separated from her husband and currently lives with her mother. She is employed in a factory where they make clothing and with that income she supports her 2 children. Erika is requesting a loan to take care of her children’s school expenses given that the income that she receives is not enough. This will allow her children to continue with their studies so that in the future they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Raising goats and sheep

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para quemar el ladrillo alquila hornos, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Rosa sueña con comprar una casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member from the Communal Bank Los Ladrilleros. Rosa lives in Compañía, a community that is located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Rosa is 35 years old and has 3 children, Rosa works with her husband making handmade bricks. To bake the bricks, Rosa rents ovens. Rosa needs a loan of $300 (900 Soles) which she will invest in fire wood. Rosa dreams with buying a house and of giving her children a good education.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Rocio De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Rocío de la mañana” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace ya más de cuatro años, cumpliendo con su  noveno ciclo de crédito. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal Senkata ubicada  en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 16 miembros que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de muebles,  venta de sabanas y frazadas, también se dedican a la venta de leche y la venta de verduras. Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de reforzar su capital para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, con esto mejorarían sus ingresos, con el unico de objetivo de mejorar  el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group called "Rocío de la mañana" (Morning Dew) has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for more than four years and is on their ninth loan. It belongs to the Senkata center located in the city of El Alto. Right now it has 16 members who have proven to be an organized group in terms of paying back their loans and their internal activities. There are different businesses throughout the group such as selling furniture, sheets and blankets, milk, and vegetables. They are requesting bigger credits with the goal of strengthening their capital to buy a larger quantity of products. This is how they will improve their income with the only objective of improving the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of products

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofia tiene 28 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Trabaja todos los días en su cafetín, ubicado dentro de un jardín de niños (institución educativa de nivel inicial) cercano a su localidad. Todas las mañanas atiende los gustos de sus pequeños clientes y los maestros de la institución. Ofrece golosinas, bebidas y platos de comida, para ello, en algunas ocasiones, sus hijos la ayudan, y para Sofía es una gran alegría poder estar con sus hijos, y generar para ellos, ingresos económicos. Sus proyectos a futuro son de seguir adelante con este negocio mejorando cada vez más para aumentar sus ventas y ganancias. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, durante este tiempo de trabajo demostró ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos, hoy se compromete, una vez más, a seguir con esta actitud positiva. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor, así como víveres para la preparación de los menús diarios.
texts.en:
Sofia is 28 years old; she lives with her two children in a rented house. She works everyday in her small café located within a children’s playground (at a kindergarten school) near her town. Every morning she serves her young customers and the teachers of the school. She offers candy, drinks and food, and on some occasions her children help her with the work. It makes Sofia really happy to be with her children and to generate economic earnings to provide for them. Her future projects are to continue advancing this business, improving her sales and earnings a little more each time. This is her second MFP loan. During this period of work she has demonstrated being punctual and responsible in her loan payments. Today she promises, once again, to continue her positive attitude. The money she’s requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale candy, as provisions for the preparation of the daily menus.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy and other ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam S., 58, (pictured with her daughter) is a widow and resides with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She sells grocery items and is able to make US$5 every day. Tam S. needs a loan to expand her business. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: Add grocery inventory

loans.name: Deonisia

texts.es:
Deonisia es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Deonisia es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Dionisia junto a su esposo tienen una tapicería en el cual brindan servicio D. tapizado D. carros, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. un personal. Además Dionisia tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico.
Deonisia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. esponja, corrofan.
Deonisia sueña con educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y traer materiales al por mayor.
texts.en:
Deonisia is a member of the Communal Bank Tulipanes (Tulips). Deonisia is married, 42 years old, and has 4 children. Deonisia and her husband own an upholstery business in which they offer car upholstery services and count with the help of one employee. Deonisia also own a vehicle in which she offers public transportation services. Deonisia needs a loan of 1,200 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of corrofan foam. Deonisia dreams with educating her children so that they become professionals, improving her business, and purchasing materials wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corrofan foam.

loans.name: La Thị

texts.en:
P. La Thị (221960503) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, P. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. P. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1996, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. P. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia B. is a marred mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters, who are all currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is 47 years old. Afia lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Afia is a baker. She bakes bread in her community and supplies retailers and beverage sellers. She also hawks to sell. Afia buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more material such as vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata K. habite dans le quartier de cambberene depuis plusieurs annees.elle est tres connue dans la commercialisation de tissus principalement mais elle evolue aussi dans la vente de parfums et de jus.elle sollicite un pret de cent mille(100 000)frs pour renforcer son capital de roulement.avec ses benefices mensuels elle assiste sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata K. has lived in the Camberene area for several years. She is very well known mainly for her business selling cloth, but she has also developed a business selling perfumes and juice. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her working capital. With her monthly profits, she helps support her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high school. Her husband is a farmer.

Patricia sells groceries like milk and sugar at Elmina near Abreshia, which she has been doing since 2007. She uses her income to support the payment of fees and utility bills.

Patricia will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gerardo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Gerardo Enrique  Z. Gutiérrez tiene 29 años de edad es casado vive con sus tres hijos con residencia en paraje pajumujuyup, del cantón chuisuc, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, actualmente presta sus servicios como operario en la tejeduría pero la inquietud  de poder sobresalir y crear su propio taller de tejeduría  pero debido al bajo ingreso que obtiene mensualmente, se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociación Asdir para pedir un préstamo así poder comprar materia prima para generar su propia producción por lo que la inversión a adquirir es muy rentable dándole así a su familia un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Artesania (compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Nilsen Indelgarden

texts.es:
Nilsen es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Alta Gracia, es casada, tiene 39 años, dos hijos de 12 y 5 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Nilsen estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo, trabajó en una Municipalidad en provincia, pero dejó de trabajar por problemas políticos, y se vino a vivir en Lima, en Lima se casó, tuvo dos hijos y se puso a trabajar con su esposo, él es Arquitecto, ella aprendió hacer planos de instalaciones eléctricas y sanitarias, ellos tiene una pequeña oficina en su casa, donde reciben los trabajos.
Desde que esta en Finca con los préstamos puede invertir en implementos para su oficina, tableros, impresoras. Lo cual facilitan el trabajo.     
Nilsen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de artículos de oficina para poder trabajar  en los planos. 
El sueño de Nilsen es tener una oficina en un lugar más céntrico

loans.use: artículos de oficina

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 45-year-old mother of 6 children (all in school). She lives with her husband in Runyenjes Embu Kenya. She started the business of buying raw bananas for sale in 2000. She gets her stock direct from local farmers wholesale and supplies to local marketplaces,  thus she is able to make a big profit. She plans to buy more stock of raw bananas with her third loan of Kshs 30,000 and also invest part of the loan to purchase cereals like beans and dry maize, especially during this harvesting season.

loans.use: Buy more raw bananas for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia ISABEL, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija que esta en el jardín. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de ropa para niños y adultos. Ella lleva la mercadería al mercado muy temprano y reparte entre todas las vendedoras. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de ropa.        .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is 27, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter in kindergarten. She alternates her activities between the home and her business of selling clothes for children and adults. She takes the merchandise to the market very early and distributes it to all of the sellers. The member needs a loan to increase the production of her clothing sales. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium, and she promises to make her payments according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her clothing sales

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Luz Lourdes H. tiene una pulpería el cual administra desde hace seis años, gracias a prestamos pequeño que hacia en instituciones logro formar su negocio mas solidó  y ayuda que su esposo dio, el se desempeña como contador en una empresa privada. Tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian para lograr un porvenir mejor. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz azúcar, aceite, avena, lácteos, carnes y otros para mejorar las ventas ya
Que en los últimos meses no ha logrado vender lo suficiente lo cual ha obtenido ganancias bajas, es por eso la inversión para no fracasar en su venta y seguir aumentando de productos variados, en un futuro desea mejorar el local haciendo embaldosado ya que es de tierra y desea dar un mejor servicio de higiene a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Lourdes H. has a mini market which she has run for six years. Thanks to small loans from institutions and help from her husband, she was able to make her business more solid. Her husband is a bookkeeper with a private business. She has three children who go to school to have a better future. This is her seventh cycle with Afodenic. She will buy basic grains like beans, rice, sugar, oil, oats, dairy products, meat, and other things to improve sales. In the last few months she has not sold enough, and her earnings are low. That is why she needs the investment so that she does not fail in her sales. She will keep increasing her various products. In the future, she wishes to improve her store by putting down a tile floor. The one she has is dirt, and she wishes to give a better, more hygienic service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, and dairy products

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina B. is from the village of  Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Merlina is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Merlina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of pagne (decorative cloth)

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia C. sells groundnut paste in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Cicilia is 40 years old and is married; her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru: Камолов Сайдали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Сайдали более 4 лет занимаеся животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Сайдали хочет купить молодого бычка и продать по высокой цене.
texts.en:
Saydali K. lives in the Yavan district. He is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. Saydali has been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years. He raises and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this business. Saydali is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle. He wants to buy a young bull and resell it at a higher price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Madame Mariam D. est une jeune dame de 29 ans. Elle habite a Hann Mariste une des cites environnantes de Dalifort. Elle est mariée et évolue dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son objectif principal est d’augmenter ses bénéfices et renforcer  le bien être de sac famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam D., age 29, is a young lady who live in Hann Mariste, one of the housing developments surrounding Dalifort.  She is married and is advancing in the commerce of cosmetics.  She's requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for bolstering her stock of merchandise.  Her main goal is to increase her profits and improve her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Ta-Kiliesu Group

texts.en: These are members of the 'Ta-Kiliesu' group. They are small-scale businesswomen who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses. The leader of the group is Kadiatu K.. The 26-year-old Kadiatu is married to a professional worker and they have two children attending primary school. For many years now, Kadiatu has been selling slippers/flip-flops. She is requesting a SLL 500,000 loan in order to buy dozens of flip-flops to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy dozens of flip-flops to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Grand-Popo au Bénin, K. Pélagie vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pélagie est mariée à MONTCHO Jean-Marc, un agent au port, avec qui elle a quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Pour participer aux dépenses de la famille, Pélagie exerce comme activité la vente de poissons fumés et frais de manière ambulante. C’est au port de pêche que Pélagie fait ses provisions. Pélagie n’a jamais fréquenté mais a déjà 15 années d’expériences dans son domaine. Deux crédits ont déjà été accordés à Pélagie par ALIDé, crédit qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l’optique de vendre ses poissons en gros, Pélagie sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Grand-Popo in Benin, Pélagie K. lives in the Fiegnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin . She is married to Jean-Marc MONTCHO, a portuary agent, with whom she has had four children, some of them attending school. Pélagie lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly shares family expenses, and Pélagie participates by selling fresh and smoked fish as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies from the fishing port. Pélagie has never attended school, but has accumulated 15 years’ experience in her business. She has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. She is now requesting a third loan, as she wants to start selling her fish wholesale.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 41 años, es una madre ejemplar, casada con Jerson de 36 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, y juntos viven en su casa propia, fabricado con material rústico a base de hojas de árbol y madera. A ella se le considera, como una mujer “Mil oficios”, pues para sacar adelante a su familia no descansa, es así que lleva 20 años dedicada a la agricultura, asimismo se dedica a la elaboración de comida, a la crianza y comercialización de cuy, cerdo, así como la venta de productos de belleza, que le resultan muy beneficioso debido a que cuenta con muchos conocidos que son sus clientes favoritos. Lo que más le gusta de las actividades que realiza, es cosechar las deliciosas mandarinas que siembra, puesto que son comercializados tanto en el mercado de su zona como en la ciudad, recibiendo un poco más de ganancias. Por otro lado su esposo, trabaja en el programa “agua para todos”, por lo que él asume los gastos del hogar. Actualmente compró un terreno de 3 hectáreas de extensión y planea sembrar productos oriundos de la zona, asimismo desea instalar un puesto de comida en un espacio disponible de su vivienda.  Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, además sus compañeras de su grupo comunal están contentas con ella, por ser solidaria y honesta. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de abono, mil plantas de plátanos y sembrarlos en el terreno que acaba de comprar, además desea contratar operarios para que le ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 41 years old, is an exemplary mother, and is married to 36 year old Jerson, with whom she has four children. They live together in their own house, which is made of rustic materials based on tree leaves and wood. She is considered a woman of "a thousand trades" because, in order to provide for her family, she never rests. For this reason, she has been working in agriculture for 20 years and also prepares food, breeds and sells guinea pigs and pigs, and sells beauty products, all of which are very beneficial to her because she has many acquaintances who are among her favorite customers. Her favorite of the tasks she undertakes is harvesting the delicious mandarins that she grows, as they are sold both in her local market and in the city, and bring in a little extra profit. On the other hand, her husband works for the "Water For All" program, so he is responsible for the household expenses. She just bought a 3 hectare plot of land and plans to sow products of local origin, and she also wants to install a food stall in an available space in their home. This is her sixth loan from MFP, and her companions in the loan group are very happy with her as she is supportive and honest. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and a thousand banana seedlings and will plan them on the land that she just bought. She also wants to hire some workers to help her with this task.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer, a thousand banana plants, and hire workers

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh B., 28, lives with his parents in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family have been living together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent.) They have been living together in their current home for three years since moving from Hairhandulaan soum of Uvurhangai. His father is a herder and his mother is a cook in a local restaurant. 


Battogtoh operates a cell phone repair and trade business. He graduated in 2007 as computer repairman from a vocational training center, an affiliate of The Mongolian University of Science and Technology. After he graduated from university, he did a cell phone repair course and started to repair cell phones at a rented counter that belonged to one of his friends in Ulaanbaatar.  Since 2008, he has been operating his own repair service with his friend, at a rented counter in a trading center called Emt in Uvurhangai province. 


In the beginning, he did not have not enough equipment and  there were many competitors running similar businesses which meant that it was difficult to earn high profits. Therefore, he received a 500,000 MNT loan in his father's name which made it possible for him to purchase the necessary equipment and spare cell phone parts for his business. 


He is an industrious, knowledgeable person who has good communication skills. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more cell phone repair equipment to provide a larger range of services to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 54 years old and is married with two children. She is well-known in the business of selling bananas and she has been in this business for about fifteen years. She runs her business from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Emerthe would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of bananas. With this additional quantity for sale, she will hopefully earn more profits. This, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and set up some new sources of income as well as create more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year old married man living with his wife and two young children in Lebanon. In 2005, he started working in a clothing store and after two years he found that this profession was suitable for him. That’s why in 2007, he has established a small clothing shop in his town. He offers all the new collections of man's wear and he always tried to be up to date with this market to be in the requisition of his clients. And he's thankful for his decision to start his own business.

He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to expand his inventory for the summer season and propose a bigger choice of clothes to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sabata Jacinto

texts.pt:
Sabata Jacinto M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 15, 17, 21 e 24 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
Nunca saiu de Boane, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que Ja levantou crédito nesta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para ampliar e melhorar a sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.700.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt foram para comércio e habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua residência oferecendo melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Sabata Jacinto M. was born in the Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is single and is the mother of 4 children who are 15, 17, 21, and 24 years old. All of them go to school. She only studied through the 6th grade and did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anybody else. She has never left Boane. Sabata has had her own business for more than 10 years. She does not have any employees and earns about 3,500 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for expenses. She is even able to save some in her bank account. Sabata has had loans with other banks, but she later decided not to continue on with them. She found out about Hluvuku through her neighbor, who has already received a loan through this institution. This is her 4th loan, which has a value of 20,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy construction material (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.) to expand and improve her home. The previous loans were for 2,700 MZN, 6,000 MZN, and 15,000 MZN, which she put toward her business and her house. She promises to pay back the loan on time so that she can receive others. In the future, she plans to request more loans in order to finish and furnish her house, so that her family can have a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Faileaso

texts.en: Faileaso U. is 55 and is married with eight children aged 18 to 36. She owns a business venture selling baked goods in the local community and has one year of experience in this business. Faileaso needs a loan of WST 1,000 to buy raw ingredients to produce more baked goods. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately USD 136 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Faileaso joined SPBD and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to produce more baked goods to sell

loans.name: Dilaram's Group

texts.en:
In order for a person to lead his or her life in dignity and convenience, there have to be some proper conditions. Those conditions can be summarized as availability of water pipes, roads and electricity. If there are not such facilities, people are faced with the everyday hard work of bringing water in carts and building all water providing systems themselves. The heroes of our story are people who overcome these difficulties everyday, and continue to work hard in order to earn their daily bread. 

Dilaram K. is 49. She has raised six daughters. Her husband works in the Water Supply Department and obtains a monthly salary of 3,000 soms. Dilaram grows cotton and sells it in market. Two of her daughters are married and live with their families. The rest of her daughters help Dilaram at the cotton plantation. Dilaram’s monthly income constitutes around 7,000 soms. This business has allowed Dilaram to marry her daughters. Now, Dilaram needs a loan. She needs to buy mineral fertilizers and therefore hopes to obtain this loan. In the near future, she plans to purchase cattle for breeding. 

Dilaram’s partners:

Mamurahan M., 41, is a mother of three children. She is engaged in cattle breeding and selling milk. Her son helps her to look after the cattle. Her husband is also engaged in some business and manages to earn 4,800 soms. Mamurahan would like to increase the total population of livestock. She needs a loan to purchase sheep for feeding.
 
Abdimutalib A., 48, is a father of two children. His eldest son is 17 and his little son is five. To provide for the family, Abdimutalib is engaged in growing cotton and corn. His monthly income is 2,100 soms. Abdimutalib has applied for this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and use the rest of the funds to complete the construction of the house.

Dildora T., 20, is single. She is preparing for marriage. Dildora is going to work after the wedding. She hopes to obtain this loan and use the funds to prepare her dowry.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man with five children who are in school.  He is employed in a security firm in Nairobi.  Besides that, he runs a retail shop where he has employed one person.  He was previously working as a plumber to earn a living. He has been running his retail shop for six months, thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him in business management.  

Currently, Richard needs to add vegetables, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat  to his inventory so as to meet his customers’ needs.  Hence, he has requested a loan of 60,000 KES. He hopes to open a manufacturing industry and create employment.

loans.use: To add vegetables, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat to his business inventory

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Señor Alejandro  y su esposa viven en la casa de su hijo tienen dos hijos mayores que ya no dependen de el son independientes el se dedica  a la actividad de la construcción desde muy joven , es su  principal fuente de ingreso es contratista y maestro trabaja con uno de sus hijos y dos ayudantes , el señor solicito el crédito  para la compra de una mescladora mas grande le dimos lo que necesitaba es nuevo con la institución y con el crédito kiva, es muy trabajador siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, su esposa se dedica  a labores del hogar, y estan muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alejandro and his wife live in their son’s house. They have two adult children that no longer depend on them, they are independent. He has worked in construction from a very young age. His main source of income is work as a contractor and master builder. He works with his son and two assistants. He asked for funding to buy a larger cement mixer and we gave him what he needed. He’s a new client of the institution and with Kiva loans. He is very hard working and is always thinking about his family’s welfare. His wife is a housewife and they are very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger cement mixer.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: Maria D. Los Angeles P. Moreyda tiene su bodega desD. hace 10 años al frente D. su casa. DesD. el inicio ella trabaja sola y venD. verduras, pollo, pan, leche, etc. Le gustaría ampliar más y tener productos como perfumes y más regalos. Hace 4 años que trabaja con Edaprospo y diga que los préstamos la ayudan a sostener su negocio, a ampliar más y también la ayudan a construir su casa. Ella quiere que sus dos hijos jóvenes estudien porque ella diga que está trabajando para ellos.
texts.en:
María D. Los Ángeles P. Moreyda has had her general store for 10 years in front of her house. From the start she has worked by herself selling vegetables, chicken, bread, milk, etc. She’d like to expand a bit M. and incluD. products such as perfumes and gift items. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for 4 years and she says the loans help her sustain her business, to expand it and also have helped her build her house. She wants her two young children to study because she says she’s working for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Rhonalyn

texts.en:
Rhonalyn M. is 33 years old, married and has a four-year-old child and a two-month-old baby. She is from the town of Banga in Cotabato province on the southern Mindanao islands. Rhonalyn is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. She also planted coconut trees on part of her land. Rhonalyn works hard to provide for her family and to save for her kids' future.

Rhonalyn joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rhonalyn is requesting a new loan, her second from CEVI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase seed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru: Кенчаев Убайдулло житель района Вахдат. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, отец 3 детей. Образование средне - специальное, шафер. По специальности не работает. На сегодняшний день он занимается ремеслом, то есть изготавливает деревянные изделия. В этой области уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки древесины.
texts.en: Ubaydullo K. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 40 years old, married and is a father of 3 children.  He has secondary-specialized education, as a driver.  He no longer works in that field.  Currently, Ubaydullo is involved in arts and crafts, i.e. he makes wooden creations.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood.

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Merlyn is married and has five children. Her eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is only four. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlyn also plants vegetables in her backyard and earns a profit from it.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jovena

texts.en:
Jovena V. is from the village of Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Jovena is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jovena has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jovena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Jovena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es: Kathy, de 28 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querido hijo Aldair de 8 años, quien es su principal motivación para todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de Kathy es la primera en abrirse en la ciudad de San Francisco, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarle a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Kathy is 28 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working young woman.  She lives in a rented house together with her son Aldair who is 8 years old and the main motivation behind all her hard work.  Kathy's store is the first to open in the town of San Francisco.  Her doors are already open at 6 in the morning to receive her early-rising customers who, knowing what a great variety of merchandise she has in her store, don't hesitate to buy from her since they are sure that they are going to find what they need.

What Kathy most likes about her work is chatting with her customers and finding out what's been happening in the neighborhood.  She has been in this business for 3 years and she considers the most difficult thing about her work the fact that she has to stay in her store all day long without being able to go out.  Over time she hopes to grow her business and provide her customers with a better service.

This is Kathy's first loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to pay it back on time since she doesn't want to cause any inconvenience for the other members of her community bank where she is very respected because of the order which she brings to the group.  She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Juana Mireya

texts.es: La Sra. M. es una mujer muy trabajadora y una madre muy responsable. Siempre al pendiente de la educación de sus hijos es por eso tomo la iniciativa de vender calzado por catalogo para contribuir al ingreso de su hogar si tener que descuidarlo debido a que su esposo tiene la mayor parte del dia laborando en una empresa dedicada ha hacer anuncio luminosos de neón es uno de los mejores coloboradores fue lo que expreso su jefe inmediato que esta muy agusto con el trabajo que el señor realiza. y su esposa para ayudarle tomo dicha iniciativa requiere el crédito para surtir pedido de zapatos que tiene encargados y tener mejor entrada económica en su hogar.
texts.en: Mrs M. is a very hard-working woman and a very responsible mother.  She is always keen on providing for her children's education which is why she took the initiative to sell footwear through catalogs.  She wanted to contribute to the household income without having to neglect her household as her husband is outside of the home most of the day working for a company making neon signs.  According to his immediate boss, who is very happy with the work he does, he is one of the company's best workers.  In order to help him, Mrs M. took this initiative.  She is requesting this loan to stock an order for shoes that she has outstanding and to improve her household economy.

loans.use: To stock an order for shoes that she has pending

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena S. sells smoked fish, maize and millet in Takoradi. She is divorced and takes care of six dependants. She has been in this business for six years. She sees to the welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Tesmilda Elizabeth

texts.en:
Tesmilda Elizabeth is 31 years old and separated. She has two children ( four and 13 years old). She is pregnant with her third child. She lives in the southeastern part of Guayaquil, an area called Fortin, known for having mostly dirt roads and houses made of cane. 
 
Tesmilda Elizabeth runs a pharmacy and also offers telephone services. She invested her savings in medicine and started the pharmacy because she likes this type of work. She opens her pharmacy every day at 7 am. 
 
Tesmilda Elizabeth plans to use her $1,000 loan to buy more medicine. She sells the medicine for twice the price she buys it for. In the future, she hopes to open a cyber café for her daughter and to expand her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Georgina Cudjoe Araba

texts.en:
Georgina Cudjoe Araba M. is married and has eight dependants. She has been through senior high school. Georgina fries doughnuts to sell at Elmina and her husband is a mason. Georgina uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. 

In this picture, Georgina is scooping flour mixture into oil to fry her doughnuts. She will use her loan to buy flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. In the future, Georgina plans to reinvest her profit.

loans.use: to buy flour and ingredients

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu T. N. is a 35-year-old woman with 2 children. She is living in Mach trang village. Tu is a successful business woman who sells baby pigs. Every day, she goes to markets to buy baby pigs at a lower price and then sells them to farmers who have mother pigs with a few baby pigs. She has run this kind of business for 5 years and it gives her a good revenue that covers her family's spending. A client of Seda since 2004, she has been in good re-payment status. Currently, she wants a loan of 7630000 VND to invest in the business.

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 46 años y está casado con la Sra. Nelida, vive con sus hijos menores.
Sixto se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de chipas caseras (masa de almidón, considerado como panificado típico del país) en compañía de su esposa, empiezan sus actividades diarias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para la elaboración de las chipas y su posterior venta que realiza por las compañías más cercanas de la ciudad. Tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, están cursando sus estudios primarios.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo, pues es el medio por el que sale a recorrer para la venta de las chipas.
texts.en:
Sixto is 46 years old and married to Mrs. Nelida.  They live with their minor children.

Sixto and his wife make and sell home-made chipas (a type of starch roll which is a typical bread product in his country).  They begin their daily activity very early in the morning making their chipas which they later sell to companies located near the city.  They have four children, all minors, who are in primary school.

They plan to use the loan to repair the vehicle they use to delivery their chipas orders.

loans.use: For auto repair

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Antonio, tiene 33 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos, el nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad de Urubamba. 

Antonio trabaja en la empresa privada llamada “Cerámicas Seminario” donde se dedican a la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo cerámica artísticos, decorativos, utilitarios, joyería, murales, esculturas y entre otros. Ya son 8  años que trabaja en la empresa y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. 

Antonio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para construir cuartos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Antonio belongs to Los Solidarios communal bank of the Arariwa Association.  He is very appreciative of the opportunity offered him and he promises to make all the payments on schedule.
Antonio is 33.  He has four children and he was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and now lives in the same city of Urubamba.

Antonio works in the private business called “Seminario Ceramics” where they make handicrafts such as artistic, decorative and utilitarian ceramics, jewelry, murals, sculpture, etc.  He has been there for 8 years and he’s doing very well because of the effort that he puts into his work.

At this time Antonio needs a loan to build rooms in his house.
