loans.use: To build rooms in his house

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor P. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Eleonor is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor owns & operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration or upholstery & tailoring services to local community members. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.Teodocio; el tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de construcción civil, el construye diferentes casas en diferentes lugares, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere construir su casa.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y yeso.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teodocio is 37 years old and lives with his 2 children.  He belongs to the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” communal bank, which is located in the Urubamba district, in Urubamba province in the Department of Cusco.

Teodocio alternates his daily activities with a job in construction—he builds houses in different locations.  This job enables him to improve the lives of his children, and he wants to build a house for his family.  He is therefore asking for a loan so that he can purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, and plaster.

Teodocio is happy about this loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials such as cement, sand, and plaster

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La señorita Genara M. vive con sus padres en la compañía Isla Ka’a de Ybycui, es soltera sin hijos.
Ella nos cuenta que realizó estudios de peluquería, manicura y pedicuro, una vez terminado estos estudios y ante la adversidad de no encontrar un lugar de trabajo, ella mismo se propuso a salir en busca de clientes, gracias a su buen trabajo y responsabilidad, rápidamente ha formado una gran clientela, en la actualidad realiza trabajos a domicilio por toda la ciudad de Ybycuí, dejándole muy buenas ganancias.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de solicitar el crédito a Kiva, ya que si cuennta con eso podrá comprar insumos necesarios para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. M. lives with her ​​parents in Ybycui Ka'a Island and is single with no children.

She tells us that she studied hairdressing, manicure and pedicure.  After completing these studies, she suffered the adversity of not finding a workplace and decided to go in search of customers.   Thanks to her good work and responsibility, a large customer base formed quickly.  She now offers at-home beauty services to clientele throughout the city of Ybycuí, earning a good profit.

She thanks Foundation Paraguaya for the opportunity to apply for credit through Kiva to buy supplies needed for her work.

loans.use: Purchase materials and supplies (nail polish, paints, hair creams, etc.).

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: A villager who lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Seng P. is a 39-year-old married woman who plants different kinds of crops on her farmland to earn a profit. Her husband is a skilled builder of wooden houses. The couple has two children, one of whom is a garment factory worker. Seng P. has had great success growing rice crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may influence Seng P.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop. Seng P. is taking out a loan to a dig a well so that she can water her crops and she will also buy some fertilizers to keep her crop growing well.

loans.use: to a dig a well and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
This is Yawa. She is 39 years old and married to a school teacher. The couple has four children ages 8, 10, 15 and 17. Yawa has two additional dependents that live with her because they are her husband’s relatives. Since 2006, Yawa has been selling local and imported food such as magi, onion salt and other items. She never attended school and began her business because it was the only skill she was trained in. Yawa works six days a week and 18 hours a day to earn a monthly income of 1,000,000 SLL. 

Yawa is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy local and imported merchandise for her business. She hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Yawa plans to acquire a building to use as a store and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy local and imported foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La vida de Eva no fue muy sencilla, desde muy pequeña siempre se preocupó por ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Actualmente tiene un negocio, que es la venta de ropa, y lo realiza en la calle, aunque es muy informal su trabajo, aún así la gente la conocen y le hacen pedidos de alguna prenda que requiera, como casacas, chompas, pantalones, pues se encuentran en un lugar que ahora baja la temperatura. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, pero ahora su mayor prioridad es aumentar la mercadería que tiene, sin embargo para lograr vender, tiene que caminar largo trechos para buscar clientes. Pero ella esta dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Por tal motivo pide un pequeño apoyo de parte de ustedes para que pueda invertir en su negocio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, así como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene.
texts.en:
Eva, 37, is an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, José, 40, and their three cherished children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Eva’s life hasn’t been easy.  From a very young age she’s taken on the responsibility of helping pay household expenses.  

She currently has a business selling clothes in the street.  Although her work is informal even so she is known by the people and they place orders for whatever article of clothing they need like jackets, sweaters and pants because they are located in a place where the temperature drops now.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and what she likes best about it is chatting with her customers.  But now, her greatest priority is increasing the merchandise she has.  However, in order to sell she has to cover long distances to seek out customers.  But she’s willing to face whatever sacrifice is necessary in order to reach her goals.  Because of this, she’s asking for a small loan from you to invest in her business.

This is her second loan with MFP and she’s determined to pay her installments on time like she did with her previous loans.  She is a very well liked and respected member of her communal bank.  She will buy clothes to increase the amount of merchandise she has.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Angela Milagros

texts.es: La señora Ángela es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad ambos están en edad escolar, angela tiene una pequeña bodega de golosinas y productos de primera necesidad, como arroz azúcar aceite entre otros ,en sus inicios su bodega era pequeña y ahora esta un poco mas surtida, angela eligió este tipo de trabajo para estar cerca de su familia, ya tiene 1 año laborando en esta actividad , el dinero del prestamos será invertido en ampliar su negocio comprando productos como gaseosas, golosinas, arroz, fideos, aceite, azúcar, entre otras cosas, el sueño a futuro de la señora angela es agrandar mucho mas su negocio para que con ello le genere mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida, angela esta muy contenta con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Ángela is a single mother of two children who are 14 and 7 years of age and still school aged.  Ángela has a small store selling snacks and basic need items like rice, sugar and oil, among others.  At the beginning the store was very small but now it’s better stocked.  Ángela chose this way of life to be near her family.  She’s been in business a year.  

The money from the loans will be invested to expand her business buying such products as soft drinks, snacks, rice, noodles, oil and sugar, among others.  Ángela’s dream for the future is to enlarge the business even more so that it will generate better income and thus improve her quality of life.  Ángela is very happy with the trust that’s been placed in her.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Germania Aracely

texts.es:
Germanía de 53 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltero y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comidas.

Inicio hace un tiempo atrás viendo que por su sector no hay ese tipo de actividad de ventas de comida entonces ella decidió abrir una. Labora sola de lunes a viernes de 5H00 pm a 9H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda. En un futuro dese abrir un restaurante mas grande.
texts.en: Germanía is 53 years old, and lives in Primavera, Duran.  (This is an area on the outskirts of the city that was originally built upon without official authorization. The area has several hills, streams and lakes that are visible as the remains of a deteriorating ecosystem).  She is single and has three adult children.  She works selling food.  She started this some time ago as there wasn't this kind of food sales activity in her area, so she decided to open one.  She works alone from Monday to Friday, from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m.  With the help of the loan, she wants to buy construction materials to finish building her home.  In the future, she wants to open a larger restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cinder blocks.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has operated her retail shop in Njabini town for the last 11 years. She is 48 years old and married to Michael; they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans, which she used to boost her business, well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her retail shop into a wholesale one.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop to sell.

loans.name: Milagros Xiomara

texts.es: La Sra. Milagros, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de dos y seis años de edad, el de seis años asiste al colegio. Nuestra cliente se  dedica  a la venta de comida.  Eligió este tipo de trabajo por su mamá  que también vende comida  en el verano.  Ella  tiene  su negocio desde hace dos años  y gana aproximadamente 400 soles semanales.  Los desafíos  que enfrenta la Sra. Milagros es el cuidado de sus hijos ya que tiene q compartir su poco tiempo con ellos y el negocio, enfrenta este reto contando con el apoyo de su madre para el cuidado de sus hijos, mientras ella atiende el negocio. Su sueño de Milagros es tener un gran restaurante con variedades de platos y  así poder darle a sus hijos lo necesario. El crédito lo va a invertir  en comprar  más insumos y accesorios para el restaurante. Es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora, se encuentra muy agradecida con la Caja Señor de Luren por la oportunidad prestada.
texts.en:
Milagros is a single mother; she has two children who are 2 and 6 years of age, the six-year-old attends school.  

Our client sells food.  She chose this type of work thanks to her mother who also sold food in the summer.  She’s had the business for the last two years and earns about 400 soles per week.

The challenge Milagros faces is caring for her children because she has to share what little time she has with them and the restaurant.  Her mother helps her face this challenge caring for the children while she tends to the business.

Milagros’ dream is to have a large restaurant with a variety of dishes to provide her children with what’s necessary.  She will use the loan to buy more ingredients and accessories for the restaurant.  

She is an enterprising, tenacious person who is very grateful to Caja Señor de Luren for the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to buy necessary ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jusup

texts.ru:
Жусуп – 44 –летний фермер из села Орто-Суу. Женат и воспитывает троих детей.  Жусуп – активный участник различных мероприятий в родном селе и со стороны односельчан характеризуется как добропорядочный, трудолюбивый и дружелюбный человек. 15 лет назад со стартовым капиталом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) Жусуп начал свой бизнес в закупе, разведении и перепродаже скота.   На сегодняшний день,  его ферма насчитывает 5 коров и 29 овец, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS).  Дополнительным источником доходов семьи является фруктовый сад, урожай от которого Жусуп продает на местном рынке. 
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жусуп обратился в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры»  за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS). В будущем, с помощью кредита, Жусуп планирует оплатить учебу для своих детей в престижном университете. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры"  (CJSC “Bai Tushum & Partners”  MFC)предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Jusup is a 44-year-old farmer from the village of Ortosuu. He is married and has three children. Jusup is an active participant in various activities in his native village, and the villagers describe him as a respectable, hardworking, and friendly person. Fifteen years ago with start-up capital amounting to 100,000 som (KGS), Jusup started his business buying, breeding, and selling livestock. Today, his farm has five cows and 29 sheep.  His monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). An additional source of family income is an orchard whose produce Jusup sells in the local market.

To further develop his business, Jusup turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS). In the future, with the help of the loan, Jusup plans to pay his children's tuition to a prestigious university.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Irene Jaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a Irene, tiene 36 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco  y le gusta porque son muy unidas en el grupo.

Ella trabaja en el INFA (Instituto Ecuatoriano de la Niñez y la Familia) pero además de esto también tiene un negocio propio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo en su casa donde tiene un local el cual le ayuda a atender su mamá,  también vende en el trabajo ya que eso no le quita mayor tiempo, lleva dos años con su negocio y le ha ido bastante bien. Su mercadería se la envían desde New York por lo cual sus clientes cada vez que llega mercadería le piden que les muestre sus productos.
 
Este crédito es para pagar una mercadería que está por llegar como: pantalones, camisetas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso ["Well-Being and Progress"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado, in the Montecristi canton. The region is nationally and internationally known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artistry. It is the home of the famous straw hats.

Here we meet Irene. She is 36, single, and lives in her parents' home. She has been the treasurer since the beginning of the Communal Bank, and she likes it because the group is very united.

She works at INFA (Instituto Ecuatoriano de la Niñez y la Familia: Ecuadorian Institution for Childhood and the Family), but on top of this she also has a small business of her own. She sells all kinds of clothing in her home, where she has a shop which her mother helps her to tend. She also sells at work because this does not take up extra time. She has had her business for two years and it has gone very well for her. She gets her merchandise from New York, so every time it arrives her customers ask her to show them her products.

This loan is to pay for a pending order of items such as: pants, shirts and children's clothing, which is what she sells the most.

Her dreams are to continue working and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
“To work as hard as I can is one of my goals in life, because I know that as I aim to uplift the life of my family, I really have to make things to make it a reality,” Yolanda said. 

Yolanda Narag is a 49-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Agustin, a furniture worker, and they are blessed with six children and another who has passed away. Their children are Imee Rose, 25, who is married and a high school graduate; Sheryll, 23, who is a college graduate and now working in Manila; Ferdinand, 22, who is in his second year of college; Richard, 19, who is an elementary graduate; Val, 10, and Ramil Jay, 9, who are both studying in their elementary grades. They live in a community where furniture making is the major source of income for most of the residents. 

Yolanda is engaged in the vending business. She put up a small stall in front of their house where her customers go when they need to buy something. Some of her merchandise includes fish and meat. Her store is located beside their small furniture shop, which is managed by her husband. The couple is working hand in hand to make sure that they can provide the needs of their family and the education of their two youngest children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fish and fruits for her food stall.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Nelva, de 44 años es una mujer valiente. Ella enviudó hace 2 años y a pesar de sus limitaciones, cuida con mucho amor a sus 2 hijos; a los que educa en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Aunque le falta el apoyo de su esposo ella no se desanima, sabe que tiene que seguir para mejorar el futuro de sus hijos, a los que quiere mucho. Desde hace 20 años, comenzó con la siembra de papa y alverja en sus terrenos agrícolas. En aquellos tiempos trabajaba con su propio capital de trabajo, “el precio en el mercado era muy bueno y obtenía buenas ganancias”, afirma. Ahora las cosas cambiaron, las ganancias son menores. A raíz de ello comenzó a dedicarse a la ganadería, con la crianza de ovejas que enseba para venderlos a un mayor precio y los 2 toros que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra. Así ella tiene un ingreso extra a la agricultura y puede salir adelante en compañía de su familia. Hoy en día desea seguir adelante, pues su mayor sueño es pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayan” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura que con el apoyo de ustedes podrá salir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Nelva sembró papa de la variedad “yungay” y “canchan”; por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelva, 44, is a brave woman.  She was widowed two years ago and despite her limitations cares for her two children with much love.  She educates them in her own house located in Cayan.  Although she does not have her husband’s support any more she does not become discouraged.  She knows that she must go on in order to improve her children’s future whom she loves very much.

For the last twenty years she’s been growing potatoes and peas in her fields.  Back then she worked with her own working capital.  “Market prices were very good and I earned good profits,” she affirms.  Now, things have changed.  Profits are lower.  Because of this, she went into raising livestock.  She raises sheep that she fattens up to sell at a better price as well as two bulls that help her till the soil.  This way she earns extra income from farming and she and her family can get ahead.

At present, she’d like to continue moving forward because her dream is to be able to pay for her children’s university studies.  She’s a member of the “Progreso Cayan” communal bank and this is her first MFP loan where she’s sure to have your support so that she can get ahead.  Besides, she pledges to be punctual with her installment payments.

Nelva planted “Yungay” and “Canchan” varieties of potatoes thanks to the support she got from you.  She will invest the money she requested in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina, 39, is married and has 2 sons and 1 daughter. They live in Wehdat, where her husband works as truck driver.

Fatina is a well-spoken and intelligent lady who has a lot of experience in the trading field. She started a small business at home selling electronics such as vacuum cleaners, stereos, etc.  Now Fatina has applied for this loan to bring in more products to sell so she can help her husband in raising the family’s income.

loans.use: buy electronic products

loans.name: Carmen Manuela

texts.es:
Carmen de 55 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Paijan, la cual pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Carmen desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos y gallos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener su pesoy tamaño ideal los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento a sus animales y realizar algunos arreglos en su casa, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y mejorar económicamente para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 55 years old, lives with her family in their own house. It has electricity and water service and is located in the urban zone of the district of Paijan, which belongs to the department of La Libertad. This zone is known for its agricultural and livestock-raising activities.

Carmen has raised and sold domestic birds (hens, turkeys, and roosters) for a number of years. Her poultry yard is located behind her house. It is roomy and accommodating, and she feeds them a balanced food and natural grains. Once they reach their ideal weight and size, she offers them for sale in different markets in the zone, and thus she obtains good earnings to pay the daily household expenses.

She has applied for a loan of 1000 PEN at Edpyme Alternativa to buy more food for her animals and to make some repairs in her house. With the income that she obtains she can cover her loan and improve the quality of life of her family. Carmen is a hard-working woman and is very responsible. The only thing that she wants is that her children aim higher and to improve economically so that she can offer them more advanced schooling.

loans.use: to buy more food for her animals and make some repairs inside her house.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children. Lilia  has a stall where she sells her steamed rice cakes, coconut wine and vinegar. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy an additional steamer, ingredients for rice cakes, as well as coconut wine for additional income.

Lilia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lilia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell and ingredients for making rice cakes

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 37-year-old, single man.  He has earned a living from pig farming for three years.  Francis has been able to maintain his business because of his good reputation with customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

Francis has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy animal feed for his pig farming business. Since Francis joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for his pig farming business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Kitale, Westen Kenya. He is married with 5 children who are all in school. He has been in mixed farming for 5 years producing maize, milk, and eggs which he takes to the local market for sale.

John has made a third loan request of 61,200 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. His previous loans of 30,000 KES and 61,200 KES were promptly paid. He says the loan will help boost his milk production, meeting the demand of family consumption and selling the rest to meet other family needs.

John laments the high cost of dairy feeds and rampant diseases which consume a lot of resources.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Hope group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Patrick takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Patrick will invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Hope group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Patrick appears with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sopheakdey

texts.en:
Sopheakdey and his wife, Sreyrath, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters who are in school. 

Sopheakdey operates business designing windows and doors with mirrors. In the past, he used to be a driver. His wife now stays at home and does housework. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy additional materials needs in his business. He will use the loan to buy mirrors.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for his business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a single mother and has four dependents, which she is responsible for raising.  Yaa sells tomatoes, garden egg plants, onions and other food items in Besease. She has been in business for the past 10 years.  Yaa will use her loan to purchase more tomatoes, garden egg plants and onions to sell.  With the additional profit earned as a result of this loan, Yaa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, garden eggplants and onions to sell.

loans.name: Jlomawouton Group

texts.fr: JLOMAWOUTON est un groupement composé de quatorze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Gisèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gisèle est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple se partage ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Gisèle vend depuis huit ans environs, divers produits (riz, maïs, huile végétale) dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Gisèle fait la transformation de manioc en farine de manioc, qu'elle vend également dans sa région. Gisèle s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Gisèle et les autres membres du groupement JLOMAWOUTON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en: JLOMAWOUTON is a group composed of 14 people who live in the same village. They all have an income-generating activity. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business and to better meet the needs of their customers. The group representative, Gisèle, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Gisèle is 31 and is married to a farmer named Roger. The couple takes care of their 4 children. Some of them go to school. They both take care of the family financially. Gisèle never went to school. To support her family, Gisèle has been selling various products (rice, corn, palm oil) in her area. In addition to that, Gisèle processes cassava into cassava flour, which she also sells in her area. Gisèle buys her supplies from Benin. It is the first time that Gisèle and the other members of JLOMAWOUTON are applying for a loan from ALIDÉ. This loan will be used to boost their business.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and of rice.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doña Esmeralda, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa  junto a su padre y un hijo de 17 años de edad.
Es una señora muy trabajadora se gana la vida vendiendo ropa como blusas, pantalones, faldas y calzonetas, además vende artículos para el hogar en plásticos y ollas de peltre. Desde hace 9 años realiza esta actividad, la que le genera los ingresos del hogar.
Para mantener surtido el negocio ha solicitado financiamiento a ODEF, actualmente solicito el quinto préstamo para surtir mas el negocio en ropa como blusas, pantalones, faldas y cortinas, aprovechando la temporada alta de ventas. Se siente motivada seguir trabajando para tener un mejor nivel económico y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 57, is a single mother living in Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her father and a 17-year-old son.  She is a very hard working woman who earns her livelihood selling clothes like blouses, pants, skirts and swimsuits.  She also sells items for the home like plastic ware and pewter pots.  She’s been in this business for nine years and it generates household income.

To maintain her store well-stocked, she has asked ODEF for a loan, her fifth one, to stock the store with more blouses, pants, skirts and curtains taking advantages of the high sales season.  She feels motivated to continue working to improve her economic level and support her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 to 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and innovative. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables, such as kale, tomatoes, etc., and fruits, like mangoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located near a busy road and her primary customers are passengers and residents of the home area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometimes the prices of vegetables and fruits increase. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to run a well-stocked greengrocer with all kind of fruits and vegetables within five years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Djanira Guicella

texts.es:
Djanira es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeña hija y su tía, a quienes ama y agradece todo por todo el apoyo brindado, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Djanira no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 2 años Djanira puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, así también sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas.
Djanira se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como prendas de vestir para niños, polos, pantalones, polos, zapatos, entre otros; de esta manera Djanira tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder asegurar la educación y bienestar de su pequeña.

loans.use: Para comprar prendas de vestir para niños, polos, pantalones, polos, zapatos,etc.

loans.name: William Gilberto

texts.es: El cliente vive en el sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Aprendió esta actividad de su padre y luego de esto, emprendieron en un negocio familiar.  Trabaja con sus hermanos y ayudantes todos los días en su taller.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar.  Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, ninguno de ellos estudia aún.  Desea en un futuro, poder seguir trabajando de la mejor forma, con la finalidad de incrementar su clientela y también mejorar su estilo y condiciones de vida de toda su familia.  Ahora quiere invertir el crédito en materiales para su taller, como pinturas, soldadura, macilla y lijas.
texts.en: This client lives in the Guasmo area of Guayaquil.  He learnt this trade from his father and subsequently they set up a family business.  He works with his brothers and assistants every day in his workshop.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  He has 2 children, both minors and neither of them are studying yet.  In the future, he hopes to be able to continue working in the best way, so he can increase his customer base and also improve his entire family's lifestyle and living conditions.  He wants to invest the loan in material for his workshop, such as paint, welding supplies, filler and abrasives .

loans.use: to buy material for his workshop (abrasives, welding supples, paint and filler)

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odile (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Odile est mariée à un certain Modeste. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Odile et son mari. Pour cette raison, Odile vend des pâtes alimentaires, du thé et des œufs depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Odile s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Odile sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes alimentaires et des plateaux œufs.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman, 47 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Raquel has a weaving business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like abacca, silk and other materials for her business.

Raquel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like abacca, silk and other materials for her business

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Fish mongering is a great business right now in Uganda and Kiva is supporting many in this business currently.

Peninah, like Eunice Okepa, plans to hire a truck to go to Lake Victoria and buy fish for herself there. This is much less expensive than buying fish in her rural village. This loan will enable her to travel this long distance so she can bring lower prices to her village.

Most fish mongers in the village get their fish from middlemen at much higher prices. This loan will enable her to take a step most don't have the opportunity to take -- cutting out the middleman. She will get the fish smoked, in bulk, so that she can continue selling for a number of days.

Peninah is a proven businesswoman. She received a grant in 2001 from VEF to start her small business. She has been faithful with this help, and now is ready to take it to the next level.

loans.use: Buy Fish from Lake Victoria

loans.name: Edis Ermelinda

texts.en:
My name is Edis V. and I make and sell pork and beef burritos. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel as I am located near a bus terminal and many people buy my burritos. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase production in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to hire someone to help me cook and I will also be able to feed my family and give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Edis V. me dedico a la produccion y venta de burritas de carne de cerdo y res, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses y mucha gente compra mis burritas, mi negociome genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion para tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una persona que me ayude a cocinar asi mismo alimentar a mi familia y darles un buen estudio.

loans.use: To purchase tortillas, cheese, pork, chicken, salt, water, spices, bread, plates, cups, napkins, rice, beans, oil and butter.

loans.name: Ana Veronica

texts.en:
This is a family business, from Mrs Ana to her three children who all help tend to the store which is a small grocery store. They have two years of experience in this business and already have plans to expand. "We are growing and we have already ran out of space to buy merchandise in larger quantities, and so we need to expand our store, but to do so we need $1,200.00 which we hope will help us finalize our project."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Este es un negocio familiar, desde la Sra. Ana hasta sus tres hijos están al pendiente de atender el negocio que es una tiendita de abarrotes llevan 2 años con este negocio y ya tienen planes para expandirse. "Estamos creciendo y ya no tenemos lugar para comprar mercancía en cantidades mayores por lo que necesitamos ampliar el lugar para esto se necesita $1,200.00 dlls esperamos y podamos terminar con nuestro proyecto.

loans.use: To expand my store and to stock merchandise.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: F. Asif Adishirin oglu is a newly started young businessman from Imishli. He is 18 years old and he recently graduated from school. He is single and he is the only breadwinner in his family. He rented a room and started a vehicle spare part trading business. But due to the absence of his own capital, he cannot provide the clients with a comprehensive range of spare parts. He requested 900 USD as working capital.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Muradjon

texts.en: Muradjon S.  is 50 years old. He has a high level of education. His specialization is teaching. He is married and has 7 children. Muradjon is working as a teacher of English in a local school. He always helped his parents to look after cattle. He has skills breeding stock.  In his farm he has a barn and a small piece of land where he grows corn and trefoil (clover) for cattle. This activity is an additional source of income. For the loan amount of $575, Muradjon is going to buy 2 bull–calves for fatting and selling. This loan helps increase the amount of cattle and gives local community members the opportunity to buy the fatted cattle at a low price. Muradjon is going to pay off the loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy bull-calves for fatting and selling

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen says her past loans have helped improve her life a lot; she saves and re-invests almost every penny she makes. She says this loan will help her to buy another pig, which she will breed so that she will have more in about 7-8 months.

Carmen hopes to expand her livestock to incluD. hens and chickens by the end of the year; she knows that a more diverse product can increase her earnings. She is very thankful for her loan, and knows that it will help her to get closer to achieving her dreams.

NOTE: This $1200 loan will fund Carmen's business as well as seven other businesses in her solidarity group. She and seven other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a young mother who dedicates all of her time to caring for her children and has never considered leaving them alone without her protection. This is the reason she decided to work selling fruits near her home, and today she continues to work in a diligent manner and has increased more and more the merchandise that she offers. She sells fruit every day in a small stand set up in her rented house. The best day for selling her delicious fruits is Sunday. Nancy hopes every day to secure the well-being of her family even more, and with time, to realize the dream of having her own house. This is why her husband also works very hard. Nancy hopes to keep working and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of fruits. With the profits she obtains, she will increase the well-being and education of her small children when they reach school age. Let's support this young mother and her family to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Nancy, es una joven madre que dedica todo su tiempo al cuidado de sus niños y nunca ha pensado en dejarlos solos sin su amparo y esta es la razón por la que decidió trabajar vendiendo frutas cerca de su casa y es así como hasta hoy sigue trabajando de manera diligente y ha incrementado cada vez más la mercadería de frutas que ofrece.Diariamente ella los comercializa en su pequeño puesto habilitado en su domicilio alquilado y el mejor de los días para la venta de sus deliciosas frutas son los días domingos.Nancy espera cada día consolidar más el bienestar de su familia y con el tiempo albergar el sueño de la casa propia; es por ello que también su esposo trabaja arduamente Nancy desea seguir trabajando y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas y con las ganancias que obtenga incrementar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños en etapa escolar.Apoya a esta joven madre y a su familia a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of fruits to offer to her neighbors and the general public.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr:
Born in 1981 Mr A. Samuel is unmarried and takes care of three (3) people. Born in a poor family, he could not be educated and was therefore trained as a shoemaker. Having obtained his diploma of end of training 15 months ago, he decided to open a workshop, but without the means, he requests a financing of $400 which will help him buy material and supplies for the workshop so that he can meet his customers' needs. Thanks to this activity, he will be able to support himself as well as his three brothers.

Né en 1981 Monsieur A. Samuel est célibataire avec trois (3) personnes à sa charge. Né d’une famille pauvre il n’a pas pu évoluer dans ses études et entre en apprentissage de la cordonnerie. Ayant obtenu son diplôme de fin d’apprentissage il y a 15 mois, il décida d’ouvrir un atelier mais n’ayant pas de moyens, il sollicite un financement de $400 qui lui permettra l’achat de matériel et de fourniture de cordonnerie afin de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Grâce à cette activité, il arrive moyennement à se supporter et également ses trois frères.

loans.use: Opening of a shoe making workshop and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 41 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1999. During the first several years, she borrowed money to invest in breeding pigs. She and her husband also worked for the brick factory to repay the loan weekly. She always chose the loan that she could be able to repay. Besides using her income from the brick factory to repay the loan weekly, she also used it for family living spendings. For every farrow of pigs, she also got a decent amount of money. As time goes by, her family economy improves. Since the local economy also improves and many households invest in pot plants, she switches to this activity. So far, her greenhouse has more than 200 plants. She wants to borrow 375 USD to buy more fertilizer and pots. She hopes to get 600-800 USD the next time she sells her plants.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị N., 41 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999. Những năm đầu tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn còn vợ chồng chị đi làm gạch để lấy tiền trả tiền tuần. Chị luôn chọn các mức vốn phù hợp với khả năng hoàn trả của gia đình. Tiền làm gạch ngoài trả tiền tuần còn dùng chi tiêu cho các khoản tiêu dùng hàng ngày. Mỗi lần bán lứa lợn gia đình lại để ra được một khoản tiền kha khá. Qua các năm kinh tế gia đình chị N. dần dần nâng lên. Khi nhận thấy kinh tế địa phương phát triển, nhiều nhà có nhu cầu chơi cây cảnh, chị N. đã chuyển sang kinh doanh mặt hàng này. Đến nay trong vườn nhà chị đã có hơn 200 cây xanh. Chị N. mong muốn được vay 375USD mua phân bón và làm chậu cây cảnh. Chị hi vọng sẽ thu được 600-800USD trong đợt bán cây sắp tới.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and flowerpots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fried  fish and resell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: A. Christiana is a trader who sells clothing material and plastic containers. Her husband is a photographer and has 2 children. She wants to increase her stock to meet her increasing costumers’ demand. She is asking for $425 to buy more clothing materials and plastic containers to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and plastic containers

loans.name: Saumu's Jasiri Group

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 5 years old. Saumu has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Gudila, who sells clothing.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Kurbonbi

texts.ru:
Kurbonbi Nazurova lives in the town of Yavan. She is 38 years old, married and has six children. She is a housewife and has a small farm where she keeps sheep and calves. At this time she wants to buy a cow which will bring milk. She has a large family and because she is unable to provide them with dairy products, she decided to get a loan and purchase a cow. She plans to pay off the loan within six months. This will help her a lot as the cow costs a lot of money so this loan will be of great help and she will be able to pay it off partially within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Назурова Курбонби жительница города Яван. Возраст 38 лет , замужем и имеет 6 детей. Она домохозяйка. Но имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит овец и бычков. Но сейчас она хочет купить дойную корову , которая бы давала ей молоко. Так как у нее очень большая семья и она не может обеспечитьее молочными продуктами , она решила получить кредит и купить корову. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении шести месяцев. Это очень поможет ей так как приобрести корову сейчас очень дорого , а кредит выручит ее и она частично сможет погашать кредит течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of her house, by plastering the walls. She has worked for at the Rafaela Herrera school in the La Fonseca neighborhood in Nueva Guinea for 10 years. Currently, she is in her fourth year at the University of URACCAN. She fulfills her job duties with much responsibility and honesty and with a lot of desire to improve herself.

She has 3 children, the oldest daughter is 20 years old and is in her third year of university study, her younger son is 14 years old and in his fourth year of secondary school and the youngest son is 10 years old and in the fifth grade. Her husband also works as a teacher, as such they both contribute to covering the household expenses. Her dream is to have job stability, good health and a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Noemi está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar la casa, labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en colonia la Fonseca en Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años, actualmente está estudiando su cuarto año en la Universidad URACCAN, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, honestidad y mucho deseo de superación personal.

Tiene 3 hijos, la hija mayor de 20 años estudia su tercer año en la Universidad, el otro tiene 14 años estudia su 4to año de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado, su esposo también labora como docente y ambos comparten los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y salud.

loans.use: Plastering the walls of her house

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Elina Bengela. She is married and has no children.

In 2005, Elina established her grocery business. Working seven days a week, and 15 hours a day, she earns about US $60 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband.

Elina requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.. In the future, Elina plans to change the business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.fr:
Mrs. Félicité A. is a native of Togo and was born around 1969 in Palimè, Togo. She is married to Mr. Ganiou da-Silva, a professional cook. She is mother of three children: Comlan, Fionou, and Ablawa, 18, 15, and 14 respectively. She does traveling sales, selling various items but principally soap. Mrs. A. was ill these past two months and so has had to spend a lot of money regaining her health. She is requesting this loan with a view to getting her traveling sales business started up again.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Félicité est de nationalité togolaise et est née vers 1969 à Palimè au TOGO. Elle est mariée à monsieur da-SILVA Ganiou, cuisinier de profession. Elle est mère de trois (03) enfants: Comlan, Fionou et Ablawa agés respectivement de 18, 15 et 14 ans. Elle est ambulante et vend divers articles et principalement du savon. Dame A. Félicité a été malade courant les deux derniers mois et a donc énormément dépensé pour sa santé. Elle sollicite ce crédit en vue de relancer son commerce.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 cases of "Palmida" soap, 8 cases of "Fanico" soap, 2 cases of sugar and 1 case of "Mosquito" insecticide

Achat de 10 cartons de savon "PALMIDA"; de 8 cartons de savons "FANICO"; de 2 cartons de sucre et d'un carton d'insecticide "MOSQUITO".

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Chek P., 26, is a mother of two children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has been raising pigs at her home and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband, Chheng Sroly, has a business catching fish from the river and selling them to the market to earn an approximately around US$5 in profits per day. Chek is requesting a loan of US$1000 from Kiva to purchase a boat motor for her husband and the rest of the money is to be used to add more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for her husband and the rest of the money is used to add more livestock.

loans.name: Reymunda Juliana

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora Reymunda Areas se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y calzados en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende a su fiel clientela con mucho entusiasmo y amabilidad.

Ella es madre casada y con un pequeño niño el cual tiene el deber de mantener y brindarle todas las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es debido a que le es de urgencia comprar la ropa y calzados para la venta y es por este motivo que se apoya de Ceprodel esperando que su crédito le sea brindado y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leo, Mrs. Reymunda Areas is dedicated to the business of selling clothes and footwear in her own house where she attends to her loyal clientele with a lot of enthusiasm and friendliness.

She is a married mother with a small child who she has to take care of and give all of the necessary conditions for his success. The reason that she has come to Ceprodel is due to the urgency of buying clothes and footwear to sell, and for this reason she hopes that the support of Ceprodel and her loan will give her the chance to improver her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 24 años, estudio agroindustrias alimentarias, actualmente vive con su madre y sus hermanos menores. Se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace un año exactamente, su negocio pertenece también a una organización compuesta de 20 socios que están exportando la carne de cuy, y esto requiere de mayor inversión para la alimentación balanceada del cuy y del conejo, sobre todo un lugar apropiado donde criarlos. La carne del cuy es muy rentable porque tiene cero colesterol y ahora ya no puede abastecerse para cumplir los pedidos por la falta de espacio, no tiene donde criarlos en espacio abierto, porque en jaulas los animales se siente incómodos. Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP para solicitar un préstamo. Con este dinero comprará cuyes y conejas de raza, además preparará un lugar adecuado para la crianza.
texts.en:
Sarita is 24 years old and an agricultural food industry student. She currently lives with her mother and younger siblings. She has earned a living through raising guineas pigs for exactly one year, and her business also belongs to a 20-member organization that is exporting guinea pig meat. This requires a greater investment for a balanced diet for the guinea pigs and rabbits, and above all an appropriate place to raise the animals. Guinea pig meat is very profitable because it has zero cholesterol and now she cannot keep up with orders due to a lack of space. She does not have an open space to raise them, and the animals feel uncomfortable in the cages. This is the first time that she has turned to MFP to request a loan. With this money she will buy bred guinea pigs and rabbits, and will also prepare an adequate place to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and rabbits of better breeding

loans.name: Eyavi Akpévi

texts.fr:
Madame  A. Eyavi est né le 28 août 1958 à tsévié (Togo). Elle habite le quartier d’Agoè et est  une revendeuse de tissus pagnes, elle divorcé de son mari Mr ADABRA joseph qui est un actuellement à la retraite. Ils ont eu ensemble quatre (04) enfants.
Madame ADABRA exerce son commerce au marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Elle demande un prêt  de 350000F pour agrandir son commerce de pagnes surtout en ces périodes de fêtes ou la demande est très élevée. Avec ce premier crédit elle voudrait acheter quatre vingt (80) pagnes BELLE DAME et vingt sept pagnes velours et le bénéfice tiré de ce commerce lui permettra d’assumer les charges familiaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eyavi Akpévi A. was born on August 28, 1958 in Tsévié (Togo). She lives in the Agoè neighborhood and sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). She is divorced from her husband, Mr. Joseph Adabra who is presently retired. They have 4 children together.

Mrs. A. does her selling at the market in Agoè Assiyéyé. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 350,000 F to expand her "pagne" business, especially during this period of end-of-year festivities where demand is very high. With this first loan, she would like to buy 80 lengths of "pagne" of the Belle Dame brand and 27 "pagnes" in velveteen. The profit she makes from her business allows her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma N. la misma es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya es casada es micro empresaria se dedica a la confección de vestidos de alta costura como también uniformes de colegio y otros.
 Actualmente ha recurrido a la institución para compras de telas para confección de vestidos de fiestas ya que estamos en época de mucha frecuencia en acontecimientos como ser colación, recepciones, fiesta navidad, año nuevo. La misma es casada,  cuenta con todas las maquinarias que se necesita para dicha actividad como maquina de coser. Ovelo, tipo industrial lo cual le facilita mucho los trabajos. Cuenta con 8 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos lo que le permite contar con la capacidad de pago de dicha operación de 5MM a 12 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zulma N. is a loyal client of Fundación Paraguaya. She is married, a dressmaker specializing in fashionable dresses as well as school uniforms. With this loan she wishes to buy cloth to make into party dresses for the many Christmas and New Years’ events of the upcoming holiday season. Zulma has all of the necessary equipment, such as industrial sewing machines, to complete her work. She has worked in her business for 8 years and has many customers, which ensures she can repay her loan of 5MM PYG back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for holiday dresses

loans.name: Fo Koffi

texts.fr: A. fo koffi habite le quartier d’adidogomé awatamé à lomé, il et marié à AGODO Essi qui est revendeuse, fo koffi exerce comme activité le commerce de charbons de bois et de maïs en gros et en détail dans le quartier d’awatamé, il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un prêt de 400000f qu’il a bien remboursé, il sollicite maintenant un crédit 300000F pour pouvoir acheter du charbons de bois et de sacs de maïs pour rentabiliser son commerce. Il a à charges 03 personnes qui sont toutes ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fo Koffi A. lives in the Adidogomé Awatamé district in Lomé. He is married to Essi AGODO, who is a retailer. He does commerce in charcoal and corn at the wholesale and retail levels, in the Awatamé district. Having already had a WAGES loan of 400,000 francs that he has repaid, he is now requesting a loan of 300,000 francs, which will be used to buy some charcoal and sacks of corn in order to make his commerce profitable. He supports three persons, all of whom are his children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Ahlimba

texts.fr: Cette dame est une revendeuse d’oignons en gros et détails, l’oignon est un ingrédient très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise, elle maitrise bien son commerce car elle le fait depuis 1990, elle s’approvisionne à l’abatoire au grand marché de lomé. Elle demande à wages son premier crédit de 500000 pour l’achat des sacs d’oignons. Elle est célibataire et avec le surplus qu’elle gagne elle arrive à aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Ahlimba is a lady who sells onions both in wholesale and in retail. Onions are widely used in the Togolese kitchen. She is well experienced and has been in the business since 1990. She buys her provisions at the central karketplace in Lome. Ahlimba is requesting her first loan from wages for 50,000 XOF ( $975.00) to buy sacks of onions. She is single and with the extra that she earns, she will help support her family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of onions

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Juana es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Juana vende ropas a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Además Juana viaja a las ferias en donde compra quesos, cereales y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, cereales.
Juana sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se superen, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank, Brisas. Juana is married. She is 40 years old. She has 4 children. Juana sells clothing. She offers the clothing to friends and family. Her sales are on credit and her clients make weekly payments. Juana travels to local carnivals where she buys cheeses and cereals and she then sells them at local markets in the city of Ayacucho. Juana needs a loan of 400 Soles, which will later on be invested by purchasing cheeses and cereals. Juana dreams about providing an education to her children so that they can have a good life. She also dreams of improving her business.

(Translated by Edith of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and cereals to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling beer, sugar etc and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Mary is 40 years old and married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: La señora Elida tiene 58 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar con madera y tienen una hija. Tiene en su casa su pequeña bodega en donde vende productos de primera necesidad (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc.), y bebidas. En esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de un año y atiende todos los días a cualquier hora D. día. Lo que le gusta de su bodeguita es que mediante la mismo se relaciona con muchas personas y darles una buena atención es primordial, menciona Elida. La rentabilidad de su negocio se muestra en que Elida es la única persona que tiene una bodega en la zona donde vive, por lo que no tiene competencia. Para más adelante quiere constituir un minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos la obtención de sus necesidades diarias. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en el poco tiempo que tiene con su banco comunal ha notado que existe mucha unión. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá comprando productos de primera necesidad para implementar su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Elida is 58 years old; she lives with her husband who works with wood; they have one daughter. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic necessities (eggs, beans, rice, milk and bread, etc.), and drinks. She’s already been doing these activities for one year; she’s open for business everyday, all the time. What she likes about her work as a grocer is that she gets to interact with lots of people. Giving them good service is essential, Elida mentions. The profitability of her business illustrates that Elida is the only person in the neighborhood that has a grocery store, a competency that she didn’t have before. In the future, she wants to build a minimarket, thus enabling her neighbors to have their daily needs met. This is her first time requesting a loan with MFP, and in the short time that she’s interacted with the community bank she’s noticed tremendous unity. The desired loan will be invested in buying basic necessities to effectively operate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lham

texts.en:
Lham A. lives with her husband in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Lham is 61 years old and has retired with her husband. All her children have already grown up and live with their own families.

Since her retirement is not enough to cover her living expenses, she has started a small cafeteria/bar with the help of her children. She runs the small fast food cafeteria/bar in the town. It is quite common in Mongolia to have a small cafeteria and bar in the same place. During the mornings and afternoons the restaurant serves cafeteria style food and in the evenings it serves alcohol. Her restaurant/bar is located next to the town's sports center, and is usually full during sporting events.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients and beverages for her cafeteria/bar business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and beverages for her cafeteria/bar business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María S. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casado. Doña Ana tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Ana es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ana inicio vendiendo pocos productos y con los financiamientos fue mejorando su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos pedían. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Es por eso que solicita un financiamiento con el motivo de mejorar su inventario y comprar productos como granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan, leña y otros. Sus sueños son de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Maria S. is 36 and married with 2 children, both of whom are in school. For the past 7 years Ana has run a small neighborhood grocery store out of her home. She started out selling only a few products, but as her income has increased, she has been able to offer her clients what they ask for. Ana is seeking financing to expand her inventory and to buy products such as staple grains, soft drinks, juices, bread, firewood, etc. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of goods

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (1332030985) is a 36 year old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, C. owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  C. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: M. I. Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: María de los Santos Acuña M., María Auxiliadora R., Katty Brenda E. M. y Marina Isabel P. Rodríguez.

 El grupo solidario M.I., es formado por cuatro miembros, tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son originarios de la comarca El Hatillo de la ciudad de Masaya.

Doña María de los Santos ,  se dedica al destace de cerdo en su casa, ella vende carne, elabora nacatamales y chicharrones, todo lo vende en su casa, sus clientes son de la comunidad. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad y s conocida en su vecindario por vender nacatamales. Es soltera y vive con dos hijos mayores que le ayudan con los gastos pues trabajan en la zonas francas. Ella sueña con mejorar su cocina y comprar una refrigeradora para guardar alimentos.
 
Doña María Auxiliadora R. se dedica a la venta de perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene tres hijos que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Katty Brenda es una joven mujer, madre de un hijo, vende cosméticos variados a personas de su comunidad y de comunidades vecinas, se decidió a trabaja en este negocio desde que se casó y así tener su propio ingreso para comprarse lo que ella como mujer necesita. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad. Es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable.

Doña Marina Isabel P., es una  joven mujer madre de un hijo pequeño en edad escolar, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa desde hace varios años, la que ha ido creciendo poco a poco con financiamientos pequeños.Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, él es agricultor.
Ella sueña con mejorar la casa porque en los inviernos se le inunda un poco, con los créditos ella ha comprado por mayor los productos, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar las ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María de los Santos Acuña M., María Auxiliadora R., Katty Brenda E. M. y Marina Isabel P. Rodríguez. M.I. is a supportive group formed by four members. They have a lot of faith in each other. They are from the El Hatillo region in the city of Masaya. María de los Santos butchers pigs at her house. She sells the meat and makes tamales and “chicaronnes” (pork rinds). Her customers live in the community. She has been doing this for a many years, and she is well known in her neighborhood for selling tamales. She is single, and she lives with two grown children. They help with the expenses. They work in the duty-free zones. She dreams of improving her kitchen and buying a refrigerator to keep food. María Auxiliadora R. sells perishables in the Masaya market. She sells fruit, which she buys wholesale and sells at retail during the day. She has three children who go to school. Her husband is a businessman in the same market where she carries her products. He helps with the household expenses. Katty Brenda is a young woman who has one child. She sells various cosmetics to community members and neighbors. Since she got married she decided to work in this business in order to buy herself what a woman needs. Her husband helps with the household expenses by driving a taxi. She takes care of her small son and her business. She is the group’s coordinator because she is so responsible. Marina Isabel P. is a young mother with a small, school aged son. She has had a small mini market in her house for several years. The market has been growing little by little with small credits. Her husband is a farmer, and he helps with the household expenses. She dreams of improving her house because in the winter it floods a little bit. With the loans she has been able to buy wholesale products. This has helped her to increase her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and other goods to sell in mini markets

loans.name: Las Peñitas De F.e. Group

texts.es:
Flavio C. C. y su familia son originarios de Oaxaca desde pequeño ayudaba a su mama a ordeñar  vacas ya que el negocio familiar era la elaboración de queso y crema.
Cuando terminaba el  horario de clases Flavio y sus hermanos le ayudaban a sus padres a vender los quesos en las rancherías cercanas. En el pueblo no había mas oportunidad de progreso así que Flavio decide empezar una nueva vida en la ciudad de México y emprender un negocio, ayudándose de su conocimiento y experiencia en la elaboración y venta de quesos. El se dedico a la distribución de sus productos en los tianguis de su comunidad. 
Flavio se levanta a las 4 de la mañana a elaborar su queso, crema y productos lácteos para su venta diaria, también una vez por semana hace entregas de su mercancia oaxaqueña (cecina, mole, chorizo, totopos, tlayudas, chocolate Etc.)
Para esto le solicita a su hermano que vive en Oaxaca que le envié los productos antes mencionado.
El señor hace dos años tuvo un accidente,  un trailer lo envistió y estuvo un año incapacitado y perdió todo. Ahora retoma su negocio nuevamente por eso decide formar un grupo con su esposa y su mama y  solicitar un crédito a Fundación Realidad A.C. para asi poder comprar materia prima (cuajo, sal, calcio, titanio  conservador, gas, tambos)  y mercancia oaxaqueña (cecina, mole, chorizo, totopos, tlayudas, chocolate etc.) Ya que sus ventas están incrementando 
El  y su familia tienen el anhelo de superarse y darle una mejor oportunidad en la vida a sus 4 hijos.

Nombre de grupo: Las Peñitas
Numero de integrantes 3
Monto solicitado: 15,000
Fecha  de desembolso: 07-de julio-2009
Nombres de las integrantes:
 Rosa María C. Castro: Venta de quesos y cosméticos  
 Patricia C. Núñez: Venta de queso y mercancia oaxaqueña 
 Flavio C. C.: Elaboración y venta de queso, crema y mercancia oaxaqueña

Comentarios de los integrantes del grupo      
 
"Gracias a las personas que nos apoyan y confían en nosotros para poder salir adelante"
texts.en:
Flavio C. C. and his family are originally from Oaxaca. Since childhood he has helped his mother milk cows for the family's business making cheese and cream. After school, Flavio and his brothers would help his parents sell the cheese at workers' quarters in nearby ranches.
