In their town there wasn't much opportunity to advance, so Flavio decided to start a new life in Mexico City and launch a business, helping him learn more and gain experience in making and selling cheeses. He dedicated himself to the distribution of his products in the community's street markets. Flavio gets up at 4:00 a.m. to make his cheese, cream and other dairy products to sell daily. Also, once a week he delivers his Oaxacan merchandise: cecina (cured, smoked meat), mole (chili sauce with chocolate and peanuts), chorizo (seasoned pork sausage), totopos (tortilla chips), tlayudas (large, crunchy tortilla topped with refried beans, meat, cheese, and salsa), chocolate, etc. For this he asks his brother who lives in Oaxaca to send him the above-mentioned products. Two years ago he had an accident; a trailer hit him and for a year he was disabled and lost everything because he couldn't work. Now he has re-started his business and thus decided to start a lending group with his wife and mother and request a loan from Fundación Realidad A.C. to be able to buy raw materials (rennet, salt, calcium, titanium preservative, propane, cans) and Oaxacan products. His sales are already growing. Flavio longs to advance himself and give his 4 children better opportunities. Group name: Las Peñitas Number of members: 3 Requested amount: 15,000 Disbursement date: July 7, 2009 Member names: Rosa María C. Castro: Sale of cheese and cosmetics Patricia C. Núñez: Sale of cheese and Oaxacan products Flavio C. C.: Production and sale of cheese, cream, and Oaxacan products Member comments: "Thank you to the people who support and trust us to be able to advance in life."

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cans to store milk, purchase rennet, salt, calcium, titanium, preservatives for cheese, cream, and cottage cheese. Purchase Oaxacan products such as cesina, mole, chorizo, tlayudas, totopo y chocolate etc.

loans.name: Afi Edem

texts.fr: Cette femme est une veuve qui a à sa charge ses 02 enfants, elle a abandonné sa profession d’institutrice pour se lancer dans le commerce produits cosmétiques, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de chaussures et de sacs. Avec son commerce elle subvient mieux aux charges de sa famille, sa clientèle grandit ce qui l’oblige à agrandir son stock, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des produits cosmétiques, 10 chaussures et 5 sacs.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow who has two children in her care.  She left her profession as a primary school teacher in order to get started in the commerce of cosmetics.  She later included with this business the sale of shoes and bags.  With this business, she provides more for her family.  Her customer base is growing, and this compels her to expand her inventory.  This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy some cosmetic products, ten shoes, and five bags. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products, shoes, and bags to sell

loans.name: Aromeñitas Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Senkata ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, hace diez años, se formo la asociación “Aromeñitas”, Otilia C. que actualmente es la presidenta, es una de las fundadoras, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas a formar parte del grupo.
Las integrantes de este grupo en su mayoría se dedican al comercio, diferente productos son vendidos en ferias y puestos de la ciudad , Martha por ejemplo vende papa en la feria 12 de octubre (El Alto), otras socias venden, zapatos, mandiles, plásticos, medias, juguetes, además también Narciso C., que también es integrante del grupo ofrece servicio de taxi. La asociación Aromeñitas necesita comprar productos en mayor cantidad para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en la comunidad de J. Yanapa.

Inicia su Trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le servirá como capital para la compra de ovinos y gallinas.

Su deseo trabajar para ayudar a su familia.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the Communal Bank, “Jesus de Nazareth,” located in the populated center of Lopez in Ilave, and the Collao province in the district of Puno. She is 19 years old, unmarried and has no children. Asunta competed her secondary studies and lives in the J. Yanapa community. She is just beginning her participation with the Manuela Ramos Movement, and this is her first loan of 500.00 PEN ($175). These funds will be used as capital for the purchase sheep and hens. Her desire is to work to help her family. She appreciates the opportunity for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and hens.

loans.name: Cristina Lisseth

texts.es: Cristina Lisseth

loans.use: Comprar el motor de gasolina para su molino

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
A la casa del señor Marciano P. le está haciendo falta un cuarto más pero en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible ya que el se encargara de la construcción en horario adicional a su trabaja. 
Don Marciano es empleado de una compañía de construcción en el departamento de albañil, este es el ingreso que el genera para su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la recamara que será de sus dos hijas ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que genera de su trabajo, su esposa la señora Gloria Mendoza se encargara de los gastos de la casa, con los ingreso de su trabajo como limpieza en casa particular.

loans.use: Ampliación de un cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa

loans.name: Alihossi

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est lancée en 2002 dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale ; parce que son mari a eu sa retraite et il fallait assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs 05 enfants. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle avait prise cette décision. Elle exerce cette activité dans le quartier d’Adamavo à Lomé. Elle a ouvert une boutique dans sa maison et vend des pâtes alimentaires, des sardines, des tomates en boîtes, des mayonnaises et divers produits. Elle accueille bien sa clientèle et est très connue de plusieurs ménages. Elle a approché WAGES pour pouvoir renouveler son stock de marchandises en baisse. Le prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 cartons de sardines, 15 cartons de tomates en boîtes, des savons, de l’huile de cuisine et des produits divers.
texts.en:
In 2002 this woman began selling general food products because her husband retired and she had to provide for the education of her 05 children. It is for this reason that she made this decision. She practices her profession in the Adamavo neighborhood in Lomé. She opened a store in her home and sells pasta, sardines, canned tomatoes, mayonnaise and various other products. She is very accommodating to her customers and is well known in several households. She approached WAGES in order to be able to replenish her stock of decreasing merchandise. This loan will allow her to purchase 10 boxes of sardines, 15 boxes of canned tomatoes, soap, kitchen oil, and various other products.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm

loans.name: A. Marie Christine

texts.fr: K. A. Marie Christine est née en 1966 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Marie Christine vit depuis 23 ans à Dogoudo à Allada. Mariée à TCHATCHABLOUKOU Ferdinand, un directeur d’école à Sékou, non loin de Allada, Marie Christine est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Marie Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie Christine a été à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Depuis 23 ans, Marie Christine vend des canaris à Allada, afin de subvenir à ses besoins. C’est à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin, que  Marie Christine s’approvisionne. Marie Christine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’accroître son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie Christine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Marie Christine K. was born in 1966 in Allada, the the Atlantic Department of Bénin. She has lived for 23 years in Dogoudo, in Allada. Married to Ferdinand TCHATCHABLOUKOU, the director of a school in Sékou, not far from Allada, Marie Christine is the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. The couple works together to support the family. Marie Christine left school before high school. For the last 23 years, she has been selling large pottery vessels in Allada to help meet financial needs. She purchases the bowls in Bohicon in Zou. A long-time client of ALIDé, Marie Christine has always repaid her loans without problem. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to increase her business and meet client demands.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 dozen pottery bowls

loans.name: Batmagnai

texts.en:
Batmagnai Y. is 40 years old.  He lives with his spouse and three teenage children in Uvs province, one of the western provinces. All of his children go to a local secondary school. 

Batmagnai has a small shoe-making business with his wife. He is a talented and locally recognized shoemaker who has been making traditional shoes for women and men with his wife since 2006. They mostly make warm shoes for cold seasons. In winter, many locals purchase their shoes. Local herders and small business owners who work outside during cold winters absolutely need their warm shoes. 

Batmagnai says that he would like to expand his business into a small shoe shop where he would have shoe-making machinery and a shop to sell his products. He is requesting a loan to purchase the materials necessary for shoe-making. Batmagnai and his wife Altanzul are pictured above. 

About XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase the materials necessary for shoe-making

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Florence works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in fresh fish, which supplies to food vendors. She buys fresh fish directly from the fishermen in her community. Florence also trades in curtains. Florence has been in business for 10 years and wishes to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Syrga's Group

texts.ru:
Токтакунова Сырга – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок восемь лет. Она вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Балыкчи. Балыкчи – один из тех городов, который прежде относился к одному из растущих городов. Однако с развалом СССР, начал терять потенциал и за пятнадцать лет превратился в «мёртвый» город. Муж Сырга, был вынужден уехать из города, так как, возможности найти работу практически не осталось. Сейчас он работает в Бишкеке. Ему удалось начать своё дело. Он занимается перепродажей автомобилей. Сырга осталась в Балыкчи. Дети были маленькие, и Сырга осталась с ними дома. Благодаря бизнесу мужа, они десять лет тому назад купили дом. Сырга сразу догадалась, что пока есть средства, нужно построить магазин и начать торговлю. Так Сырга смогла начать своё дело. Сейчас она торгует прохладительными напитками, кондитерскими изделиями, копчёной рыбой и продовольственными  товарами. В месяц ей удаётся заработать до десяти тысяч сомов ($230). Дети Сырга уже подросли. Старшему сыну шестнадцать лет. Скоро уже и школу закончит. Младшей дочери девять лет. Сырга обратилась за этим кредитом, с целью вложить их в товарооборот, закупить продовольственные товары и побольше кондитерских изделий для новогоднего периода. 

У Сырга четыре партнёра по группе:

Мурсаевой Базаркул пятьдесят один год. Базаркул не замужем. У неё три дочери. Базаркул уже выдала две старшие дочери замуж. Младшей всего шесть лет. Чтобы прокормить себя и дочку, Базаркул продаёт по организациям под зарплаты трикотажные изделия. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить носков изделий, женских шапок,  и детских изделий. 

Толомушевой Шарый пятьдесят два года. Муж Шарый уже на пенсии. Сама Шарый торгует в павильоне продуктами питания, а также у них есть баня, которую они топят для клиентов три раза в неделю. Шарый надеется получить кредит для ремонта бани.

Бектургановой Бурулсун, пятьдесят восемь лет. Бурулсун – вдова. Она работает учительницей в средней школе, а также получает пенсию. Дочь Бурулсун работает в швейном цехе. Она шьёт и продаёт бальные платья. Бурулсун нужен кредит, чтобы закупить ткани для шитья бальных платьев. 

Жолдошбековой Айзаде девятнадцать лет. Она замужем и у неё уже есть сын, которому одиннадцать месяцев. Муж Айзады работает диспетчером в ОсОО «Кызыл – Саз Транс». Свёкр дома занимается ремонтом автомашин. Айзада обратилась за кредитом, чтобы помочь свёкру купить коробку передач, амортизаторы и другие автозапчасти. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Syrga T. is the leader of this group. She is forty-eight years old and lives in the city of Balykchi together with her family. Balykchi is one of those cities previously considered to be one of the growing cities; however, due to the breakup of the USSR, it began to lose its potential and became a “dead” city over the course of fifteen years. Syrga’s husband had to leave the city because there was no realistic possibility of finding work. He now works in Bishkek. He was able to start his own business and is involved in reselling cars. Syrga stayed in Balykchi. The children were young, and Syrga stayed home with them. Thanks to her husband’s business, they bought a house ten years ago. Syrga quickly realized that while they had the means, she needed to build a store and begin sales. Thus, Syrga was able to start her business. Currently, she sells refreshments, candy, smoked fish and other food products. Just in a month, she is able to earn up to ten thousand som ($230). Syrga’s children already grew up. The oldest son is sixteen years old. He will soon be graduating from school. The youngest daughter is nine years old. Syrga requested this loan with the goal of investing this money into product turnover, purchasing food products and more candy for the New Year period.

Syrga has four partners in this group:

Bazarkul M. is fifty-one years old. Bazarkul is not married. She has three daughters. Bazarkul already married off her two older daughters. The youngest is only six years old. In order to support herself and her daughter, Bazarkul sells textile goods to businesses. Currently, she needs a loan in order to purchase socks, women’s hats and children’s goods.

Shariy T. is fifty-two years old. Her husband is already retired. Shariy sells food products at a shopping center. They also own a sauna that they run for clients three times per week. Shariy is hoping to obtain a loan to repair the sauna.

Burulsun B. is fifty-eight years old. She is a widow. She works as a teacher at a secondary school and also receives a pension. Burulson’s daughter works at a textile factory. She sews and sells ballroom gowns. Burulsun need a loan in order to purchase fabric for making ballroom gowns.

Ayzada J. is nineteen years old. She is married and already has a son, who is eleven months old. Ayzada’s husband works as a dispatcher at the “Kyzyl-Saz Trans” company. Her father-in-law is involved in car repairs at home. Ayzada requested this loan in order to help her father-in-law purchase a transmission box, suspension shocks and other auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products and candy for the New Year period

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Renante

texts.en: Renante, 30 years old, lives by farming. He is married and has three children. His farm is the only source of income his family has, so he makes sure to keep his farm healthy for rice crops. He spends the whole day on the farm and although it is tiring, he still enjoys doing it. He is now preparing his land for planting. He he needs materials for the farm, so he applied to CEVI. He is asking for a loan of Php 6,000. He will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lwamba Development Group, Mityana

texts.en: M. Samuel, pictured separately at the top left, is a part of the big group. He is a patient and hard working man, married with five children, out of which three are in secondary and two in primary school.  He also takes care of two dependants. Samuel is a produce buyer from Lwamba of Mityana from which he is able to make profits that enable him to take good care of his family. This is Samuel’s second loan from Kiva partner Pearl Microfinance and he is happy that his first loan helped him buy more produce for resale just as he hopese this will do in order to enable him  to make more profits. He buys produce such as rice, beans, maize, etc. for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce.

loans.name: Dine

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Dine est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Dine s’est installée depuis une dizaine d’année à Hêdomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Dine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs différentes charges. Pour y arriver, Dine mène comme activité principale, la vente de savons (de lessive et de toilette) à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Dine vend également des tissus et des fournitures scolaires. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Dine s’approvisionne. Dine exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et à déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé. Dine a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Dine envisage augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin d’augmenter la clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C’est pourquoi Dine sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Dine A. was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She's married and the mother of three children, who all attend school. For about ten years, Dine has been living in Hêdomey, in the city of Abomey Calavi. She lives alone with her children, and has to support their various expenses on her own. To manage it, her main business consists in selling clothing detergent and toilet soaps at her home, as well as an ambulant saleswoman. As a secondary business, she also sells fabrics and school supplies. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Dine has been running this business for eight years, and already benefited from one loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. This loan was repaid without problems. Dine would like to bolster her stock, in order to increase her clientele and her income. This is why she's seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy several boxes of soaps, and three boxes of notebooks

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, el señor Santos P. se dedica a la venta de calzados tanto para damas como caballeros ofreciéndolos a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en su localidad.

Actualmente está buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones del negocio y está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de dichos calzados para continuar ofertándolos y así mejorar las condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
Santos P. sells women's and men's shoes in Managua's Mayoreo market every day from very early in the morning on. He is currently looking for a way to improve the condition of his business so he's requesting funds to buy shoes so that he can continue to offer them for sale thus improving his business' condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es:
El Sr. Cárcamo M. es un ganadero que vive con Chorrera – Palermo una comunidad del municipio del Viejo.

El va a utilizar el crédito para la compra de terneros para desarrollo ya que el se dedica a la producción de ganado.

El Sr. Cárcamo actualmente ha tenido 4 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado bien, de igual manera se siente muy agradecido con la Institución  por todo el apoyo que le se le ha brindado y espera seguir siendo apoyado para seguir generando mayores Ingresos.
texts.en:
El Sr. Cárcamo M. es un ganadero que vive con Chorrera – Palermo una comunidad del municipio del Viejo. El va a utilizar el crédito para la compra de terneros para desarrollo ya que el se dedica a la producción de ganado. El Sr. Cárcamo actualmente ha tenido 4 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pagado bien, de igual manera se siente muy agradecido con la Institución por todo el apoyo que le se le ha brindado y espera seguir siendo apoyado para seguir generando mayores Ingresos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Terneros para Desarrollo

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia F. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Delia joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mr. Pon K. was born in 1948 and he lives in Chrouy Chrey village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Orim Yat, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mr. Pon K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. He is the father of a child who is a farmer too. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Luz tiene una hija de 1 año y es conviviente y vive en la casa de sus padres, desde muy niña ayudaba a sus padres en la venta de frutas, actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado mayoristas de frutas en donde vende frutas de acuerdo a la temporada, ahora vende plátano y piña, actividad que realiza desde la madrugada hasta las 5 de la tarde. Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro. 
Luz necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátanos. El sueño de Luz es cambiar de negocio por la venta de ropa o ferretería y tener un hotel.
texts.en:
Luz has a 1 year old daughter and shares a home, living in the house of her parents. From a very young age she helped her parents selling fruit. At present she has a position in the wholesale fruit market where she sells fruits according to the season. Now she sells bananas and pineapple, an activity that she performs from the early morning to 5 in the afternoon. Luz belongs to the New Life Communal Bank and what she likes most is the incentive to save. Luz needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of bananas. The dream of Luz is to change her business to the sale of clothing or hardware and to have a hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Rosa Clementina

texts.es:
Rosa de 52 años,  ella vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tienen dos hijos y tiene una tienda de vivieres, hace aproximadamente 10 años con un dinero que tenia reunido ella invirtió en arroz, aceites y legumbres. 

Rosa ahora trabaja en la tienda desde las 05h00am hasta el anochecer, vende en su tienda arroz, bebidas y legumbres entre otros, pero para seguir con su tienda ella quiere comprar cilindros de gas para venderlos, bebidas y cuadernos. 

En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, lives in a periurban area in El Fortín, Guayaquil. She has two children and she owns a grocery store. About 10 years ago she used some savings she had to buy rice, cooking oil and vegetables. Rosa is now open for business from 5am until nightfall. She stocks rice, beverages and vegetables among other items. In order to continue she needs to buy gas cylinders, beverages and notebooks to sell. In the future she’d like to buy a van for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For gas cylinders, beverages, vegetables.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad T. is a working mother from Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip. She is the mother of Haitham, Maysam, Ala and Aala' who are five, four, two and one year old respectively. Nihad and her husband own a juice stall where they sell all kinds of fresh juice. Nihad works in the shop during the day while her husband, Muhammad, works as a mobile vendor, as shown in the picture above.

Nihad took a $800 loan from FATEN to purchase a professional juicer, which will save time and make juice faster. Nihad and her husband plan to have a juice shop by saving their income from their businesses and by using a second loan from FATEN when the current loan is repaid.

Nihad comes from a conservative background, so her husband, Muhammad, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase a professional juicer

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna G. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 46 years old and is married with four adult children. Edna owns and operates a business growing rice and selling her harvested rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2007, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice production

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Natif de Koutiala, Monsieur Issa Traoré a 39 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec ses femmes  et ses enfants dans le quartier Koko  de la ville de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ). 
Monsieur  Issa Traoré n’a pas  été à  l’école,  c’est pour cela qu’il n’a pas prit du temps à s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis  son jeune âge auprès   de son père commerçant. 
Il est bien connu dans la vente de plastiques et  divers autres articles, il reçoit des commandes   à travers les petits détaillants de la ville de Koutiala. 
Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité et en quantité, il a décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles en plastiques à Bobo Dioulaso au Burkina Faso. 
Il a une boutique de vente de plastique au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente tous les jours à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit. 
Avec  ce nouveau prêt, Issa Traoré compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des  d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités.
texts.en:
A native of Koutiala, Mr. Issa Traoré is a 39-year-old married father of three. He lives with his wives and children in the Koko neighborhood of Koutiala in the Sikasso region. Because Mr. Traoré did not attend school, he became involved very early on in business activities with his shopkeeper father. He is well known for the sale of plastics and other items, and receives orders through small retailers in the city of Koutiala. To satisfy his clients in both quantity and quality, he is working with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to purchase a large number of plastic items in Bobo Dioulaso, Burkina Faso. Mr. Traoré has a plastics store in the large market of Koutiala and sells daily to a customer base made up of men and women, both for cash and for credit. With this new loan, Issa Traoré expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000FCFA, which he plans to use to pay back the interest to Soro Yiriwaso, improve living conditions for his family, and invest in his business.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various plastic products

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Panamericana  es un centro que se encuentra camino a la ciudad de Copacabana. En el mismo ha renovado crédito la asociación comunal de “Yungueñitas”, este grupo consta de ocho socias, está iniciando su décimo séptimo ciclo,  es decir que las socias más antiguas están alrededor de 8 años en nuestra institución;  a la cabeza se encuentre la señora Verónica como presidenta.

La  señora Verónica comenta que es una fundadora, por que se encuentra desde el primer ciclo de funcionamiento de la Asociación. Su negocio está diversificado, pues tiene un negocio de venta de chicharrón y otro de venta de ropa, su hermanita le ayuda con la atención de los clientes. Las ventas son realizadas en las diferentes ferias de El Alto, en las zonas de 16 de Julio  (jueves y domingo), Rio Seco y la Ceja los otros días. Su primer crédito fue de $us100.- y le sirvió para comprar material de trabajo, para este nuevo ciclo está solicitando Bs.3000.- para la compra de mercadería. Este esfuerzo es el que le permite, junto a su esposo, criar a sus cinco hijos.

En relación al resto de los integrantes la A.C. “Yungueñitas” también tienen sus propios negocios en servicio, producción y comercio
texts.en:
The Panamerican Focal Center is a center that has found it way to the city of Copacabana. At this very center the “Yungueñitas” communal association has renewed its credit. This group has eight members, it is beginning its seventeenth cycle. Its most long-standing members have been in our institution for around 8 years; at its head is the president Verónica. Verónica mentions that she is a founding member, because she is from the first cycle of the Association's operation. Her business is diverse, as she has a business selling pork crackling and another selling clothes, her younger sister helps her look after her customers. The sales are made at the different markets of El Alto, in the areas: "16 de Julio" (Thursday and Sunday), "Rio Seco" and "la Ceja" the other days. Her first loan was for $us100.- and she used it to buy material for work, for this new cycle she is asking for Bs.3000.- for the purchase of merchandise. This effort allows her, together with her husband, to raise their five children. Regarding the other members of the “Yungueñitas” association they also have their own businesses in service, production and business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Roselieta's Group

texts.en:
Roselieta R. is from the village of Balok. She is 40 years old. Roselieta is the leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if the other person is delinquent or defaults.

Roselieta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Roselieta owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Roselieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a week.

In 2008, Roselieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Roselieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Roselieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Roselieta's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which lets Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan Q. is a young and energetic guy who is married and has one child. He is young and full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better.

Elshan raises sheep in a small village in the Agsu region. Elshan’s primary clients are butchers. He started his business a year ago. He took up the business of his father, who is now a pensioner. Elshan has great experience in sheep breeding and the farming business because he has observed it from childhood.

Elshan would like to expand his business, and so he has asked for a loan of 900 AZN to buy eight sheep and fodder. This will help him to increase his income and improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase eight sheep and fodder

loans.name: Naana

texts.en: Naana A. is into the sale of second-hand clothing. She is married and has four children. She has been in this business for five years now. Her husband is a driver. Naana uses her income she makes from her sales to feed the family as a way of helping her husband. Naana will use the loan to purchase additional bales of second-hand clothes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naana plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: purchase additional bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion M. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 61 years old. Encarnacion is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Encarnacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Encarnacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

Encarnacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Encarnacion has successfully repaid a previous from ASKI. Encarnacion is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Encarnacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Saing's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of eight members. They are living in Reang Dek village, Kandal province. This village members selected Mrs. Saing C., a 48-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. Each members will use their portion of the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Saing C. earns her living through pig raising. With this business, she does not have enough money to buy pig food for her pig raising. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase pig food for her current business. Her husband, Mr. Eng Mao, owns a threshing machine which it has been rented to villagers for a profit. This couple has four children: one of whom is a fisherman, and others two help their parents on current businesses. The youngest one is attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fish food for fish raising.

loans.name: Alfonzo

texts.es: Alfonso, de 57 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Teodora de 45 años y su querida hija menor Zulma de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con el apoyo de su esposa, Alfonso decidió comprar hace 30 años, unos terrenos en los deseaba trabajar y así mejorar la economía de su familia. Actualmente esos terrenos son trabajados, pero son más productivos que antes, ya que con el paso del tiempo ha aprendido a obtener la mayor producción de café, cacao y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP; esta muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fortalecer sus sembríos, también invertirá en la compra de ganado, para iniciar un negocio de venta de carne.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 57, is an unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Teodora, 45, and his beloved youngest daughter Zulma, 14, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.

With his wife’s help, Alfonso decided 30 years ago to buy some land that he wanted to farm to improve his family’s income.  Currently those fields are farmed and are more productive than before because as time has gone by he has learned how to obtain larger production of coffee, cocoa beans and coca leaves.

What he enjoys most about the work is the close relationship he has with the soil; he also very much enjoys watching his plants grow.  He has been in this line of work for 40 years and considers the most difficult part of it protecting his fields from the inclement weather because any distraction can affect the crops.  In the future he hopes to buy new fields to increase production.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He is very happy to get it because he urgently needs it to improve his business.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more manure to strengthen his plantings and he will also buy cattle to start a business selling meat.

loans.use: To buy manure and steers to start selling meat.

loans.name: José Avelino

texts.es:
José Avelino es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Las Lomas, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas. El cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde ha instalado el sembrío de arroz. José se vale de esta actividad para sacar adelante la economía de su familia, por ello trata siempre de mantener a su actividad trabajando del mejor modo posible. El ya cuenta con varios años trabajando en esta actividad, por ello conoce bastante sobre el manejo de estos cultivos.

José desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y así garantizarse una buena cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa realizar su meta.
texts.en:
José Avelino, 50, is a father living with his wife and children in a rural area of Las Lomas district, an agricultural district located in Piura region, located about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He’s been a farmer since very young.  He has a small piece of farm land where he grows rice.  José counts on this activity to support his family so always makes an effort to keep the business working in the best possible way.  He has many years experience working in this line of work so he is quite knowledgeable about handling these crops.

José wants to get fertilizers to maintain the crops thus guaranteeing a good harvest.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that he plans to use to reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector managing a buy and sell of beddings. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of beddings like pillows, matts, blankets and bedsheets in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ta-Marsu Group

texts.en:
Members of the “Ta-marsu Group” from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, are pictured here. They are small businessmen who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL for each group member. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers and increase sales and profits, thereby improving their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Osman K.. Osman was born in the northern city of Makeni about 61 years ago. He is married and has seven children, two of whom are still attending school. For the past four years, Osman has been selling shoes. With his share of this loan, Osman will buy dozens of slippers to add to his inventory.

loans.use: to buy slippers to increase inventory

loans.name: El Rubi Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Rubi lo integran 3 mujeres, todas muy unidas y estan ubicadas en el Barrio las Flores de la ciudad de El Paraiso, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Mayra Yolanda Z. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de tajaditas de plátano, tiene mucha experiencia en fabricar tajaditas de platano fritas..
Doña Mayra es una mujer que a sabido ganarse a su clientela, por el buen sabor, la cantidad por porción y los precios que ella ofrece, además de la venta de tajaditas de plátano también se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y sus derivados, esta actividad la realiza solamente los días sábados de cada semana.
Mayra utilizara el credito para la compra de platanos, aceite y sal.

la sra. Maria Rosario N. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas.
Doña Maria es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad que realiza, ya que las golosinas que  vende son de muy buen sabor, cuenta con una gran clientela.
 además de los ingresos que percibe en su negocio cuenta con ayuda económica por parte de su esposo ya que el le envía remesas desde los Estados Unidos por lo que es notable que sus condiciones de vida son muy favorables. Pero esto no le quita el entusiasmo de trabajar. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus golosinas.

La sra. Deysi Judith O. C. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de pan y rosquillas. Durante todo este tiempo Deysi a perfeccionado su técnica para la elaboración de rosquillas y pan logrando obtener muy buen sabor en su producto, tiene una gran clientela ya que su producto tiene gran demanda, ofrece precios bajos a los mayoristas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima y continuar elaborando su producto y cubriendo la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rubi group is made up of three women who are very close to each other and live in the neighborhood of Las Flores in the city of El Paraíso.  Below is more information about the different work that they do.

Mayra Yolanda Z. is a merchant who sells sliced bananas.  She has a lot of experience making fried sliced bananas.  Doña Mayra won over customers with good flavors, good portion sizes, and good prices.  In addition to selling sliced bananas, she also sells pork on Saturdays.  Mayra will use this loan to purchase bananas, oil, and salt.

Maria Rosario N. is a merchant who sells sweets.  She is well known in her community for her work.  The sweets she sells are tasty, so she has a lot of customers.  In addition to the income she earns from her business, her husband sends money every month from the United States, so her living conditions are good.  However, she is still eager to work.  She will use this loan to purchase materials to make her sweets.

Deysi Judith O. C. is a merchant who makes and sells bread and pastries.  Deysi has been perfecting her bread and pastry making technique for a long time to create a good tasting product.  She has a lot of customers because there is a lot of demand for her products.  She offers low prices to wholesalers.  She will use this loan to purchase materials to make bread and pastries so that she can continue baking and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, butter, sugar, bananas, oil, salt, tortillas, vegetables, meat, potatoes and yucca

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Mrs. Dioscora G., 59 years old, is widowed and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She strives hard to make a living. It is not easy for her to be alone without a partner, but life must go on with Dioscora. She was blessed with four children, who are now adults.

Dioscora's primary source of income comes from her sari-sari (general) store. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2009 and has already had two loans. Dioscora says she is thankful for the cooperative because of the financial assistance given to her family. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari business. She hopes for a bountiful life ahead. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional goods

loans.name: Nyorence Anyango

texts.en:
Nyorence Anyango W. is 30 years old. She is a widow and lives in the Manyatta area with her 16-year-old son. 

For the past four years, Nyorence has a run retail shop in Manyatta. Her monthly income is 10,000 KES. Nyorence is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to buy sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil to add to her stock.  

In the future, Nyorence hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Cynthia  Lucia

texts.es:
Cynthia tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Razuri, una zona de gente trabajadora que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en la provincia de Ascope en la Región de La Libertad a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la vende cerveza al por menor, en su domicilio ella ofrece cerveza en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona. El negocio  cuenta con una antigüedad de dos años,  y es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Cynthia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de cerveza ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado en los últimos meses. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 29 years old, married, and lives with her family in the District of Razuri. The hardworking people of this area are primarily devoted to agriculture. This community is situated in Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad, which is two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Cynthia sells beer on a small scale from her home. She sells her product to her neighbors and people who come to the area for work. Her business has been in operation for two years and she has plenty of support from her family. The income she generates from her business is used to maintain the daily finances for her family.

Cynthia wants to expand her business by purchasing beer since demand has increased the past few months. She is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can accomplish this goal.

loans.use: To purchase beer for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man. He is living with his wife and one school-age child. He is from Lebanon. For the past 30 years, he has  buil1 a good business reputation working as a home painter. He operates his business by taking private projects. Despite his old age, this man works tough to be able to pay his family expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase scaffolding and renew his tools. He is willing to take more painting projects in order to increase his profits. In the future, he is planning to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and renew his tools

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia S. es trabajadora registro civil de las personas en Managua, desempeña el cargo de jefa de sección tiene 10 años de laborar para esta institución, se le han financiado tres crédito los cuales los ha solicitado para la construcción de su casa poco a poco es ultimo ya la terminar de construir, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar es madre soltera trabaja para mantener a sus hijos y con los crédito le han venido ayudar mucho ya que solo así ha podido salir adelante y tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Antonia S. works in the register office in Managua.  She is head of section and has been working for the institution for 10 years.  Antonia has been granted three loans which she requested in order to gradually build her house.  This loan will be used to finish the building work.  She is a single mother and works to support her two school-age children.  The loans she has received have helped her a lot since they have enabled her to get ahead and own her own home.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone, gravel and corrugated metal sheets

loans.name: José Jair

texts.es:
Jair B. R., de 30 años tiene un almacén automotriz llamado “Almacén y taller de repuestos A.J.”  él vive con su cónyuge y su hija en la edad de 4 años en el barrio 7 de abril, al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla  y allí  desde el año 2009 funciona su microempresa, la cual ofrece servicios automotriz y se dedica a la venta de tornillos, tuercas, tensores, estriberas, cerraduras, neumáticos, manetas, caballetes, amortiguadores etc.
Jaír nació en el municipio de Soledad y cuando cumplió sus 15 años inició su vida laboral, sin haber terminado el nivel educativo de bachiller; primero fue ayudante en periferia tienda a  tienda, luego a los 18 años condujo un taxi y allí se conoció con su hoy cónyuge trabajando por 10 años,  y posteriormente inició su actual   actividad   en el año 2009, cuando  se independizó para emprender la microempresa. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará repuestos para motos, incersión  planea sea exitosa, porque comprará repuestos de mayor rotación entre sus clientes y porque el sitio donde se encuentra ubicado es un punto estratégico, en el cual no tiene competencia.   Su sueño es tener un local propio,  a nivel familiar darle a su hija todo el apoyo en su educación para que sea exitosa. Mientras tanto, Jair continua trabajando con su negocio,  aplicando financiaciones cortas y vendiendo de contado principalmente, para alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jair B. R. is 30 years old and has an auto parts store called "Almacén y Taller de Repuestos A.J."  He lives with his partner and his 4 year-old daughter in 7 de Abril neighborhood, in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla.  He has been running his small business there since 2009.  He offers automotive services and sells screws, nuts, tension belts, footplates, locks, tires, levers, kickstands, shock absorbers, etc.

Jaír was born in the town of Soledad and he started his working life when he turned 15, without finishing his high school education.  First he worked as an assistant on the outskirts of town then, when he turned 18, he started driving a taxi which is how he met his current partner.  He worked in that business for 10 years and then started his current business in 2009.  He set up his small business and started working for himself.

This is Jaír's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy motorcycle parts.  He intends his investment to be successful as he will buy the spare parts that his customers buy most often.  His business is in a strategic location where there is no competition.

Jaír's dream is to own his own premises.  As far as his family is concerned, he would like to provide his daughter with all the support she needs in her education so that she can be successful.  In the meantime, Jaír continues working in his business, using short-term loans and mainly selling his products for cash, in order to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Beatrice Wanjira

texts.en:
Beatrice Wanjira is 42 years old.  She is married to Joseph Gathongo, who contributes to the family income. She has four children. 

Beatrice has been running her retail shop for a period of about 8 years and earns an income of 9,500 Kenya shillings a month.  She also has a farm where she grows maize, cabbages and beans. 

This is Beatrice's first loan with KADET.  She wants to use it to buy detergents, soap and tea leaves for her retail shop.  She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards. She also hopes to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap and detergent for her store

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 48 years old and is married to Murungi.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jecinta hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hjos.  Nely cuenta con educación primaria.
La señora  trabaja  desde hace dos años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales, tales como bordados.
Nely solicitará un  nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1100.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar 16 kilos de lana  de diferentes colores y bayetas (tela de la región) para sus respectivos tejidos, la señora los vende en la localidad de Ilave y  trabaja sola en el negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en construcción civil .
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las ganancias del ahorro.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She is 28 years old, married and has three children.  Nely completed elementary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years.  Her first loan was in the amount of 500 new soles that she invested in her crafts, like weaving, business.

Nely will ask for a new loan in the amount of 1100 new soles to buy 16 kilos of wool in different colors and bayetas (regional fabric) for her various weavings.  She sells in Ilave and works alone since her husband works in civil construction.  

Her dream is to have more capital to improve the business.  What she likes about the communal bank is the earnings on savings.

loans.use: to buy 16 kilos of wool in different colors and bayetas (regional fabrics) for her respective weavings.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Nancy tiene 24 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia elabora mantas en lana de alpaca, ella también  realiza los diseños de aves, montañas, y todas las figuras andinas en los bordados de las diferentes mantas; La socia requiere el dinero para comprar cochinilla esta es una planta que permita la pigmentación y da colores a los telares, la socia desea también invertir en la compra de lana de alpaca. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lana de alpaca y cochinilla.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Sr. de Tayancani" [Lord of Tayancani]. She lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. 

The member Nancy is 24 years old. She lives in a committed relationship and has two children. She alternates her household activities with the purchase and sale of handicraft. The member makes blankets out of alpaca wool. She also makes designs of birds, mountains and all the Andean shapes, used to embroider the various blankets. The member needs the money to purchase cochinilla which is a plant that provides pigment for giving color to the cloth. The member also wishes to invest in the purchase of alpaca wool. The member is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of alpaca wool and cochinilla. 

The member appreciates and gives infinite thanks for the loan she has received, since this will allow her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. Thus she promises to make her payments within the stipulated time frame.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of alpaca wool and cochinilla for making red dye.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria.
La señora Lucia es socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de San José del Movimiento Manuela R., ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de chifleria (candados, linternas, cepillos, otros de uso personal)  También se dedica a la venta de leche y venta de ovinos y vacunos.  Con el préstamo solicitado comprará candados, linternas, pilas, cepillos, fósforos, detergentes, gaseosa, etc., 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtido y abastecido con diversos productos para el hogar.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the communal bank, “Santa Rosa de San Jose,” which is located in the district of Mañazo in the province and department of Puno.  She is 30, a single mother, and has 3 children.  She studied through her third year of secondary school.

Señora Lucia recently joined the communal bank, “Santa Rosa de San Jose,” which is part of the Manuela R. movement.  She needs a loan of 500 PEN, which she will invest in her business of selling miscellaneous items like padlocks, flashlights, brushes, and items for personal use.  She also sells sheep and cow’s milk.  With the requested, loan, she will buy padlocks, flashlights, batteries, brushes, matches, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked supply store with various products for the home.  What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to buy padlocks, flashlights, batteries, brushes, matches, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc is a 50-year-old married woman with a son. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phuoc and her husband have been selling a variety of goods such as sugar, milk, and beverages from the door of her home since 1995.  

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety of stock for her store, such as snack foods and basic household items. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions. She also hopes to be able to save part of the income she earns in case the family encounters any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of stock for her store.

loans.name: Asociacion Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es: Una alcancía con nuevos objetivos y nuevas metas, así se caracteriza L. alcancía comunal Asociación las Tres Estrellas integrada por 7 miembros hace más D. un año y medio. Cada integrante se identifica por L. fortaleza y el entusiasmo por salir siempre adelante una D. ellas es Anita  D. 33 años D. edad, sorprenD. con su actitud, es D. esas mujeres que te dan energía, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Una mujer  con oportunidades y habilidades distintas a las demás pero que en el correr del tiempo ha evidenciado que siempre se pueD.,  Comenzó su negocio hace diez años partiendo casi D. cero, vendiendo golosinas en una maleta, hoy en día tiene su local D. golosinas. Con L. ayuda D. su esposo, día a día trabajan  para salir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos, también se dedican a L. ventas D. calzados, con el reciente prestamos piensan  en invertir en  mas calzados y golosinas.
texts.en: The 'Asociación las Tres Estrellas' community bank is a bank with new aims and new goals.  The group has seven members and has been in existence for more than one and a half years.  Each member of the group is noted for their strength and the enthusiasm that they have to keep forging ahead in life.  One of the members is 33 year-old Anita who has a surprising attituD..  She is one of these women who give you energy.  She is married and has four children.  She is a woman who has different opportunities and abilities from other people but, over time, she has shown that she is always able.  She started her business ten years ago, starting almost from scratch, selling candies out of a suitcase.  She now owns a candy store.  With the help of her husband, she works every day in order to get ahead in life and proviD. her young children with a good education.  She also sells footwear.  She plans to invest this new loan in buying more footwear and candy.

loans.use: to invest in buying footwear and candy

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: Pedro D. 53 años y vive en el suroccidente D. L. ciudad, donD.  venD. raspado, una ralladura D. helado, a L. cual le agregan esencias D.  rosa, fresa, tamarindo o limón cubierto con leche condensada y muy apetecido en el Caribe Colombiano, por sus características D. refrescante, que consume L. gente  para apaciguar L. sed, producto D. los incesantes días soleados y D. calor permanente. Pedro diariamente sale por todas las calles D. su barrio y aledaños, pedaleando  en su carruaje, que contiene todos los insumos para preparar el delicioso “Raspao” como lo llaman,  en el momento en que el cliente lo solicite; muchas veces se ubica en colegios, esperando que los estudiantes  terminan sus jornadas y ahí casi siempre hace su gran venta, y  así, continua en su bicicoche alquilado, por muchos barrios del suroccidente D. BarranquilL., donD. ya es bien conocido desD. hace 7 años. Pedro con este negocio ha ganado el respeto D. L. comunidad, es un hombre serio  y ha logrado generar ingresos para su hogar conformado por su esposa y sus 4 hijos en las edades D. 15 a 32 años.  Para Pedro, que ya conoce su clienteL. y con elL. gana un buen dinero, ya es tiempo D. comprar su carro D. raspado para no seguir pagando arriendo, porque le sale más costoso arrendar que hacer un crédito y sacar L. cuota D. él. Esta es L. razón por L. cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer crédito que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará su medio D. producción. Esta inversión es exitosa porque le permite además D. adquirir su vehículo sin pagar arriendo,  hacer un ahorro programado e irse preparando para acceder a los programas D. vivienda con subsidio del estado y cumplir su gran sueño D. tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Pedro, 53, lives in the southwestern part of the city where he sells "raspado" (ice dessert).  He offers rose, strawberry, tamarind or lemon flavors covered with condensed milk which is very popular in the Colombian Caribbean area.  This refreshment is consumed by the locals to calm their thirst resulting from the hot sunny days.  Every day Pedro rides through the streets in his neighborhood and nearby villages to sell his delicious "Raspao", which is what it is called.  He frequently parks near schools at the end of the day and sells to the students.  Then he takes his rented bicycle cart through the southwestern neighborhoods of BarranquilL. where he is well-known after having worked there seven year.  Pedro has been able to gain respect in the community for what he does.  He is a serious man and has been able to generate income for his household comprised of his wife and four children, ages 15 to 32.  For Pedro, the time has come for him to buy his own cart so he doesn't have to rent any more, as it is more expensive.  He has decided to request his first credikiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  This will allow him to buy a vehicle and begin a savings program.  He wants to prepare for a state subsidized housing program so that one day he can have his own house.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle cart.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 29 years old and married with three children.

Jesusa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jesusa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from feed retailing, selling ready-to-wear clothes, farming sugarcane, buying and selling used clothes and  selling electronic reloads.

Jesusa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan and her husband Savon (pictured together) have been married since 1978. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chhan and her husband are rice farmers. They also supplement their livelihood with a new fish farming business. Chhan is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 61 años de edad,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene ocho hijos. 

Actualmente, Segundina vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de chicha y la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad Segundina requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. 

El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Segundina was born in Urubamba Province in the community of Racchi.  She’s 61 years old, married and has 8 children.

Currently, Segundina lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She’s a farmer, sells “chicha” [corn-based beverage] and raises small farm animals like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  On this occasion, Segundina needs the loan to buy corn.

The “Qorihuayrachina” communal bank meets monthly in the community of Racchi in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known as a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Kichuna

texts.en:
Kichuna is a single woman with no children. She lives in a family house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her personal maintenance. 

Kichuna is currently a teacher but with this loan she wants to start a charcoal selling business. She faces a major challenge of enough income to sustain her basic needs. She dreams of establishing her own business and not depend fully on her teaching job.

Kichuna is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of charcoal to start her charcoal business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to start her charcoal business.

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive por la comunidad  Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales también labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora que laboran día a día para salir en adelante.

Doña María tiene de 65 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija que es casada e independiente. Su esposo realiza trabajos de carpintería en su casa, la casa en donde viven es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio y trabajo en su juventud.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y a la cría  y venta de animales pequeños como cuyes y pollos.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hija,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para los mismos para continuar con su negocio.

Su sueño es conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Yanaturo. She lives in the community of Yanaturo in the city of Cuenca, a place where the people work in agriculture, raise animals, and also work in the city in a variety of occupations. The people of this place are friendly, courteous and hardworking, and they work each day in order to get ahead.

Maria is 65 years old, married, and has a daughter who is married and independent.   Her husband has a carpentry business in their home.  They own their own home, as a result of the sacrifices and hard work of their youth.

Maria devotes her time to doing household chores, and she also has a business raising small animals to sell such as guinea pigs and chickens.

This is the first loan that she has taken through her communal bank, which she joined at the invitation of her daughter.  She will invest the loan proceeds in the purchase of chickens and poultry feed to continue with her business.

Her dream is to be able to remain in good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Ma.chuchi

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Ma. Chuchi works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products.  

Ma. Chuchi is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Ma. Chuchi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina smokes fresh fish to sell in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Her educational background is up to the senior high school level. She wishes to increase the quantity of fish she sells, so a loan will help acquire additional fresh fish to sell. Any profits realized will be reinvested for further growth.

She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter.

loans.use: to acquire additional fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.ru:
Камо  родился в 1962 г. в  селе Тандзавер (Tandzaver), Сюникского марза. После окончания средней школы он поступил в Капанский строительный техникум. В данный момент Камо работает в Капанском лесном хозяйстве.
Камо женат и  имеет двух детей: сына и дочь. Сыну 21 год, он учится в Горисском колледже на третьем курсе юридического факультета; дочери  24 года, она окончила Капанское медицинское училище, вышла замуж и сейчас проживает в России. Жена Камо работает библиотекаршей.
